360 No Scope.name: 360 No Scope
360 No Scope.description:
Requirements You are wielding a gun.

You fire a trick shot as part of performing a daredevil maneuver, meshing the art of over the top movement with an incredible display of firearm control. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.XUBUoDl3FeAG2Uap]{Parkour} and then @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}. You can make a ranged Strike with the gun you're wielding during this movement, including when you are falling.

AbadarCorp Rep Dedication.name: AbadarCorp Rep Dedication
AbadarCorp Rep Dedication.description:
You've internalized your corporation's culture and strategies, and you're knowledgeable about general business practices. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Business or Corporate Lore.

You can use Business or Corporate Lore instead of any other skill when making a Recall Knowledge check about subjects related to your work, such as goods your company buys and sells, individuals or settlements where you do business, or industry laws.

Aberrant Shape.name: Aberrant Shape
Aberrant Shape.description: You can take the form of a terrifying aberration. When you Change Shape, you can choose one of the following: gain the effects of a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{enlarge} spell and 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.fiwhzHpbOsugCrON]{eldritch bond} spell; gain the effects of a 2nd-rank enlarge spell and 6th-rank eldritch bond spell granting three abilities; or gain the effects of a 6th-rank eldritch bond spell granting four abilities. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you shift back, whichever comes first.

Accelerated Step.name: Accelerated Step
Accelerated Step.description: You can absorb the solar and electromagnetic radiation in your surroundings, transforming it into kinetic energy that propels your body faster. Your Speeds increase by 5 feet. In addition, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.P95mzZ3VV40cXbx5]{Light Speed} action.

According to My Calculations.name: According to My Calculations
According to My Calculations.description:
You announce business projections to an ally to benefit them. Make a @Check[business-lore|dc:@self.level] or @Check[corporate-lore|dc:@self.level] check against a DC based on your level. Whether or not you're successful, the target becomes temporarily immune to According to My Calculations for 24 hours. The benefit lasts for 1 minute or until activated.

Critical Success The target gains a +2 circumstance bonus on their next skill check or attack roll.

Success The target gains a +1 circumstance bonus on their next skill check or attack roll.

Critical Failure The target takes a â€“1 penalty to their next skill check or attack roll.

Acquire Asset.name: Acquire Asset
Acquire Asset.description: You assess a foe while in the thick of battle by observing their reactions to your attack. Make a melee or ranged Strike against a creature that is not your asset. On a hit, your target becomes your asset as if you had used @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.03orjjkalSZC6Mtb]{Size Up}. On a critical hit, you can immediately attempt a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about the target.

Activate Targeting System.name: Activate Targeting System
Activate Targeting System.description: You activate the advanced targeting system you've built into your exocortex, ensuring your attacks strike true through the chaotic crossfire. The next time before the end of your turn that you, your drone, or your turret makes an attack roll, the attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll, as well as any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

Adaptable Intellect.name: Adaptable Intellect
Adaptable Intellect.description:
Requirements You have access to an infosphere, library, or similar reference collection.

What might take other minds a lifetime to master, you can temporarily absorb through a brief, intense study session. During your daily preparations, you can review literature to gain the trained proficiency rank in one skill of your choice. This proficiency lasts until you prepare again. Since this proficiency is temporary, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a skill increase or a permanent character option (like a feat).

Adaptable Limbs.name: Adaptable Limbs
Adaptable Limbs.description: You grow sturdy lower limbs that allow you to walk on land. Increase your Speed to 20 feet. Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.q65trZhn6OgdxRxN]{Adaptive Locomotion} action.

Adapted Cantrip (Starfinder).name: Adapted Cantrip (Starfinder)
Adapted Cantrip (Starfinder).description:
Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style. Choose one cantrip from a magical tradition other than your own. If you prepare spells, you can choose this spell when you prepare your cantrips, in addition to your other options. If you have a spell repertoire, replace one of your cantrips known with the chosen spell. You can cast this cantrip as a spell of your class's tradition.

If you swap or retrain this cantrip later, you can choose its replacement from the same alternate tradition or a different one.

Adaptive Adept (Starfinder).name: Adaptive Adept (Starfinder)
Adaptive Adept (Starfinder).description: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition. Choose a cantrip or 1st-rank spell from the same magical tradition as your cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You gain that spell, adding it to your spell options just like the cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You can cast this spell as a spell of your class's magical tradition. If you choose a 1st-rank spell, you don't gain access to the heightened versions of that spell, meaning you can't prepare them if you prepare spells and you can't learn them or select the spell as a signature spell if you have a spell repertoire.

Adaptive Camouflage.name: Adaptive Camouflage
Adaptive Camouflage.description:
You install a modified hologram projector into a suit of armor, giving it rudimentary cloaking capabilities. You gain the following new mod.

Adaptive Camouflage (armor): Using auto-populating holograms, you veil the target. The creature wearing the modded armor does not need cover or concealment to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.

Adaptive Defense.name: Adaptive Defense
Adaptive Defense.description:
Transfer Cost 2

You prepare your vitality network to catch some of your excess magic, allowing it to flow back and bolster your bond's defenses. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that deals damage, whether or not it successfully deals damage, you and your bonded allies gain resistance to that type of damage equal to the spell's rank (minimum 1) until the end of your next turn. If the spell deals more than one type of damage, choose one and gain resistance to that type.

Additional Spoons.name: Additional Spoons
Additional Spoons.description:
Frequency once per day

You help an ally renew their reserve of mental energy or get through an ordeal with a combination of audio clues and therapeutic exercises. Spend 10 minutes and attempt a @Check[type:diplomacy] check to reduce an ally's clumsy, enfeebled, or stupefied condition value by 1, or reduce it by 2 on a critical success. You can reduce only one condition at a time.

The DC for the Diplomacy check for this action is usually the DC of the effect that caused the condition or a level-appropriate DC based on GM discretion. Outside elements can influence this, and if a player has suffered a major traumatic event, they may require more dedicated counseling from a medical professional. A creature can only benefit from this action once every 24 hours.

Additional Warp Spell.name: Additional Warp Spell
Additional Warp Spell.description: You learn the initial warp spell of the chosen paradox.

Adopted Talents.name: Adopted Talents
Adopted Talents.description:
Requirements You have a bonded partner.

Since becoming bonded with your partner, you've learned a lot about them, and you're beginning to pick up their habits, interests, and knowledge. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.ihN8gkHSdPG9Trte]{Adopted Ancestry}, but you must select the ancestry of your bonded partner. You also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the ancestry you chose for Adopted Ancestry.

Special You must have a permanent partner bond to select this feat, meaning you can't be a mercurial dragonkin.

Advanced Atmospheric Flight.name: Advanced Atmospheric Flight
Advanced Atmospheric Flight.description: You've become more adept at using your energy wings within an atmosphere. @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.wZyBTTRM2BjC93gg]{Atmospheric Flight} no longer has a frequency and can be used as often as desired. When you use Atmospheric Flight, your wings remain manifested until you spend a single action to purposefully dismiss them.

Advanced Cross Platform Application.name: Advanced Cross Platform Application
Advanced Cross Platform Application.description: You learn the advanced magic hack of the same programming language as the magic hack you learned with Cross Platform Application.

Advanced Customization.name: Advanced Customization
Advanced Customization.description:
You've further modified your drone, granting it a new ability. You drone gains one advanced customization.

Special You can select this feat up to three times.

Advanced Deity's Domain.name: Advanced Deity's Domain
Advanced Deity's Domain.description: Dedicated study of your deity allows you to unlock further divine blessings. You gain an advanced domain spell from the domain you chose with @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.ZeTPotnUocaMmnSy]{Deity's Domain}. You can cast that spell as an epiphany spell.

Advanced Drone.name: Advanced Drone
Advanced Drone.description: You further customize your drone. It becomes an advanced companion.

Advanced General Training (Starfinder).name: Advanced General Training (Starfinder)
Advanced General Training (Starfinder).description:
Over the long course of your adventuring life, your adaptability has let you pick up numerous useful abilities. You gain a general feat of 7th level or lower. You must meet the feat's prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different feat each time.

Advanced Insectile Flight.name: Advanced Insectile Flight
Advanced Insectile Flight.description: Your wings have strengthened and no longer tire. Unfurl Wings no longer has a frequency and can be used as often as desired. When you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.YnLWZi6wGKE8DQrr]{Unfurl Wings}, your wings remain unfurled until you spend a single action to purposefully furl them back up.

Advanced Magic Hack.name: Advanced Magic Hack
Advanced Magic Hack.description: You learn the advanced magic hack of your chosen programming language.

Advanced Targeting System.name: Advanced Targeting System
Advanced Targeting System.description: You've improved your targeting system for higher accuracy. Once per 10 minutes, when you roll an attack roll that's affected by Activate Targeting System, you can choose to add the fortune trait to that roll. If you do, you roll the attack roll twice and use the higher result.

Advanced Targeting System (Starfinder).name: Advanced Targeting System (Starfinder)
Advanced Targeting System (Starfinder).description: Your ocular processors are augmented with advanced targeting systems, allowing you to more easily pinpoint your enemy and predict their movements. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh] once per day as a 1st-rank arcane innate spell.

Advantageous Assault.name: Advantageous Assault
Advantageous Assault.description: When your enemy is weakened, you press the attack. When you successfully Strike a creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} or persistent bleed condition with a melee or ranged weapon, you gain a circumstance bonus to the damage roll equal to the number of weapon damage dice of the weapon used for the Strike.

Aerial Dash.name: Aerial Dash
Aerial Dash.description: Whether by catching a current or pushing yourself beyond your limits, you fly forward incredibly fast. Fly up to three times. If you are a stormrider dragonkin, instead you Fly up to four times.

Aerial Master.name: Aerial Master
Aerial Master.description: Your ability to fly through the skies under your own power is unparalleled. Your fly Speed increases by 10 feet.

Akashic Eye.name: Akashic Eye
Akashic Eye.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

One of your eyes has developed into a conduit for the Akashic Record, the transitory plane of all knowledge. You Recall Knowledge using @Check[type:occultism|traits:action:recall-knowledge] instead of any other skill as though Occultism were applicable to perform Recall Knowledge for that creature.

Critical Success You recall accurately and gain two pieces of additional information or context.

Success You recall accurately and gain a piece of additional information or context and a piece of erroneous knowledge, but don't have any way to differentiate which is which.

Failure You gain a piece of additional information or context and a piece of erroneous information.

Critical Failure You gain two pieces of erroneous information.

Akashic Transcendence.name: Akashic Transcendence
Akashic Transcendence.description: Your third eye has opened to the greater truth of the universe, allowing you perceive and decipher the constant flow of data as time and space unfolds before you. You can use Akashic Eye once per round instead of once every 10 minutes.

Alakablam.name: Alakablam
Alakablam.description:
Requirements You are holding a weapon and your last action was to Cast a Spell from a spell gem or spell chip.

You can use the delicate remains of a consumed spell gem or spell chip as ammunition by firing it before the last of its magic fades away. You Reload a ranged weapon using the consumed item and @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.VMH34bRidGNubqYz]{Overclock Gear}. If the spell was not damaging, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 force damage and gains the arcane and magical traits. If the spell dealt damage, the Strike deals this type of damage instead (or one type of your choice if the spell could deal multiple types of damage).

All Hands on Deck.name: All Hands on Deck
All Hands on Deck.description:
Frequency once per day

You're able to focus on your coordination for a brief moment. Until the beginning of your next turn, you count one additional pair of hands as your active hands. At the beginning of your next turn, choose which set of active hands remains your active hands.

Allsix.name: Allsix
Allsix.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements You are not holding any items except in your active hands.

You put in your best effort, focusing everything you've got on the task at hand and putting allsix of your hands (three of your sets of arms) into it! The next time you roll an attack roll or skill check, roll it three times and use the highest result.

Alluring Pheromones.name: Alluring Pheromones
Alluring Pheromones.description: You can leverage your alluring pheromones to influence others, even when you lack other means of communication. You can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on creatures with whom you don't share a language, and to make simple Requests of them. This could include getting directions or getting the target to pick a specific individual out from a crowd. When you do, Make an Impression and Request lose the linguistic trait and gain the olfactory trait.

Always Ready.name: Always Ready
Always Ready.description:
Trigger You are about to roll initiative.

You're ready for anythingâ€”even an ambush. You Interact to draw a weapon. At the beginning of your first turn, @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} at a target as a free action.

Ambidextrous Shifter.name: Ambidextrous Shifter
Ambidextrous Shifter.description: You have enough practice with your natural form that you can utilize more of your limbs than usual. You have six arms, which allows you to wield and hold up to six hands' worth of weapons and equipment. If you use more than four of these arms, your land Speed becomes 5 feet. At any time, one pair of hands is designated your active hands. You can change this designation from one pair of hands to another by taking the Switch Hands action, which is a single action. You can only perform actions with your active hands. This feat allows you to use up to six arms when you use Change Shape to take a form with multiple arms, such as a kasatha or skittermander.

Ammo Infector Virus.name: Ammo Infector Virus
Ammo Infector Virus.description: You quickly program a worm into your ammo to infect tech worn by your target. Strike with a ranged weapon. If your Strike hits, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.V0nHjdYpGGit2Eyk]{Combat Hack} the creature or an item the creature is holding or wielding.

Ammunition Conservation.name: Ammunition Conservation
Ammunition Conservation.description:
Requirements You are wielding an automatic weapon.

By using direct and methodical burst fire, you can conserve your ammunition without compromising your destructive potential. Your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} only expends one usage per target in the area.

Amplify Radiance.name: Amplify Radiance
Amplify Radiance.description: You're an abundant source of electromagnetic radiation, which naturally amplifies the radiance of lights around you. Light sources in your possession (including those carried, cast on you, worn, or otherwise a part of you) are more luminousâ€”double the area illuminated by these light sources. If a light source you possess would deal damage or cause a harmful effect based on its area, the area of those additional effects are not increased by Amplify Radiance. Additionally, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to counteract checks made to counteract darkness.

Ancestral Knowledge.name: Ancestral Knowledge
Ancestral Knowledge.description:
Choose an ancestry or heritage. You learn a new language available to that ancestry or heritage. You become trained in Society. If you're already trained in Society, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice. You also become trained in the Lore skill related to that specific ancestry or heritage, such as Android Lore or Ysoki Lore.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different ancestry or heritage each time.

Ancestral Physiology.name: Ancestral Physiology
Ancestral Physiology.description:
Your time spent in another skin has allowed you to shape your own body into a weapon. You gain a feat associated with a chosen ancestry or heritage that grants an unarmed attack. You can select ancestry feats that include that feat as a prerequisite as if you were a member of that ancestry or heritage. You can use the unarmed attack only when you're transformed into a member of that ancestry.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different ancestry or feat each time.

Ancestral Weapon Familiarity.name: Ancestral Weapon Familiarity
Ancestral Weapon Familiarity.description:
You've learned how to use the traditional weapons of another ancestry. You gain the weapon familiarity feat associated with a chosen ancestry or heritage, even if you are not a member of that ancestry or heritage. You can select ancestry feats that include that feat as a prerequisite as if you were a member of that ancestry or heritage. You must meet all feats' prerequisites when chosen other than the ancestry or heritage.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different ancestry or feat each time.

Anchoring Impacts.name: Anchoring Impacts
Anchoring Impacts.description: Your suppressing attacks can pin down foes in place, preventing them from moving at more than a crawling pace. When you suppress a target with one of your attacks, increase the speed penalty to a â€“20-foot status penalty for the duration of the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} condition. If the effect that imparted the suppressed condition was a critical hit, or the target critically failed the effect and becomes suppressed, then the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Anchoring Strike.name: Anchoring Strike
Anchoring Strike.description:
Requirements Your quantum field is active.

Battle can be disorienting, but for you, the intense mental effort of striking your targets lends you additional clarity and focus. Make a Strike. The Strike gains the following success and critical success effects.

Critical Success The Strike gains the anchoring trait. You can reroll the damage dice rolled for this strike, but you must use the second result, even if it's worse.

Success The Strike gains the anchoring trait.

Android Lore (Starfinder).name: Android Lore (Starfinder)
Android Lore (Starfinder).description:
You have a keen interest in the origins of your people. You become trained in Crafting and Thievery. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Android Lore.

Angled Shot.name: Angled Shot
Angled Shot.description:
Requirements You are wielding an area (line) weapon.

By carefully angling your shot you can direct the line of your weapon to strike from an unexpected angle. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} with your weapon. You can choose one solid surface within the line's range to ricochet your shot off, continuing the line for the remainder of its distance in one direction of your choice. When determining if a target has cover from your attack, determine the target's cover from the point where you ricochet your shot from instead of you. A creature that is in the same line's attack more than once doesn't take any additional damage.

Animal Skins.name: Animal Skins
Animal Skins.description: Once per day, when you Change Shape, you can instead gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form}, heightened to half your level rounded up, for 1 minute or until you shift back, whichever comes first.

Arcane Intuition.name: Arcane Intuition
Arcane Intuition.description: You've developed a special sense that allows you to see the fundamental construction of spells and other ongoing magical effects. You immediately gain the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} arcane innate spell from your Arcane Sense without needing to Cast the Spell, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to counteract checks against spells and ongoing magic effects. If you are legendary in Arcana, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.

Arctic Bite.name: Arctic Bite
Arctic Bite.description: The freezing power of your bite becomes irresistible. The cold damage dealt by your jaws Strike increases to @Damage[2d6[untyped]] damage and ignores an amount of the target's cold resistance equal to your level. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

Area Denial Turret.name: Area Denial Turret
Area Denial Turret.description: You've built your turret so it can rain down widespread destruction, in addition to performing targeted shots. You can use 2 actions to Area Fire your turret. When you do, your turret gains the area (cone) or area (line) trait (your choice whenever you Area Fire) and its range is halved.

Armor Ace.name: Armor Ace
Armor Ace.description: You've learned through trial and painful error how to make the most out of your armor, deflecting damage from explosions and similar effects. Armor you wear gains the bulwark trait. When you're wearing armor that already has the bulwark trait, increase the modifier to Reflex saves to avoid damaging effects granted by that armor to +4, rather than +3.

Atmospheric Flight.name: Atmospheric Flight
Atmospheric Flight.description: You can manifest your energy wings while within an atmosphere for a short time. Your energy wings manifest, granting you a fly Speed equal to your land Speed plus 10 feet for 10 minutes. You can end this duration early as a single action.

Attune to Nature's Song.name: Attune to Nature's Song
Attune to Nature's Song.description:
Requirements You are outdoors in a natural, undeveloped environment.

You open your senses to your surroundings, attuning to the underlying song of your environment and syncing your own body's rhythm to its beat. For 1 minute, you ignore non-magical difficult terrain and you treat non-magical greater difficult terrain in that area as difficult terrain. If you enter a different biome than you're currently located in, or if you enter a building or other constructed structure, these benefits immediately end.

Attuned Blow.name: Attuned Blow
Attuned Blow.description:
Requirements You are unattuned.

You can use your manifestations immediately upon attuning yourself. When you take the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.JLo2gJ2s0BXUKsLQ]{Attune} action, you can make a Strike with your solar weapon or a @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.0o7v0LwOjvvNJRCw]{Solar Shot} as a free action after you become re-attuned.

Augmentation Specialist.name: Augmentation Specialist
Augmentation Specialist.description: You have the medical knowledge necessary to safely install augmentations. You can install and remove augmentations. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} using Medicine as an augmentation surgeon in a settlement that sells augmentations. You can install augmentations on yourself or other creatures using Medicine to reduce their price as detailed in the Craft downtime activity. If you are an expert in Medicine, you can install an augmentation in 10 minutes per item level of the augmentation. If you are a master in Medicine, you can install an augmentation in 1 minute per item level.

Augmented.name: Augmented
Augmented.description: You embrace scientific and technological advances, frequently integrating cutting-edge augmentations into your body. in order to improve yourself. Choose one common augmentation with an item level of 1 or less. You begin with this augmentation already installed in your body (you don't need to pay the credits to purchase this starting augmentation). Increase the maximum number of augmentations you can have installed by one.

Augmented Adaptation.name: Augmented Adaptation
Augmented Adaptation.description: You've adapted your own body to suit your needs. The total number of augmentations you can install is increased by two.

Augmented Body.name: Augmented Body
Augmented Body.description: You have acquired or developed an augmentation in your body. You install one augmentation with an item level equal to your character level or lower. This augmentation does not count against your total implant limit. The first time you take this feat, the augmentation you receive is free as long as it's item level is 1 or lower. You can upgrade this augmentation by swapping it out with another augmentation when you gain a level or by spending downtime replacing the augmentation as though changing out a feat. When you swap out the augmentation, you must pay the difference between the original and new augmentation each time you upgrade.

Auto Spellshape.name: Auto Spellshape
Auto Spellshape.description: Altering your spells doesn't take any longer than casting them normally because you've learned how to exploit magical shortcuts. You can use spellshape actions as free actions.

Auto-Loop.name: Auto-Loop
Auto-Loop.description: You've programmed automated shortcuts into your exocortex, enabling you to act faster and more frequently in the heat of battle. At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain an additional reaction you can use on that turn for a mechanic reaction.

Auto-Target.name: Auto-Target
Auto-Target.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of your drone or turret uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Thanks to the quick response time of your exocortex and top-notch motion sensors, your drone or turret can automatically target enemies based on proximity. Your drone or turret makes a ranged Strike against the triggering creature. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Avid Traveler.name: Avid Traveler
Avid Traveler.description:
You spend more time gallivanting across the galaxy than you do at home. You become trained in Society. If you would automatically become trained in Society (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.P9HCz0uR6xPHuw72]{Multilingual} skill feat.

Backup Spell.name: Backup Spell
Backup Spell.description:
Actions 1 to 3

Frequent backups prevent data loss. You regain one expended spell slot that is at least 2 ranks lower than your highest-rank spell slot and takes 1, 2, or 3 actions to cast. You then immediately cast a cached spell that can be cast using that slot. The number of actions required for Backup Spell is equal to the action cost of the spell cast. Being able to quickly program such a spell is mentally taxing, however. After Casting the Spell, you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}, and any tech gear you attempt to use is @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 3} until the end of your next turn.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, tech gear you attempt to use until the end of your next turn isn't glitching 3.

Baleful Aura.name: Baleful Aura
Baleful Aura.description: You've learned to unleash the anger and malice built up over the course of your life and restless death against multiple foes at once, creating a potent aura around yourself. You can choose to use Baleful Gaze as a 2-action activity, rather than 1. When you do, Baleful Gaze gains the divine trait, loses the visual trait, and affects each living creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], rather than a single living creature.

Baleful Gaze.name: Baleful Gaze
Baleful Gaze.description:
Frequency once per minute

You have an ominous presence that unnerves the living. You've learned to harness this sinister aura to your own advantage and can scare your foes with a focused glance. Focus your ill intent at one living creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC, or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure) and be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} as long as the frightened condition lasts. Once you've used Baleful Gaze against a creature, it's temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Barathu Lore.name: Barathu Lore
Barathu Lore.description: From your upbringing, you've learned the ways of your people while also seeking to expand your own mind in the fields of creation. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Crafting and Medicine. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Barathu Lore.

Barricade.name: Barricade
Barricade.description: You hastily create a barricade using nearby items, junk, or debris. The barricade provides lesser cover for you and one other ally, though you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} to increase this benefit to standard cover. The barricade is flimsy and falls apart at the end of your next turn. There isn't normally enough material for you to build a second barricade in the same space unless you're in a particularly cluttered area (at the GM's discretion).

Basic Insectile Flight.name: Basic Insectile Flight
Basic Insectile Flight.description: You've developed usable wings that you can extend for brief periods of time, in order to fly. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.YnLWZi6wGKE8DQrr]{Unfurl Wings} action.

Bathed in Blood.name: Bathed in Blood
Bathed in Blood.description: You've spent your life on the battlefield, and you know how to inflict vicious, bloody wounds upon your enemies. You gain a +1 status bonus to any persistent bleed damage you deal. You can spend a 1-action activity during your turn to roll a @Check[type:flat|dc:10] to remove any persistent bleed damage you have.

Battle Saint.name: Battle Saint
Battle Saint.description: You have ascended to the rank of battle saint and expect to become a true divine servant of Damoritosh upon your death. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jj5d830iUi2ZlQfs]{Blessed Boundary} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} as 7th-rank divine innate spells once per day each.

Battleblessed.name: Battleblessed
Battleblessed.description: You're an accomplished battledancer and warrior, blessed by seers, honed by ancestral tradition, and capable of feats beyond the natural abilities of your peers. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KcLVELhCUcKXxiKE]{tailwind} as a 1st-rank primal innate spell that you can cast once per day.

Big Mouth (Starfinder).name: Big Mouth (Starfinder)
Big Mouth (Starfinder).description: Your cheek pouches are especially stretchy. Instead of storing up to four items of Light Bulk in your cheek pouches, you can store up to 1 Bulk worth of items. The maximum size of a given item is unchanged.

Bioluminescence.name: Bioluminescence
Bioluminescence.description:
Your eyes glow like bioluminescent lamps, and you have learned how to focus them into a directional beam. Your eyes shed light in a 30 foot line in any direction you're looking.

You can suppress or restore this light as a free action. In addition, while this light is active you can take the Point Out action to indicate a creature within the area of your bioluminescence without making any noise, in which case it loses the auditory and manipulate traits. Finally, after you use an action to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, you can send predetermined signals with your lights to alert all allies you can see to your location as a free action.

Biometric Assessor.name: Biometric Assessor
Biometric Assessor.description:
You've uploaded a biometric and genetic database to your exocortex. You gain the following new mod.

Biometric Assessor (weapon): You modify the weapon to take a genetic sample upon contact, which you can rapidly compare to a database using your exocortex. When the modded weapon successfully deals damage to a creature, you can immediately @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Recall Knowledge]{Recall Knowledge} about the target as a free action, with a +1 circumstance bonus to the skill check. If you are untrained in the skill you would roll for this Recall Knowledge check, you roll the check as if you were trained in that skill.

Blazing Corona.name: Blazing Corona
Blazing Corona.description: Your ability to manipulate solar radiation has improved. You can manifest your wings to use Coronal Flare without any hands at any time, even if you are not in a vacuum. In addition, your Coronal Flare gains the Thrown 40 feet trait.

Blend In.name: Blend In
Blend In.description: You know how to blend in and become a forgettable face in the crowd. While in a settlement, you can use Society in place of Deception when Impersonating a non-specific individual.

Blood Sense.name: Blood Sense
Blood Sense.description: You have a keen sense of smell and are capable of detecting bloody wounds at a distance. You gain blood sense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a living creature who is not at its full Hit Points. Creatures that don't have blood, such as oozes and constructs, can't be detected with your blood sense.

Bloodletter.name: Bloodletter
Bloodletter.description: Gutting your foes has become second nature, and you can perform horrifying acts in the thick of battle. You can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.d6YF0yPxF5lU2VQ2]{Tear Wound} as a free action, rather than a single action.

Bloody Wounds.name: Bloody Wounds
Bloody Wounds.description: You're capable of targeting your mark's vital arteries, leaving bloody wounds. When you critically hit your mark, you deal persistent bleed damage to your mark equal to your number of @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} damage dice.

Bloomguard.name: Bloomguard
Bloomguard.description: After years of meritorious military service, you were chosen for the elite Bloomguard, where you underwent rigorous training that honed your defenses against the tricks of First World creatures. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Will saving throws and Will DCs against mental effects and effects created by fey, and once per day, you can roll twice and take the better on a save against a mental effect or an effect created by a fey.

Body Art.name: Body Art
Body Art.description: Your body is your canvas, and you've taken body modification to a whole new level. You gain an augmentation at no cost. The augmentation must be your level or lower. This augmentation doesn't count against the maximum number of augmentations you can implant, and each time you gain a new ancestry feat, you can upgrade this augmentation to a new augmentation of your level or lower at no cost, representing your continued exploration in body modification.

Bolstered by Battle.name: Bolstered by Battle
Bolstered by Battle.description:
Trigger You deal the killing blow to an enemy.

You find the battlefield as a second home and the threat of battle and the thrill of victory invigorating. You gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level. These temporary Hit Points last until the end of the current battle or for 1 minute, whichever is shorter.

Bond Boost.name: Bond Boost
Bond Boost.description:
Transfer Cost 4

Trigger A bonded ally within 20 feet is about to roll a saving throw.

You channel a surge of energy through your bond, shielding your ally's body and mind. Your ally gains a +2 status bonus to the triggering saving throw. If they roll a success at the saving throw against a vitality or void effect, they get a critical success instead.

Bond Spell.name: Bond Spell
Bond Spell.description:
Transfer Cost the rank of the triggering spell

Trigger A bonded ally Casts a Spell.

You pulse energy through your bond as your ally casts a spell, empowering their spell in one of the following ways.

  • If their spell deals damage or heals Hit Points and doesn't have a duration, you grant that spell a status bonus to damage or Hit Points equal to its rank.
  • If their spell has a duration of 1 minute or longer and a single target, the spell instead lasts 5 minutes.
  • If the spell has an area of burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet, or 5 feet to the length of a cone or line.
  • If the spell attempts a counteract check, add a +2 status bonus to the counteract check.

Bondbearer.name: Bondbearer
Bondbearer.description: You and your bonded partner have learned the ancient art of dragonriding. Your bonded partner can ride you if they are one size category smaller than you (Medium size, for most dragonkin), rather than needing to be two size categories smaller. When your bonded partner rides you as a mount, your synchronicity enables them to gain three actions at the start of their turn, rather than the two they normally would for riding another PC. You still gain only two actions at the start of your turn, rather than three.

Bonded Transposition.name: Bonded Transposition
Bonded Transposition.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes.

Trigger Your bonded partner is within 40 feet and would be damaged by an enemy.

Instinctively sensing your bonded partner is in danger, you swoop in to save them from harm. You and your bonded partner immediately swap places with one another, teleporting into one another's locations. The damage that would be dealt to your bonded partner is dealt to you instead.

Booming Bootloader.name: Booming Bootloader
Booming Bootloader.description:
You've programmed a custom sound to play so your summoned creature appears with unexpected fanfare. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with the summon trait, all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the creature you summoned take 1d4 sonic damage per spell rank.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, one creature of your choice within 10 feet of the creature you summoned must succeed at a Will save against your spell DC or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Borai Lore.name: Borai Lore
Borai Lore.description:
Since your resurrection, you've learned a lot about yourself, your place in the cycle of souls, and other undead. You become trained in Intimidation and Religion. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background of class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Borai Lore.

Born to Fly.name: Born to Fly
Born to Fly.description: You find flying exhilarating and live to perform impressive aerial maneuvers. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight and on Piloting checks to Drive a vehicle or starship. When you roll a critical failure on an Acrobatics check to Maneuver in Flight, you get a failure instead.

Borrow Spell.name: Borrow Spell
Borrow Spell.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You use an action which Sustains your quantum field, and the quantum field is still active.

Reaching across time and space, you can borrow a spell from a version of yourself in another reality. During this turn, you can cast one spell without spending a spell slot to do so. The spell must be in your repertoire and at least 1 rank lower than your highest-rank witchwarper spell slot.

Bottomless Pockets.name: Bottomless Pockets
Bottomless Pockets.description: Your travels have taught you to pack smart for any situation. You've got really big pockets, and you've crammed a whole lot of useful stuff into them. You can use Just the Thingâ€¦ once per hour, rather than once per day.

Boundless Energy.name: Boundless Energy
Boundless Energy.description: Your wells of energy are unending and your exuberance can't be contained. You can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.dXnb5du6mEkBRdQM]{Unleash Energy} once every hour, rather than once per day.

Brainsplain.name: Brainsplain
Brainsplain.description:
Trigger You succeed at a check to Recall Knowledge to identify a foe within range of your limited telepathy.

Upon carefully analyzing a creature, you helpfully send it a telepathic lecture regarding its physiological and psychological inadequacies. For inexplicable reasons, doing so tends to aggravate the creature rather than educate it. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|against:class] save against your class DC. If you critically succeeded at the triggering check to Recall Knowledge, the target takes a â€“1 status penalty to its Will save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success You accidentally overshare, exposing your own foibles. The creature gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its next attack roll against you, as long as that attack is made within 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round, after which it is stupefied 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Breach.name: Breach
Breach.description:
You propel yourself up like a whale breaching the surface of the ocean, then crash back down with thunderous force. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}. When you land, all opponents within 10 feet of you must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class-spell] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Special If you have the Quick Jump feat, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} when using Breach.

Bring It On!.name: Bring It On!
Bring It On!.description:
Requirements You are wielding a two-handed weapon.

You lower your guard while bracing yourself for the inevitable blows of predatory opportunists. Until the start of your next turn, you take a â€“2 circumstance penalty to AC and gain resistance to all damage equal to half your level. If you have the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.class-features.Item.sy40CowlzpsjQkKd]{armor storm} fighting style, you gain resistance equal to your level against attacks made by @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} enemies.

Broadened Assessment.name: Broadened Assessment
Broadened Assessment.description: When the going gets tough, it's important to know who you can push around. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.03orjjkalSZC6Mtb]{Size Up} an individual to make them your asset, you pay close attention to their physical capabilities, in addition to their social inclinations and mental headspace. You can leverage this information to gain an edge during a physical altercationâ€”or to avoid one! You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics, Athletics, and Stealth checks against your assets.

Broadside Charge.name: Broadside Charge
Broadside Charge.description:
Requirements You are wielding a gun and a melee weapon with the agile trait or a phase cutlass, each in a different hand.

Advancing with blade and pistol in hand, you make a ranged Strike, move up to your Speed, and make a melee Strike, each using your current multiple attack penalty and both at the same target. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.

Broken Cycle.name: Broken Cycle
Broken Cycle.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

You've developed an understanding of the greater nature of the Cycle using traditional Kasathan philosophy and can apply it to your spellcasting. The next spell you Cast this round that deals fire damage instead deals cold damage, or if the spell deals cold damage, it instead deals fire damage. Change the trait of the spell from cold or fire and vice versa as appropriate. For the next minute you gain resistance 5 to cold or fire, matching the damage of the spell you cast. This has no effect on spells that deal both fire and cold damage.

Brutal Anatomy.name: Brutal Anatomy
Brutal Anatomy.description:
You're a natural predator and have trained to use part of your body as a weapon. When you select this feat, you gain one of the following unarmed attacks of your choice: jaws, claw, or tail. Each of these attacks is in the brawling weapon group.

A claw unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing damage and has the agile, finesse, unarmed, and vesk traits.

A jaws unarmed attack deals 1d6 piercing damage and has the grapple, unarmed, and vesk traits.

A tail unarmed attack deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has the sweep, trip, unarmed, and vesk traits.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these attacks, you get its critical specialization effect.

Special You can take this feat three times. Each time you do, select a different attack from the options listed above.

Brutal Barrage.name: Brutal Barrage
Brutal Barrage.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You prepare the perfect shot, able to tear through those closest to the impact point. If your next action is to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire}, add two additional weapon damage dice to targets who are adjacent to the center point of impact, or within the first 10 feet of a cone or line effect.

Bullet Fever.name: Bullet Fever
Bullet Fever.description:
Trigger You take damage that would reduce you to 0 Hit Points.

Frequency once per hour

You fly into a frenzy with your last ounce of strength. Instead of being knocked out, you are reduced to 1 Hit Points, gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your key attribute modifier for 1 minute, increase your wounded value by 1, and enter a frenzy. You can't voluntarily end your frenzy. While in a frenzy caused by Bullet Fever:

  • You automatically apply precision damage to all targets as though you were Aiming.
  • You take a â€“2 circumstance penalty to AC.
  • You take a â€“2 circumstance penalty to Will saves.
  • You can't take actions that don't have the attack or move traits except to Reload your weapons. When Bullet Fever ends, you lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from Bullet Fever.

Bullet Hell.name: Bullet Hell
Bullet Hell.description:
Requirements You are wielding an automatic or area (cone) weapon.

You fire your weapon in sustained bursts to unleash a consistent deluge of firepower that causes terrain to become treacherous to those attempting to move through it. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack with your weapon. Until the start of your next turn, any creature that moves through the area you attacked takes @Damage[1d4[untyped]] damage of the same type as the weapon fired per square traversed, with a basic Reflex save made at the end of each move action they make through the area. On a failure, they become @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of your next turn.

Buoy.name: Buoy
Buoy.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet fails a Will saving throw.

You shout or sign encouragement to an ally in their time of need, buoying their spirits and hardening their resolve. Your ally rerolls the triggering check but must use the new result, even if it's worse. If you shout, Buoy gains the auditory trait. If you sign, Buoy gains the visual trait.

Burst Fire.name: Burst Fire
Burst Fire.description: You squeeze the trigger and release a calculated burst of fire. If you make your second Strike from @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.NJEAwGW4pN6AQGnm]{Double Tap} with the same gun, Double Tap counts as one attack when calculating your multiple attack penalty, and you apply your precision damage bonus from Aim to both Strikes.

Burst of Strength.name: Burst of Strength
Burst of Strength.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You fail or critically fail an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}.

Whether by a quippy personal catchphrase or a particularly motivating insult, your bellows rally your inner reserves of strength while startling your opponent. You can reroll the triggering check, but you must use the new result, even if it's worse.

Butterfly Effect.name: Butterfly Effect
Butterfly Effect.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger A creature critically succeeds at a saving throw against a spell you cast. The spell must be a single-target spell.

You find a reality in which you attempted the triggering spell against a different target. The new target must be within the spell's original range, within 30 feet of the spell's original target, and must not be an original target of the spell. The new target immediately attempts a save against the spell as if it were the original target.

Byzantine Linguistics.name: Byzantine Linguistics
Byzantine Linguistics.description:
You've spent hours poring over dusty tombs and ancient inscriptions, giving you practiced insight into linguistic problems. You gain access to uncommon languages that are restricted due to belonging to ancient civilizations or long-lost cultures. This does not give you access to languages that are restricted for additional reasons, such as not being decoded yet or being a secret language.

You can use Society or Delve Lore to Decipher Writing and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus on checks made to decipher text in a language that you don't know.

Call Down the Saints.name: Call Down the Saints
Call Down the Saints.description:
You have a deep reverence for the vesk battle saints and aspire to join their ranks one day. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jQdm301h6e8hIY4U]{Spiritual Guardian} as a 5th-rank divine innate spell once per day. When you do, the spiritual guardian that appears is a divine echo of one of the vesk battle saints.

At 15th level, the rank of spiritual guardian increases to 7th.

Calm Before the Storm.name: Calm Before the Storm
Calm Before the Storm.description: You maintain a calm demeanor even when facing mortal peril. At the end of your turn, reduce your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition by 2 instead of 1.

Camouvisage.name: Camouvisage
Camouvisage.description: You shift the color and texture of your skin to match your surroundings. You Change Shape, but instead of taking on the form of another creature, you blend in with your environment. As long as an observer is at least 20 feet away from you, you don't need cover from that observer to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. This lasts as long as you stay in your new form or until you move to an area with substantially different terrain.

Canny Explorer.name: Canny Explorer
Canny Explorer.description:
You're accustomed to surviving natural hazards and confrontations with aggressive predators. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal}, to Perception checks to detect environmental hazards, and to Survival checks to disable environmental hazards.

If you have another ability that allows you to do so, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on animals and to make Requests of animals.

Cantrip Expansion.name: Cantrip Expansion
Cantrip Expansion.description: Dedicated study allows you to prepare a wider range of simple spells. You can prepare two additional cantrips each day.

Careful Strike.name: Careful Strike
Careful Strike.description:
You focus on your solar weapon's trajectory so you can adjust it up to the last possible moment to turn a missed attack into a glancing blow. Make a melee Strike with your solar weapon. It gains the following failure effect.

Failure Your attack deals any damage it would have dealt on a hit, counting all damage dice as though they rolled a 1, and gains the usual benefits of your attunement when making solar weapon Strikes.

Cautious Trespasser.name: Cautious Trespasser
Cautious Trespasser.description: You grew up in a dangerous environment that taught you to be wary. You can perform the Investigate exploration activity at the same time as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Search} exploration activity.

Cellular Acceleration.name: Cellular Acceleration
Cellular Acceleration.description:
Frequency once per day

You speed up your body's metabolism and respiration by changing yourself at a cellular level. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute and can use the extra action each round only for Strike and Stride actions.

Cellular Adaptation.name: Cellular Adaptation
Cellular Adaptation.description: The malleable nature of your body dulls the impact of physical ailments. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases, poisons, and radiation. If you roll a success on a saving throw against one of these effects, you get a critical success instead.

Cellular Regeneration.name: Cellular Regeneration
Cellular Regeneration.description:
Frequency once per day

Your body can repair damaged cells and even regrow missing limbs. You gain regeneration equal to half your level for 1 minute. During this time, you can't die from damage and your dying condition can't increase to a value that would kill you, though if your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{wounded} value becomes 4 or higher, you stay @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} until your wounds are treated. Each time you regain Hit Points from regeneration, you also regrow one damaged or ruined organ (if any), and you can reattach severed body parts by spending an Interact action to hold the body part to the area it was severed from.

Center Thoughts.name: Center Thoughts
Center Thoughts.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You fail a Will saving throw against a mental effect.

You center your thoughts and focus your mind, shaking off emotional turmoil and harmful mental intrusions. Reroll the triggering saving throw and use the better result.

Centered Mind.name: Centered Mind
Centered Mind.description: You know your own mind and instinctively resist attempts to unbalance your thoughts or control your emotions. You can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.atCg0UvSl2lEXQoL]{Center Thoughts} once per hour, rather than once per day.

Cerebral Circumvention.name: Cerebral Circumvention
Cerebral Circumvention.description:
Trigger A Telepredicted creature uses an effect that requires a Reflex save or attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} you.

Requirements You have a bonus against the target using Telepredict.

By reading cues and analyzing probability outcomes, you smoothly predicting your opponent's next move. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your Reflex save or Reflex DC against the triggering action. Increase this bonus to +2 if you've dealt mental damage to the target since the last time you used Telepredict.

Change of Plans!.name: Change of Plans!
Change of Plans!.description:
Trigger The target of your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FXlhxST6fuaFt3Nh]{Get 'Em!} is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Requirements You used Get 'Em! against a creature on your last turn.

As the target you directed your allies to take down falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or is destroyed, you quickly direct them at another target. You use Get 'Em! against a new target, following all the normal targeting restrictions for Get 'Em! You don't count as leading by example against this new target.

Check it Out!.name: Check it Out!
Check it Out!.description: You've poured all your creativity into making your weapon truly eye-catching. Choose one weapon you own to decorate in your own style. While wielding your chosen weapon, add the weapon's tracking value as an item bonus to Deception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} and Intimidation checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}. You can only have one such weapon active at a time. You can spend 24 hours customizing a new weapon, at which point your connection with your previous weapon is lost.

Cheek Pouches (Starfinder).name: Cheek Pouches (Starfinder)
Cheek Pouches (Starfinder).description: Your cheeks are stretchy, and you can store up to four items of light Bulk or less in these cheek pouches. None of these items can have a dimension longer than 1 foot. As long as you have at least one item in your cheek pouches, your speech is noticeably difficult to understand. Placing an item in your cheek pouch or retrieving one is an Interact action. You can empty your mouth with a single action, causing everything you had stored in your cheek pouches to fall to the ground in your square.

Cheer Up.name: Cheer Up
Cheer Up.description: You encourage an adjacent ally to overcome their minor ailments by patting them on the back, providing them useful advice, or otherwise offering some form of comfort or inspiration. The target reduces the value of one of the following conditions of their choice by 2, or reduces the value of two of the following conditions by 1 each: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}. The target then becomes temporarily immune to Cheer Up for 1 day.

Child of the Twilight Eclipse.name: Child of the Twilight Eclipse
Child of the Twilight Eclipse.description:
You were born a beacon of light to guide your friends or a host of darkness to give them refuge. Choose to be a child of darkness or a child of light.

If you are a child of light, you give off bright light in a 10-foot radius; you can suppress this ability as a free action.

If you are a child of darkness, you can perform simple Interact actions within your reach with your shadow, such as opening an unlocked door, but your shadow can't hold items.

Add the listed spells to your spell list and spell repertoire as signature spells.

Child of Light 1st @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.ahrdUKm1HXw7EyFw] 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE] 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DyiD239dNS7RIxZE] 7th @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.xDuktpYTml9loyj5]

Child of Darkness 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a] 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c] 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sRfSBHWHdbIa0aGc] 7th @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.GNbPLs7S7RetVuPy]

Cleanse Spirit.name: Cleanse Spirit
Cleanse Spirit.description: Through your knowledge of traditional kasathan healing rituals and meditative practices, you've learned to cleanse the body and mind of the ill or troubled. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{cleanse affliction} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo]{sound body} as 4th-rank occult innate spells. You can cast each of these occult innate spells once per day.

Clever Counterspell.name: Clever Counterspell
Clever Counterspell.description: You creatively apply your prepared spells to Counterspell a much wider variety of your opponents' magic. Instead of being able to counter a foe's spell with Counterspell only if you have that same spell prepared, you can use Counterspell as long as you have the spell the foe is casting in your spell database. When you use Counterspell in this way, you must still expend a prepared spell; the prepared spell you expend must share a trait with the triggering spell other than concentrate, manipulate, or its tradition trait. The GM might allow you to instead use a spell that has an opposing trait or that otherwise logically would counter the triggering spell (such as using a cold or water spell to counter @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd] or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EfFMLVbmkBWmzoLF] to counter a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D] spell).

Clever Improviser (Starfinder).name: Clever Improviser (Starfinder)
Clever Improviser (Starfinder).description: You've learned how to handle situations when you're out of your depth. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.9jGaBxLUtevZYcZO]{Untrained Improvisation} general feat. In addition, you can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained, even if you are untrained.

Climbing Claws.name: Climbing Claws
Climbing Claws.description: You can extend your claws to aid you in climbing. You gain a climb Speed equal to your land Speed.

Clinging Bite.name: Clinging Bite
Clinging Bite.description: You have excellent control over your stomach-mouth. Your jaws unarmed attack gains the grapple trait. You have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} ability, but you can only use it following a successful critical hit with your jaws (rather than on a hit) or when you have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Cloaking Companion.name: Cloaking Companion
Cloaking Companion.description:
Your drone or turret activates a rudimentary cloaking field, making it harder for enemies to pinpoint. Your drone or turret activates its specialized camouflage device and gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{concealment} until the beginning of your next turn.

Level (+8) The concealment lasts for 1 minute.

Cloaking Field.name: Cloaking Field
Cloaking Field.description:
You install a device that deploys static, smoke, or self populating holograms to create a cloaking field. You gain the following new mod.

Cloaking Field (armor or exocortex): You customize the armor to emit a cloaking field in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]. All creatures within the cloaking field become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and those outside the area become concealed to those within. You (and your drone, if applicable) can see through the cloaking field unhindered.

Close Combat Bully.name: Close Combat Bully
Close Combat Bully.description: You are particularly adept at taking advantage of foes who get close to you, lashing out with vicious strikes anytime someone tries to act near you. At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to make a @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.rgZ9EvqnyGdafiMv]{Punitive Strike}.

Cloud Storage.name: Cloud Storage
Cloud Storage.description:
Transfer Cost 1

You can use your vitality network as an extradimensional storage space, sliding items into and out of thin air as if it were a null space chamber. You can Interact with an item that weighs 1 Bulk or less to stow it into your Cloud Storage. A creature in your bond and on the same plane can pay the transfer cost to remove an item from your Cloud Storage as an Interact action. Your Cloud Storage has a capacity of 12 Bulk. When you become expert or higher in your connection skill, it becomes 25 Bulk; 50 Bulk at master, and 75 Bulk at legendary.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.3bbBxY9CtdW0aBpE]{Effect: Cloud Storage}

Clustered Shots.name: Clustered Shots
Clustered Shots.description:
Requirements You are wielding a gun with at least three expend worth of ammunition.

You shoot a spray of bullets at a target with a display of expert marksmanship. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, then make a ranged Strike at your mark and subtract three times your weapon's expend from its magazine. Roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

Collateral Witness.name: Collateral Witness
Collateral Witness.description:
Trigger You reduce your primary target to 0 Hit Points using @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire}.

With a subtle gesture of your weapon and a stare, you remind a survivor of your onslaught that there's more where that came from. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a single creature that was in the area of your Auto-Fire with a +2 circumstance bonus. If you have legendary proficiency in Intimidation or if you have the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.class-features.Item.0gR2k1paeKXs5OsS]{action hero} fighting style and the target of Collateral Witness is the enemy closest to you, you can use this as a free action with the same trigger.

Collective Connection.name: Collective Connection
Collective Connection.description: You can tap into one of your merged minds to better focus. If your next action is to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}, roll the Recall Knowledge check twice and use the better result.

Combat Hack.name: Combat Hack
Combat Hack.description:
Requirements You are holding or wearing a hacking kit and have a free hand.

You've seen enough tech problems to know how to cause them, even during a fight. Attempt a @Check[type:computers] check to Hack an adjacent creature, hazard, or item with the tech trait. The DC is equal to the creature or hazard's Fortitude DC or the Fortitude DC of the creature holding the object. Otherwise, the GM sets the DC for the check based on the item's level. Those targets are temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 2} for 1 round.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure If the target has the glitching condition, reduce the value of its glitching condition by 1.

Combat Reflexes.name: Combat Reflexes
Combat Reflexes.description: Your extensive training has transformed you into a living weapon. At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain an additional reaction you can use on only that turn to use an operative reaction.

Combine.name: Combine
Combine.description:
You temporarily merge your body with that of an adjacent willing creature, overlaying yourself atop them to better shield them from harm. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes. You can Dismiss this effect. When you do, you emerge in a space adjacent to the target you were merged with. While combined, you and your target each take your own turns, as normal and must be targeted separately for purposes of abilities and other effects. Additionally, you and your target gain the following benefits.

  • If the target is Medium or smaller, their size increases to Large and their reach increases to 10 feet.
  • You occupy the target's space. If the target moves, you move with them, so that you always occupy their space. You can't take actions with the move trait.
  • For each Speed you possess, compare it to that of your target. If your Speed is faster, or they lack that Speed, they gain your Speed.
  • Your body shields the target from harm, granting them greater cover, though you do not gain cover. Your body doesn't obscure their vision or block line of sight.

Come Get Some!.name: Come Get Some!
Come Get Some!.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You are reduced to 0 Hit Points and dying.

You fight on to the absolute last, pushing yourself to make one last attack at a foe. Make a melee or ranged Strike with a â€“2 circumstance penalty, or make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack with the DC decreased by 2. Once you make a Strike as part of this action, you fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

Command Tactics.name: Command Tactics
Command Tactics.description: Whenever an ally selects you as the target of their attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert}, you increase the circumstance bonus they receive to their skill check by an additional +1, or an additional +2 if you have master proficiency or higher (+3 for expert, +5 for master, and +6 for legendary).

Commanding Pheromones.name: Commanding Pheromones
Commanding Pheromones.description: You can leverage your commanding pheromones to soothe ill will and take the edge off your threats, turning your attempts at coercion into acts of leadership. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} a creature, if your target would become unfriendly (and they aren't already unfriendly or hostile), they become indifferent instead.

Commercial Customization.name: Commercial Customization
Commercial Customization.description:
You've further modified your drone, granting it a new ability. You drone gains one commercial customization.

Special You can select this feat up to three times.

Communalism.name: Communalism
Communalism.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An ally within 10 feet fails a skill check requiring 3 actions or fewer.

You broadcast helpful encouragement or pertinent information to your ally's mind. Your ally rerolls the triggering skill check and takes the better result.

Competitive Spirit.name: Competitive Spirit
Competitive Spirit.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger An ally attempts a skill check with a skill that you have trained or better proficiency rank in.

You push yourself to be the best by competing with the triggering ally. Until the end of your next turn, you can attempt the same skill check to perform the same action or activity that the triggering ally performed. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to this skill check. If you achieve at least one degree of success higher than the triggering ally, this use of Competitive Spirit doesn't count toward its frequency. If you roll a critical failure on this skill check, you take a â€“1 circumstance penalty to all skill checks attempted with that skill for the next hour as you try new techniques to improve your future attempts.

Complete Transposition.name: Complete Transposition
Complete Transposition.description: When you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.dKRDmSn0TixVNxhR]{Quantum Transposition} to move your quantum field, you can teleport any number of creatures within the quantum field's original area to squares of your choice in the its new area. You also teleport any items they're wearing or holding. Your Quantum Transposition action gains the teleportation trait. Each target may attempt a Will save against your witchwarper class DC. Targets who succeed at the save are unaffected.

Compressed Casting.name: Compressed Casting
Compressed Casting.description:
Straining both your mind and your equipment, you compress as much of your spell's programming as you can, resulting in a faster compiling but much more complex code. If your next action is to cast a technomancer cantrip or a technomancer spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank technomancer spell slot you have, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.MKgHjc8DEB2XsRa8]{Double Spellshape} feat, you can apply both this jailbreak benefit and the other spellshape's original jailbreak benefit to the spell.

Concentrated Explosion.name: Concentrated Explosion
Concentrated Explosion.description:
When it comes to setting off explosions, there's only one rule: the bigger the boom, the better. You gain the following new mod.

Concentrated Explosion (grenade): You pack extra explosives into the grenade's casing. The item's area is halved (rounded down; a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] is reduced to one 5-foot square) but it deals one additional die of damage.

Concentrated Shot.name: Concentrated Shot
Concentrated Shot.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

Focusing your fire lets you pick out a target for immediate destruction. Make a ranged Strike against a target with your weapon, without using the area effect. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to damage on that Strike. This bonus increases to +6 at 11th level and +8 at 15th level. If making this Strike with an automatic weapon, you consume ammo as though you used @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} against 3 enemies.

Confident Actualization.name: Confident Actualization
Confident Actualization.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You are about to attempt a saving throw or skill check

Your utter confidence in your abilities helps you actualize your ambitions and push yourself to reach your desired goals. Roll the triggering check or save twice and use the better result.

Confounding Disquisition.name: Confounding Disquisition
Confounding Disquisition.description:
You enthrall a foe with a convoluted and utterly pointless monologue that leaves your audience dumbfounded. Attempt a @Check[type:deception|defense:will] or @Check[type:diplomacy|defense:will] check against the Will DC of a single creature within 30 feet. After the effects conclude, the target is temporarily immune to your Confounding Disquisition for 1 day.

Critical Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Success The target is stupefied 1 for 1 round.

Failure The target takes a â€“1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 round.
