@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.KEZy8RB16MleX5NY]{Effect: Confounding Disquisition}

Critical Failure The target is unaffected.

Consistent Communalism.name: Consistent Communalism
Consistent Communalism.description: You're always ready to lend your allies a helping hand and some encouraging thoughts. You can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.aUUp3y38AVVVRcbN]{Communalism} once per hour, rather than once per day.

Consistent Surge (Starfinder).name: Consistent Surge (Starfinder)
Consistent Surge (Starfinder).description: Your nanites are incredibly effective, capable of improving your body's efficiency more often. You can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.7ekJi7J2ZPURhCVM]{Nanite Surge} with a frequency of once per 10 minutes, rather than once per hour.

Constellation Vortex.name: Constellation Vortex
Constellation Vortex.description:
You will into being a copy of your solar weapon, causing it to circle around you in a vortex that leaves constellation patterns in its wake. Any creature that starts its turn adjacent to you takes an amount of damage equal to the weapon damage of your solar weapon with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC. You can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to add another weapon to the vortex, up to a maximum of 3 weapons at any time. Each added weapon increases the damage of the effect by 1. The vortex lasts for 1 round before shattering, but you can Sustain the vortex for up to 1 minute.

You can spend 1 action to shatter your vortex early. When it shatters, the vortex deals an amount of damage equal to your level with the same type as your solar weapon, plus 1 for each additional weapon in the vortex (@Damage[(@actor.level)[bludgeoning]|options:solar-weapon-damage-type]), to all adjacent creatures. Once your shatter the vortex, you cannot recreate it for [[/r 1d4+1 #rounds]] rounds.

Graviton-Attuned Increase the damage of the vortex by 2 per weapon (including the first).

Photon-Attuned Add 1 fire damage per weapon (including the first).

Level (+3) The damage from each additional weapon increases by 2.

Contemplative Lore.name: Contemplative Lore
Contemplative Lore.description:
After extensive study of historical records, legends, and myths, you have absorbed the essential teachings of contemplative society. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Arcana and Occultism. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Contemplative Lore.

Contortive Compression.name: Contortive Compression
Contortive Compression.description: Contorting your limbs as though you were transforming allows you to fit through tight spaces. You can move at full Speed while Squeezing.

Convergent Evolution.name: Convergent Evolution
Convergent Evolution.description: You sample the genetic code of creatures and people you contact and mimic them. When you take this feat, select up to three different ancestries with which you have had significant contact. You can select ancestry feats from the ancestries you chose, in addition to barathu ancestry feats. In addition, you gain one ancestry feat you qualify for of 5th level or lower, from one of the selected ancestries. You can retrain the selected feat once per day during your daily preparations.

Convert Elemental Essence.name: Convert Elemental Essence
Convert Elemental Essence.description:
Trigger An enemy targeted a bonded creature with a Strike or spell with an attack roll that has an elemental trait and the roll fails or critically fails, or you roll a critical success on a save against a foe's harmful elemental spell.

Your vitality network absorbs the essence of the attack. Your vitality network regains 2 Hit Points per rank of the triggering spell or 4 Hit Points per weapon die of the triggering Strike.

Convert Illumination.name: Convert Illumination
Convert Illumination.description:
Trigger An area within 60 feet has its light level is reduced due to magical darkness.

Understanding that the brightest light casts the darkest shadow, you draw out the last vestiges of suppressed illumination in a space cloaked in darkness to replenish your magic. Your vitality network regains Hit Points equal to the spell rank of the magical darkness if the affected area was normally dim light, and doubled if the affected area was normally bright light. Even if the magical darkness ends, the area's light level remains non-magical darkness for 1 minute; this effect removes light in the area but is not magical darkness and is automatically overcome by any form of magical light.

Convert Lifeforce.name: Convert Lifeforce
Convert Lifeforce.description: With extreme concentration, you can spend your own Hit Points to force parts of your vital essence into your vitality network for use in the future or by allies in immediate need. Your vitality network regains Hit Points equal to the amount you spend â€“ 4.

Convert Tempo.name: Convert Tempo
Convert Tempo.description:
Frequency once per minute

You dance across the battlefield knowing that the extra flourishes more than make up for the bolstering morale of your performance. You Stride at half your normal Speed. Your vitality network regains Hit Points equal to the number of feet you traverse.

Convertible Chassis.name: Convertible Chassis
Convertible Chassis.description: Your drone easily converts into additional forms. Reconfiguring your drone into a different chassis is a 1-hour activity with the concentrate and manipulate traits. When you select this feat, choose one chassis as your alternate chassis. Your drone gains the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.8yr4VNRWAvrLtzb3]{Mobile Reconfiguration} action.

Cooperative.name: Cooperative
Cooperative.description:
You work well on a team, and you're always ready to lend a hand and accept the help offered by others. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid, and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid you.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.P8WZZAiAe47my2JR]{Effect: Cooperative}

Cooperative Nature (Starfinder).name: Cooperative Nature (Starfinder)
Cooperative Nature (Starfinder).description: The short human life span lends perspective and has taught you from a young age to set aside differences and work with others to achieve greatness. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus on checks to Aid.

Cooperative Soul (Starfinder).name: Cooperative Soul (Starfinder)
Cooperative Soul (Starfinder).description: You have developed a soul-deep bond with your comrades and maintain an even greater degree of cooperation with them. If you are at least an expert in the skill you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aiding}, when you roll a failure or critical failure to Aid a skill check, you get a success instead.

Coordinated Fire.name: Coordinated Fire
Coordinated Fire.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

With a mighty bellow, you unload your weapon to give your allies the cover they need to rally. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack without a primary target. Give a verbal order as part of your firing. Every ally within 30 feet who hears and understands your order can take a reaction to follow your order to Stride, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}, or Reload.

Cornered Fury (Starfinder).name: Cornered Fury (Starfinder)
Cornered Fury (Starfinder).description: When physically outmatched, you fight with unexpected ferocity. If a foe of a larger size than you critically hits and damages you, that foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to you for 1 round.

Corona.name: Corona
Corona.description:
You unleash a corona of stellar energy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around yourself. If your attunement changes, then the effect of your corona immediately changes. You can Sustain the effect for up to 1 minute. Your corona ends if you become unattuned.

Graviton-Attuned The area of your corona is darkness that prevents light from entering the area. This acts as a darkness spell with a spell rank equal to half your level.

Photon-Attuned The area of your corona is suffused with solar light shedding bright light in the area and dim light out to double the size of the emanation. Invisible creatures within the bright light of your emanation become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, while creatures already concealed are no longer concealed.

Coronal Flare.name: Coronal Flare
Coronal Flare.description: Ambient solar energy manifests in your attacks. You gain a solar strike unarmed attack that requires a free hand to use unless you have manifested energy wings. This is an agile, finesse, unarmed attack in the flame weapon group that deals @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage.

Corporate Speak.name: Corporate Speak
Corporate Speak.description: You can share hidden messages using technical business and corporate jargon, using Business or Corporate Lore to disguise the true meaning of your words. Any allies who have traveled alongside you for at least 1 full week or are trained in the same Lore skill automatically discern your meaning. Other observers must succeed at a Perception check against your Business or Corporate Lore DC to realize you're passing a secret message, and they must critically succeed to understand the message.

Corrosive Venting.name: Corrosive Venting
Corrosive Venting.description:
You can control the strength and causticity of your internal gases as you vent them. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.ERLWteY4wPqMoGbF]{Vent Gas}, increase the area of your emanation to 10 feet. Additionally, you can choose to make the gas you vent caustic. If you do, creatures within the Vented Gas when you create it, or who begin their turn in the gas, are dealt @Damage[3d6[acid]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. On a critical failure, a creature additionally takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,acid]] damage.

At 17th level, the acid damage increases to @Damage[5d6[acid]] and the persistent acid damage increases to @Damage[2d4[persistent,acid]].

Cosmic Alignment.name: Cosmic Alignment
Cosmic Alignment.description: You understand the full breadth of the cosmic plan. You're permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. You can use your extra action only to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.JLo2gJ2s0BXUKsLQ]{Attune}, Strike with your solar weapon, or make a @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.0o7v0LwOjvvNJRCw]{Solar Shot}.

Cosmic Caster.name: Cosmic Caster
Cosmic Caster.description: You have the ability to convert ambient solar radiation and other stellar energy into pure magical light. You gain wisp ally as a 1st-rank arcane innate spell and gain floating flame and revealing light as 2nd-rank arcane innate spells. You can cast each of these spells as arcane innate spells once per day.

Cosmic Infusion.name: Cosmic Infusion
Cosmic Infusion.description:
You suffuse your attunement with additional energy. Anytime you deal fire damage or persistent fire damage as a result of being photon-attuned, you can instead choose to deal vitality damage or persistent vitality damage.

While graviton-attuned, Strikes with your solar weapon cause the target to count all squares within 10 feet as being difficult terrain instead of just adjacent squares.

Cosmic Traveler.name: Cosmic Traveler
Cosmic Traveler.description: The Drift is your true home, and you can survive within it indefinitely. While you're in the Drift, you gain the cosmic trait and you don't need to eat or drink. While you're in the Drift and a vacuum, you gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell that you have prepared.

When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to counter it. You expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to counteract the triggering spell.

Covering Fire.name: Covering Fire
Covering Fire.description:
You unleash a hail fire to cover your allies. The number of actions you spend determines how you can use this ability.

1 Make a ranged Strike against a target and select one ally within range of the same attack. If your Strike hits your target, you deal no damage, but the targeted foe becomes @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} and takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty on attacks made against your ally until the end of your next turn.

2 Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} and select an ally within the first range increment of your weapon. Your ally doesn't need to be inside the area of effect of your Area Fire. Any foes you suppress with your Area Fire take a â€“2 circumstance penalty on attacks made against your selected ally until the end of your next turn.

Covering Flare.name: Covering Flare
Covering Flare.description: You use your solar flare to cover yourself as you close in on your foes. You Stride twice; at any point during this movement, you can make a Solar Shot attack. If the attack hits, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the end of its next turn.

Creative Cover.name: Creative Cover
Creative Cover.description:
You use your knowledge of engineering alongside your surroundings to create flimsy obstacles and barriers on the fly that you can use to take cover. You Interact to create a simple barrier from surrounding materials, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} behind this barrier to gain lesser cover (rather than the standard cover usually granted by Taking Cover). This barrier does not otherwise grant lesser cover to anyone. At the end of your next turn, this simple barrier breaks down, becoming ineffective. This barrier has AC 10 and is immediately destroyed when it is dealt any damage.

If you have the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.jSzuRceUiH3yspYD]{Barricade} feat, you instead Barricade, then Take Cover behind your barricade (gaining standard cover, as usual for Taking Cover). This barrier still breaks down at the end of your next turn, but it is much sturdier as your knowledge lets your employ additional construction methods. The barrier has AC 10, Hardness equal to half your level, and Hit Points equal to twice your level.

Creature Whisperer.name: Creature Whisperer
Creature Whisperer.description: You've developed an understanding of the natural world after bonding with a wide variety of different animals. You spend 10 minutes attempting to communicate with an animal. Attempt a @Check[type:nature] check against a DC determined by the GM; this is usually the animal's Will DC, but circumstances might adjust the precise DC. On a success, you communicate basic information to the animal, such as the direction of prey or where something might be buried. On a critical failure, the creature refuses to communicate with you for 24 hours and may become hostile if it isn't already accustomed to you.

Crew Member.name: Crew Member
Crew Member.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} and rolls a failure.

You are always able to help in a pinch. Attempt a skill check or attack roll of the same type attempted by your ally and replace the result of the failed Aid with your result, even if you did not prepare to help.

Critical Care.name: Critical Care
Critical Care.description:
You attempt to pinpoint a vital part of your patient's anatomy to maximize your healing serums. You can roll a @Check[type:medicine|defense:fortitude] check to deliver a healing serum and compare it to the target's Fortitude DC, even if you target yourself or a willing creature. The target then becomes immune to this feat for 24 hours.

Critical Success You heal the maximum amount listed for the consumable.

Success You heal the target normally.

Critical Failure The ammunition and consumable are destroyed, and you provide no healing.

Critical Explosion.name: Critical Explosion
Critical Explosion.description: Your mines explode in a cloud of shrapnel that shreds through a creature's weakest points to cause lasting harm. Add your Intelligence modifier to your mines' damage. A creature that critically fails its saving throw against one of your mines is additionally dealt persistent damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. If the mine dealt physical damage, this is persistent bleed damage. Otherwise, the persistent damage is of the same type dealt by the mine.

Cross Platform Application.name: Cross Platform Application
Cross Platform Application.description: You learn the initial magic hack of a programming language other than your chosen programming language.

Crowd Control.name: Crowd Control
Crowd Control.description:
You are experienced with influencing crowds. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy on checks against crowds. The first time each round you Stride into a square containing a crowd, you can attempt a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:20] check to try to move the crowd out of your way. A GM may use a different DC under certain circumstances, such as when the crowd has a level or set DC to disperse.

Critical Success As success, and the crowd departs from all adjacent squares as you move.

Success The crowd disperses from squares you move into.

Failure The crowd doesn't move, but you can continue moving.

Critical Failure The crowd forcefully resists you and disrupts your Stride.

Crowd Surfing.name: Crowd Surfing
Crowd Surfing.description: You know how to navigate crowds without slowing down. You can move at full Speed in crowds, treat truly packed areas as difficult terrain.

Current Rider.name: Current Rider
Current Rider.description: You ride air currents, electromagnetic waves, and solar energy like a parachute. You take no damage from falling regardless of the distance you fall.

Cut 'Em Deep.name: Cut 'Em Deep
Cut 'Em Deep.description:
Your insults and threats almost always hit the mark and might not result in longstanding repercussions thanks to your canny wit. When you roll a failure on a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.

When you successfully Demoralize your asset or the target of your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FXlhxST6fuaFt3Nh]{Get 'Em!}, the target doesn't become immune to your further attempts to Demoralize them.

Cyclone.name: Cyclone
Cyclone.description:
Requirements You aren't in a vacuum.

You take inspiration from schools of hunting manta rays, creating a vortex to draw in your foe before striking. You spin in place and can attempt an @Check[athletics] check against the Fortitude DC of all creatures within 20 feet of you (or 40 feet if you and the target are in water). On a success, that creature is moved adjacent to you. On a critical success, it's also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If a creature is within melee reach of you after this check is resolved, you can Strike that creature.

Damoritosh's Claw.name: Damoritosh's Claw
Damoritosh's Claw.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements You are engaged in combat.

You pray to Damoritosh for a blessing in the heat of battleâ€”and Damoritosh answers. You regain 1 Focus Point, up to your usual maximum.

Damoritosh's Grip.name: Damoritosh's Grip
Damoritosh's Grip.description: You have become a legendary soldier on par with the saints of Damoritosh and needn't choose between the destructive power of your firearm and the honor of your personal armament. You can wield a two-handed melee weapon in one hand and a two-handed weapon with the area or automatic trait in the other hand. This does not allow you to wield two two-handed melee weapons or two two-handed guns.

Dance!.name: Dance!
Dance!.description:
You compel enemies to avoid your attacks by aiming for their feet. When you suppress a target with one of your attacks, they also become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of their turn.

In addition, when Auto-Firing in a cone that affects only a single foe, they take a â€“1 circumstance penalty to Reflex saves made against the attack.

Danger Awareness.name: Danger Awareness
Danger Awareness.description: You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to danger. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf], and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9evPzg9E6muFcoSk] creatures; to AC against attacks made by traps and hidden, undetected, and unnoticed creatures; and to saves against traps. Even if you aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching}, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be Searching. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap. If your initiative result is tied with an opponent, you always go first.

Danger Sense.name: Danger Sense
Danger Sense.description:
Trigger You are about to roll initiative.

You signal an ally, warning them of impending danger. Select one ally. You and the target roll for initiative as normal, then both use the higher result. Apply the bonus granted by @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.3AoG7FzHx903o4nO]{Saw It Coming} to both rolls if you're rolling against your asset.

Danger Zone.name: Danger Zone
Danger Zone.description: Your quantum field is extremely dangerous. Any creature that moves through the area takes @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/4)d6)[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.dangerZone]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC at the end of each move action they take through the area. You select the damage type the first time each day you use this ability: acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, piercing, slashing, or sonic. Increase the number of damage dice by one at 12th, 16th, and 20th levels.

Data Jockey.name: Data Jockey
Data Jockey.description: Like spectra, you can easily send data to other technological devices. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.BmCv54hcNK6rA4q1]{implant data} cantrip as a divine innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Databond.name: Databond
Databond.description: Through your studies, you've come to understand computer code the same way most occult spellcasters understand magical script and runes. You can speak with computers. Any creature you summon is considered part of your bond and doesn't count against the maximum number of creatures in your bond. During your daily preparations, you learn one of the following spells and can cast it as though it were a signature spell that day: @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.drvdhQ2vDoocH7f6], @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.cykzPdDC93OkC1IN], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa], or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.R9Znyb9sgD9xZISH].

Dauntless.name: Dauntless
Dauntless.description: Skittermanders rarely get discouraged, and don't understand the concept of fear. They rarely feel it, and they don't go out of their way to experience it. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against fear and a +1 circumstance bonus to your Will DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you. If you get a success on save against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead.

Dazzling Diversion.name: Dazzling Diversion
Dazzling Diversion.description: You concentrate ambient energy into a burst of light. Using the flash as cover, you use the Stealth skill to Hide, and then you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} up to twice.

Dazzling Glare.name: Dazzling Glare
Dazzling Glare.description: Through practice, you've learned how to increase the intensity of your bioluminescence. The range of your bioluminescence increases to 50 feet. Your dazzling glare misleads your foes, allowing you to use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} action against a creature within the range of your bioluminescence, rather than within melee range.

Dazzling Performance.name: Dazzling Performance
Dazzling Performance.description:
You shine even brighter on stage. When you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.O5zeo938lWGoNnb3]{Sparkling Performance}, creatures within your light's radius must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC (whichever is higher). Your allies are immune to this effect.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is dazzled for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature is dazzled for 1 minute.

Deadlift.name: Deadlift
Deadlift.description:
Requirements You are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

For 1 minute, you can carry 4 more Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered. The amount you can carry increases to 6 at expert, 8 at master, and 10 at legendary. When the benefits of this feat end, you become fatigued for 10 minutes.

Death Blossom.name: Death Blossom
Death Blossom.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with full ammunition and the area or automatic trait.

Spinning in place you fire indiscriminately to completely clear out the room. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} (even if using an automatic weapon), affecting each creature in an emanation around you with a radius equal to the range of the weapon. Creatures in the area take a â€“1 circumstance penalty to Reflex saves made against this attack, due to the cataclysmic nature of the raining fire. This action expends all the weapon's ammunition. You can't designate a primary target with this attack.

Death-Touched Caster.name: Death-Touched Caster
Death-Touched Caster.description:
You exist on the boundaries between life and death, and you can channel your own imbalanced spiritual essence into magical spells. Choose one of the following cantrips: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kcelf6IHl3L9VXXg]{Vitality Lash} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]{Void Warp}. You can cast this spell as a divine innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Special You can select this feat twice. Each time, you must select a different cantrip.

Deathly Constitution.name: Deathly Constitution
Deathly Constitution.description: Thanks to your life-altering brush with death, your living body is better protected against the weaknesses of the flesh. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against disease and poison.

Debris Zone.name: Debris Zone
Debris Zone.description: Whether covered in debris, partially flooded, or otherwise troublesome to traverse, the area of your quantum field becomes difficult terrain.

Debug Spell.name: Debug Spell
Debug Spell.description:
You can adjust the parameters of a spell to operate at maximum efficiency with minimal chances of error based on the circumstances in which it'll be cast. If your next action is to Cast a Spell that deals damage, any die you roll for damage that has a result lower than 2 becomes a result of 2 instead.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, any die you roll for damage with a result lower than 3 becomes a result of 3 instead.

Deep Diplomat.name: Deep Diplomat
Deep Diplomat.description: You've studied the history of the Deep Current Alliance, and you understand the value of turning an enemy into a friend. When you succeed on a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} against an opponent that's hostile, you critically succeed instead.

Deepspeaker.name: Deepspeaker
Deepspeaker.description: You're descended from a long line of deepspeakers, dating back to an ancestor who served as liaison for a linnorm. You've been chosen to carry on the tradition, learning secrets passed down through generations of your people. You become trained in Performance and gain the Impressive Performance skill feat.

Defensive Formation.name: Defensive Formation
Defensive Formation.description:
Requirements You're adjacent to at least two of your allies.

You instinctively understand how your allies act and move, and use that knowledge in the heat of combat to adopt a defensive formation that better shields you from harm. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saving throws. If one of these adjacent allies is your bonded partner, that bonded partner gains the same benefit that you do. This benefit lasts until you are no longer adjacent to at least two of your allies.

Defensive Gunner.name: Defensive Gunner
Defensive Gunner.description: You've learned to safely defend yourself with guns, shielding your body and deflecting blows with stock and barrel. Guns you wield gain the parry trait. If an appropriate weapon already has the parry trait, increase the circumstance bonus to AC it grants when used to parry from +1 to +2.

Defensive Programming.name: Defensive Programming
Defensive Programming.description: Your drone is programmed to protect your allies and other nearby creatures. Your drone gains the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.tZhKyMiM7q3KLHfN]{Covering Posture} action.

Defiant Liberation.name: Defiant Liberation
Defiant Liberation.description: You can leverage your instinctive magical abilities to liberate the body and mind. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EfFMLVbmkBWmzoLF]{Clear Mind} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement} as 4th-rank arcane innate spells. You can cast each of these spells as arcane innate spells once per day.

Deflect Missile.name: Deflect Missile
Deflect Missile.description:
Trigger A bomb or missile is thrown or launched within or through your firearm's range.

Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

Soldiers who fight from trenches often use bursts of automatic fire to deflect incoming bombs and missiles by shooting them out of the air. Use one expend of the weapon's ammunition. Make an attack roll against the Reflex DC of the missile or grenade attack. On a success, you deflect it, causing it to veer harmlessly off course or fail to detonate entirely.

Deflecting Fire.name: Deflecting Fire
Deflecting Fire.description:
Trigger You are the target of a ranged attack.

Requirements You're aware of the attack, are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against it, and are wielding a gun.

You attempt to deflect the oncoming projectile with a well-timed shot from your gun. Expend an amount of ammunition from your gun equal to its usage, as if you had fired the gun. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, you have deflected it. You can't deflect unusually massive ranged projectiles, such as missiles or a steel beam.

Deific Obedience.name: Deific Obedience
Deific Obedience.description: You have dedicated yourself to a deity or pantheon. As long as you follow the edicts and anathema of that deity, you gain their granted 1st-rank spell as a divine innate spell you can cast once per day. If you're a master in Religion, the spell is heightened to 3rd rank; if you're legendary, it is heightened to 4th rank. If you repeatedly break your deity's edicts or perform anathemas, you lose this ability, and it can only be regained with an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual.

Deity's Domain.name: Deity's Domain
Deity's Domain.description: You lead the life of a divine follower, understanding the intricacies of your deity's powers and channeling them through your devotion to their teachings. Choose one of your deity's domains. You gain the domain's initial domain spell as an epiphany spell.

Delete Root Access.name: Delete Root Access
Delete Root Access.description:
If your next action is to cast @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.74EAtV4JC9Cihtp7], replace its target with "one construct or tech creature." Instead of delete's normal effects, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr] by you if its level is equal to or lower than your level â€“ 3. It can attempt a Will saving throw to resist being controlled by you. If the target is already under someone else's command, the controlling creature also rolls a saving throw, and the construct uses the better result.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The construct or tech creature becomes a minion under your control. The spell gains a duration of 1 minute, but it is dismissed if you or an ally attacks the construct or tech minion.

Critical Failure As failure, but the duration is 1 hour.

Jailbreak If you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.EE07CnQmn8Xg4gkd]{Jailbreak} Spell to use this spellshape, if the construct or tech creature succeeds at its save but doesn't critically succeed, it is your minion for 1 round. If the construct fails its save, it is your minion for 10 minutes. If it critically fails, it is your minion for 24 hours.

Denial of Safety.name: Denial of Safety
Denial of Safety.description:
You manipulate the energy of a spell to mercilessly blast a wider area. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Jailbreak If you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.EE07CnQmn8Xg4gkd]{Jailbreak Spell} to use this spellshape, add an additional 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet or the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add an additional 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Deploy Bunker.name: Deploy Bunker
Deploy Bunker.description:
Retractable barriers extend from your drone or turret exocortex to create a temporary wall. You either create a 5-foot-wide metal wall in a space adjacent to your drone or turret, or you extend a wall you've already created by 5 additional feet. The walls created by your exocortex are 1 inch thick, 5 feet high, and are placed vertically on the border between squares. They must be placed on a solid, horizontal surface. The walls are a part of your exocortex, sharing the same statistics and Hit Points.

These walls automatically retract back into your exocortex if the drone or turret that created the walls moves (or is forced to move) from its location.

Dermal Spikes.name: Dermal Spikes
Dermal Spikes.description: Spiky protrusions jut from your body, which you can use to wound your attackers. Your Fortitude DC against Athletics checks to Grapple or Shove you increases by 1. Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6Fl8TlxORWQAfwsh]{Piercing Spikes} reaction.

Destructive Dash.name: Destructive Dash
Destructive Dash.description:
Requirements You are in an environment with suitable material to tear up, such as an urban environment.

You dash across the battlefield, tearing up your surroundings and toppling nearby objects as you go to make it harder for your foes to maneuver or to give chase. Stride up to your Speed. The squares that you pass through becomes difficult terrain.

A creature within reach of one of the affected squares can clean the area with an Interact action, removing any difficult terrain you created in the square.

Determined Optimist.name: Determined Optimist
Determined Optimist.description:
You refuse to give up or give in to despair, even when all seems hopeless. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against emotion and fear effects. If you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion or fear effect, you get a critical success instead.

Special You can't select this feat if you have the Heightened Paranoia feat.

Devastating Aim.name: Devastating Aim
Devastating Aim.description: Your well-placed shots inflict devastating wounds on your targets. When you Aim, increase the precision damage dice from d4s to d6s.

Devoted Defender.name: Devoted Defender
Devoted Defender.description: You've learned to protect your allies from harm in the heat of battle, rather than simply yourself. Whenever you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield} or position a weapon with the parry trait defensively to increase your AC, you can select one adjacent ally. As long as the selected ally remains adjacent to you, they gain the same circumstance bonus to AC from your shield or weapon as you do. These benefits last until the start of your next turn. If you have the Shield Block feat, during this time you can trigger Shield Block when you have your shield raised and the selected ally would take damage from a physical attack, in addition to Shield Block's usual trigger.

Digestive Outburst.name: Digestive Outburst
Digestive Outburst.description: You disgorge your stomach to attack your opponents with powerful enzymes. You gain a stomach unarmed attack that deals 1d8 acid damage damage, has the analog and unwieldy traits, and is in the corrosive weapon group.

Digestive Spray.name: Digestive Spray
Digestive Spray.description:
Frequency once per day

You force your body to produce an excess of powerful corrosive digestive enzymes that you can use to spray in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[7d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic] save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC). A creature that gets a critical failure on this Reflex save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Digital Ambassador.name: Digital Ambassador
Digital Ambassador.description: You understand the nuances of different cultures and the limitations of computer-assisted translation apps well enough to communicate as if you actually knew the language. You do not take penalties for using translation apps to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, Influence, Lie, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, or Request. If you are a master in Society, you can use translation apps for any linguistic action without any penalties.

Digital Diversion.name: Digital Diversion
Digital Diversion.description: Whether it's a sudden comm unit ping or a warning alarm on an equipment display, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} by using Computers instead of Deception on a target carrying, wearing, or wielding a tech item.

Din of Chaos.name: Din of Chaos
Din of Chaos.description: The roar of your gun and subsequent explosions rout those caught in the chaos of your attack. When you suppress a target with one of your attacks, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for the duration of the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} condition. If the effect that imparted the suppressed condition was a critical hit, or the target critically failed the effect and became suppressed, then the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Dirge for the Fallen.name: Dirge for the Fallen
Dirge for the Fallen.description: You perform a mournful dirge tinged with supernatural grief that compels the dead to rise and the wounded to heal. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO] ritual once per year as the primary caster using Performance for the primary check.

Dirty Retort.name: Dirty Retort
Dirty Retort.description:
Trigger A creature misses or critically misses you with a melee Strike.

You turn the tables on your attacker, using underhanded tactics to temporarily hinder it, such as by throwing dirt in its eyes, shining a light in its face, pulling its coat over its head, untying its shoes, or otherwise being a meddlesome nuisance. The triggering creature becomes your choice of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the beginning of its next turn.

Disarming Shot.name: Disarming Shot
Disarming Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You attempt to disarm your foe with a well-aimed shot. You Aim, then make a ranged Strike at your mark. If the Strike hits, select a weapon your target is wielding or an item your target is holding. The target takes a -2 circumstance penalty to attacks with the item, or other checks requiring a firm grasp on the item, as long as the creature holds the item or until the creature Interacts to change its grip on the item. On a critical success, you knock the selected weapon or item out of the target's grasp.

Disciple of the Cycle.name: Disciple of the Cycle
Disciple of the Cycle.description: While it pales in comparison to the powers of a true solarian, you're a devoted disciple of the Cycle and can temporarily manifest control over the powers of the cosmos. You gain @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.41eiakxOYO96avgr]{flashfire} and @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.NtlvrkW23KGGwjp6]{gravity tether} as 3rd-rank occult innate spells. You can cast each of these occult innate spells once per day.

Dishonored Contrarian.name: Dishonored Contrarian
Dishonored Contrarian.description: When the going gets tough, the tough fight tooth and nail to build a better lifeâ€”literally. Your fellow vlakas might carry hope, dreams, and unending optimism in their hearts, but you've always found it harder to look on the bright side, and you've done some dubious things to get by. Whether you've lied, cheated, stolen, or taken some lives, you know that you did what it took to survive and thrive in a cold and callous galaxy. You become trained in one of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Intimidation, or Thievery. If you select Deception, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.HEBXaS656MZTiWFu]{Lengthy Diversion} skill feat. If you select Intimidation, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.gUqvezs2zzoTXFAI]{Group Coercion} skill feat. If you select Thievery, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.hVZbnsDuXihggylt]{Subtle Theft} skill feat.

Disperse!.name: Disperse!
Disperse!.description:
When you're fully decked out in your Hellknight regalia, just the presence of your fearsome visage drives enemies back. Attempt an @Check[intimidation] check against an enemy within 30 feet who can perceive you.

Critical Success You push your target up to 10 feet away from you. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.

Success You push your target back 5 feet. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.

Distant Feint.name: Distant Feint
Distant Feint.description: You're an incredible actor, and you can use your over-the-top boasts and bombastic gestures to throw a foe off their game just as easily as you can from close range with a brandished weaponâ€”if you've got the required firepower. If you are wielding a ranged weapon, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} against an opponent at a range of 15 feet, rather than just within melee reach. If you succeed, the opponent is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against your melee and ranged attacks, rather than only your melee attacks. If you do, you Feint gains the mental trait.

Distant Telepath.name: Distant Telepath
Distant Telepath.description:
Whether through training or innate talent, you've expanded the range at which you can telepathically communicate. Increase the range of your limited telepathy by 15 feet.

Special You can select this feat more than once.

Dive for Cover.name: Dive for Cover
Dive for Cover.description: When threatened, you can quickly take a dive and find somewhere to hunker down. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, land @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} to hunker down and gain greater cover against ranged attacks, even if you don't have an object to get behind.

Diverse Schemes.name: Diverse Schemes
Diverse Schemes.description: You're an efficient multitasker and always have more than one goal in mind or scheme ready to go. You can maintain two assets at once.

Divine Fighting Technique.name: Divine Fighting Technique
Divine Fighting Technique.description: Your deity seemingly manifests itself in your fighting style. Your proficiency with your deity's favored weapon increases to expert. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using your deity's favored weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect; you can use your spell DC in place of your class DC for this effect.

Divine Weapon Training.name: Divine Weapon Training
Divine Weapon Training.description: You gain access to your deity's favored weapon and become trained in that weapon. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency with a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency for this weapon.

Do It Now!.name: Do It Now!
Do It Now!.description:
Requirements You issued an envoy directive since the start of your turn.

You motivate an ally, possibly with some choice gestures or words, to follow your directive immediately. Choose one ally within 60 feet. As a free action, that ally can immediately take any single action that would satisfy the conditions of one of your active envoy directives. The ally then becomes immune to this ability for the next minute.

Do You Know Who I Work For?.name: Do You Know Who I Work For?
Do You Know Who I Work For?.description: Throwing your corporation's name around adds weight to your threats. When you use Intimidation to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a target who knows about your corporation, a success becomes a critical success.

Don't Touch That!.name: Don't Touch That!
Don't Touch That!.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An ally you can observe triggers a trap.

You give a sharp, panicked reprimand to an unobservant ally. This feat gains the visual or auditory trait, whichever is appropriate for your warning. Attempt a Delve Lore check against the hazard's stealth DC.

Critical Success Your warning comes just in time. You prevent the trap from being triggered, or you delay the activation until the start or end of your next turn (your choice).

Success Your ally gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against the trap's next attack, or to their next saving throw against the trap's effects.

Critical Failure Your sharp warning only startles your ally, leaving them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the trap's next attack.

Don't You Die on Me!.name: Don't You Die on Me!
Don't You Die on Me!.description: You encourage your ally to hang on and keep moving, despite life-threatening wounds or other serious injuries that might take them out of the battle. Select an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} ally. Reduce the target's dying value by 1. If this would reduce their dying value to 0, they lose the dying condition, don't increase their wounded condition, and remain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. The targeted ally then becomes temporarily immune to Don't You Die on Me! for 1 hour.

Double Deployment.name: Double Deployment
Double Deployment.description: You've programmed your exocortex to deploy mines together to create a choke point. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ccVcznj9KVYHLVaY]{Deploy Mine} twice. Both mines must be within 30 feet of one another.

Double Detonation.name: Double Detonation
Double Detonation.description:
Frequency once per round

You unleash a flurry of synchronized explosions by activating two of your mines at once. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.S3iCDy8ppR8eXp8V]{Detonate Mine} twice. If a creature is in the area of both of these detonations, combine the damage for the purposes of calculating that creature's resistances and weaknesses.

Double Draw.name: Double Draw
Double Draw.description: You Interact to draw, stow, or swap items you have up to twice.

Double Jailbreak.name: Double Jailbreak
Double Jailbreak.description:
The rules of magic are mere suggestions for you. If your next action is to Jailbreak Spell, replace all jailbreak benefits of that spellshape with the following.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, you can also apply another technomancer spellshape you know and its jailbreak benefits to the effects of the spell.

Double Spellshape.name: Double Spellshape
Double Spellshape.description:
By jailbreaking the protections on a spellshape, you can apply it to a spell already modified by another spellshape. If your next action is to Jailbreak Spell, replace all jailbreak benefits of that spellshape with the following:

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, you can also apply another technomancer spellshape you know to the effects of the spell, but you do not gain that spellshape's jailbreak benefit.

Double Tap.name: Double Tap
Double Tap.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You fire two shots at the same target in quick succession. You Aim, then make two Strikes against your mark. Apply the multiple attack penalty normally. If both attacks hit, combine their damage. You add any precision damage only once, to the attack of your choice. Apply the target's resistances and weaknesses only once.

Down to the Wire.name: Down to the Wire
Down to the Wire.description:
Trigger You complete the last action on your turn, your turn has not ended yet, and you issued an envoy directive this turn but you haven't led by example for that directive yet.

You act quickly to show your teammates exactly how it's done. Use a single action that would satisfy the conditions to lead by example for one of your envoy directives. If you use this action to attack, the attack uses your multiple attack penalty, as normal.

Draconic Lethality.name: Draconic Lethality
Draconic Lethality.description:
Your draconic body is a weapon. When you select this feat, you gain one of the following unarmed attacks of your choice: claw, horn, jaws, or tail. Each of these attacks is in the brawling weapon group and has the listed damage die and traits.

  • Claw 1d6 slashing (agile, finesse, unarmed)
  • Horn 1d6 piercing (finesse, unarmed)
  • Jaws 1d6 piercing (grapple, unarmed)
  • Tail 1d6 bludgeoning (sweep, trip, unarmed)

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these attacks, you get its critical specialization effect.

Special You can take this feat four times. Each time you do, select a different attack from the options listed above.

Draconic Senses.name: Draconic Senses
Draconic Senses.description: You have an impressive sense of smell, passed down through the generations from a dragon ancestor. You gain imprecise scent with a range of 40 feet. The GM might double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind, at their discretion.

Dragonkin Breath.name: Dragonkin Breath
Dragonkin Breath.description:
Your exhalations are infused with energy, like your dragon ancestors of old. You can exhale a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[@actor.flags.pf2e.dragonkinBreath.damageType]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic] save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC). After using this attack, you can't use it again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge it]]{1d4 rounds}. At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, the damage increases by 1d4.

Special When you select this feat, choose your breath's damage type and weapon group: acid (corrosive), bludgeoning (hammer), cold (cryo), electricity (shock), fire (flame), piercing (spear), slashing (knife), or sonic (sonic). This choice is permanent. This ability has the trait associated with the type of damage it deals.

Dragonkin Lore.name: Dragonkin Lore
Dragonkin Lore.description:
You're trained in skills passed down through generations of dragonkin. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Athletics and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Dragonkin Lore.

Dragonkin Weapon Familiarity.name: Dragonkin Weapon Familiarity
Dragonkin Weapon Familiarity.description:
You wield weapons favored by the Skyfire Legion. You are trained with the skyfire sword, flamethrower, and machine gun. In addition, you gain access to all uncommon weapons with the dragonkin trait. For the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these weapons, you get its critical specialization effect.

Dragonâ€™s Tenacity.name: Dragonâ€™s Tenacity
Dragonâ€™s Tenacity.description: Your mind and body have the resilience of your dragon progenitors. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against fear effects, sleep effects, and effects that would cause you to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. This bonus increases to +2 against spells and magic items that have these effects.

Drift Hop.name: Drift Hop
Drift Hop.description:
Frequency once per day

You travel across the battlefield via the Drift. You teleport up to a distance equal to your Speed within your line of sight. If you're in the Drift, the distance you can teleport is doubled.

Drift Slip.name: Drift Slip
Drift Slip.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger An enemy's Strike would hit you and you weren't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to that enemy.

You momentarily slip into the Drift, becoming concealed against the triggering Strike. If the flat check for concealment fails, the Strike misses you. After resolving the triggering Strike, you reemerge from the Drift in an adjacent, unoccupied space.

Drift Strike.name: Drift Strike
Drift Strike.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Requirements Your last action was a successful critical hit melee Strike against a creature.

You launch the triggering creature into the Drift to reposition it across the battlefield. The creature is teleported to a location of your choice up to a distance of 20 feet from its starting location and within your line of sight. If you're in the Drift, the distance you can teleport the target is doubled. The creature must be able to fit in its new location, and its new location must be unoccupied. The creature can attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The distance you can teleport the target is halved, and the target can't be moved to a location that's hazardous or would result in a fall.

Failure You teleport the target the noted distance.

Critical Failure The distance you can teleport the target is doubled.

Drift-Touched.name: Drift-Touched
Drift-Touched.description:
Frequency once per day

You were born in the Drift and now, even after leaving, the plane is always a part of you. With a thought, you seize a fragment of the Drift and temporarily transplant it onto the battlefield as an intangible barrier of colorful light. This shimmering field appears within 30 feet and is straight and vertical, stretching up to 10 feet long and 10 feet high. The barrier grants concealment to creatures targeted through it, and it sheds colorful bright light for 10 feet on each side and dim light for the next 10 feet. You can ignore any concealment granted by the barrier. The barrier lasts for 5 rounds. At 13th level, the barrier instead grants standard cover.

Dual Aim.name: Dual Aim
Dual Aim.description:
Your sharpshooter skills improve. You can have two marks at a time instead of one. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, you can select two marks, rather than one.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.P0yY6bmmv3n1UX20]{Effect: Dual Aim}

Dual Bond.name: Dual Bond
Dual Bond.description: While some claim you're incapable of forming a partner bond as deep as other dragonkin can, it's undeniable that you have more flexibility and freedom when it comes to bonding. You can maintain any number of partner bonds at once. Your bonded partners don't automatically count as being bonded with one another.

Eager Assistant.name: Eager Assistant
Eager Assistant.description: You love helping your friends and allies achieve their goals. At the start of your turn, you gain one additional reaction, which you can use only to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid}.

Eager Combatant.name: Eager Combatant
Eager Combatant.description:
Trigger You roll Athletics or Intimidation for initiative.

You eagerly stride into battle, giving no thought to the consequences. You Stride in a straight line directly toward an enemy.

Ebb & Flow.name: Ebb & Flow
Ebb & Flow.description: With careful focus, you guarantee that vital energy lost from a target is caught by your vitality network. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that deals void damage to a single target and the target loses Hit Points from the spell, your vitality network gains Hit Points equal to twice the spell's rank. If your next action is to Strike with a weapon that deals void damage, your vitality network gains 2 Hit Points per weapon damage die.

Eclipse Strike.name: Eclipse Strike
Eclipse Strike.description:
Your attacks create a brilliant eclipse, making you harder to hit through foes. Make a melee Strike with your solar weapon or use Solar Shot. On a hit, you create an impressive display of solar energy between you and your foe. Creatures attempting to target you through your struck target increase the level of cover you receive by one level: lesser cover becomes standard cover, or standard cover becomes greater cover in the case of larger creatures. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

Graviton-Attuned Until the start of your next turn, whenever you wouldn't have any cover against an attack, you gain the benefits of lesser cover against that attack.

Photon-Attuned If a creature's attack would have cover from the creature you struck, that creature takes a â€“1 circumstance penalty to its attack. This lasts until the start of your next turn.

Eldritch Bond.name: Eldritch Bond
Eldritch Bond.description: You channel power from beyond this reality or from the most esoteric regions of the multiverse, granting creatures in your bond the power to reform their bodies into powerful, aberrant shapes. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.fiwhzHpbOsugCrON] epiphany spell.

Electrical Engineer.name: Electrical Engineer
Electrical Engineer.description: You can fuel battery-powered devices by drawing electricity from different sources. This takes 1 minute of work and an adjacent source of power appropriate to the device. If the source of power is a technological creature or hazard, it must have been destroyed within the last 10 minutes and provides charges equal to twice its level. If the source is a facility capable of charging a battery, it operates as if the battery were always fully charged. If you are a master in Crafting, you can connect a device to a power source as a 3-action activity. If you're legendary, it takes 1 action.

Electrical Shielding.name: Electrical Shielding
Electrical Shielding.description: Your body is insulated from electrical attacks. You gain electricity resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ErXde8sIMDsCVPrJ]{Redirect Current} reaction.

Electromagnetic Mastery.name: Electromagnetic Mastery
Electromagnetic Mastery.description: You have learned how to hone your whiskers to their maximum potential. Your electromagnetic sense becomes a precise sense with a range of 15 feet.

Electromagnetic Whiskers.name: Electromagnetic Whiskers
Electromagnetic Whiskers.description: You have honed your whiskers' sensitivity to the degree that you can sense the movement of the weak electric fields emitted by potential enemies. You gain electromagnetic sense as an imprecise sense out to 15 feet. Electromagnetic sense allows you to detect nearby living and technological creatures, but you may have to use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find an undetected creature in an environment with too much electromagnetic radiation, such as inside the engine room of a spaceship or near a powerful source of radio waves.

Elite Drone.name: Elite Drone
Elite Drone.description: You personalize your drone, creating a marvel of technology that's also an exquisite work of art. Your drone becomes a specialized companion.

Elusive Target.name: Elusive Target
Elusive Target.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting you fails or critically fails.

You move out of the way, eluding your attackers. You Step.

Embrace the Magic.name: Embrace the Magic
Embrace the Magic.description:
You understand that the galaxy is a wondrous place full of arcane mysteries and strange phenomena. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

In addition, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks to Identify Magic.

Emotional Maestro.name: Emotional Maestro
Emotional Maestro.description: Your ability to detect the emotions of others is unparalleled. Your emotion sense becomes a precise sense with a range of 120 feet.

Emotionless (Starfinder).name: Emotionless (Starfinder)
Emotionless (Starfinder).description: Your inhibited or malfunctioning emotional processors make it difficult for you to feel strong emotions. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against emotion effects. If you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead.

Empowered Nimbus.name: Empowered Nimbus
Empowered Nimbus.description:
You've mastered using your nimbus to diffuse incoming damage. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.fy5RQYfWhum3Bz9H]{Nimbus Surge}, you gain resistance equal to half your level (rounded up). The type of resistance depends on your current attunement.

Graviton-Attuned Your resistance applies to physical damage (bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing).

Photon-Attuned Your resistance applies to the following types of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic.

Encode Presence.name: Encode Presence
Encode Presence.description:
Frequency once per hour

You instinctively encode your presence, obscuring your identity and scrambling your visual appearance to technological visual sensors. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to all technological visual sensors, such as security cameras, ocular cybernetic augmentations, and the visual processors of technological constructs, for 1 minute. As the nature of this effect still leaves your location obvious, you can't use this concealment to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.

Encyclopedic Recall.name: Encyclopedic Recall
Encyclopedic Recall.description:
Frequency once per round

You swiftly calculate and cross-reference several subjects at once. You instantly use up to three Recall Knowledge actions. If you have any special abilities or free actions that would normally be triggered when you Recall Knowledge, you can't use them for these actions. At 13th level, you can instead use up to four Recall Knowledge actions. At 17th level, you can instead use up to five Recall Knowledge actions.

Endlessly Adaptive.name: Endlessly Adaptive
Endlessly Adaptive.description: Your varied life experiences allow you to adapt to nearly any situation. When you gain skill feats using @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.class-features.Item.0HtLXgFUqD0wYzRl], you gain two additional skill feats. In addition, you can adapt to the day's challenges by spending 1 hour to plan. If you do, you can reselect the feats chosen with adaptive talent as if you had made your daily preparations. You can't trade out feats with limited-use abilities that you've already used that day.

Enduring Echolocation.name: Enduring Echolocation
Enduring Echolocation.description: You perceive your surroundings as much by echolocation as by your other senses. Your echolocation becomes a precise sense to a range of 60 feet (or 120 feet underwater), in addition to the imprecise sense out to 120 feet (or 240 feet underwater).

Enduring Exocortex.name: Enduring Exocortex
Enduring Exocortex.description: Painstaking contingency plans and a reliable backup power source allow your exocortex to continue processing data and following your programming even when you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]. When you have 0 Hit Points or are otherwise unable to act, your exocortex remains functional and can take 3 actions per round on your turn. Your enduring exocortex can act while you're dying or unconscious, but it ceases to function if you are dead.

Energy Consumption.name: Energy Consumption
Energy Consumption.description:
Your body has adapted over to consume the excess energy it uses to shield itself, allowing it to neutralize other forms of energy that could harm it. When you use your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.hvWJRc0dGF3ivrb6]{Energy Deflection} reaction, if the attack was a failure or critical failure, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level; you also gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.lmowZWTzJaZfM3bb]{Energy Shielding} feat (selecting a different type of energy). These temporary Hit Points and the Energy Shielding feat last 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.g1J6DOxBQkacvbyE]{Effect: Energy Consumption}

Energy Deflection.name: Energy Deflection
Energy Deflection.description:
Trigger You are the target of a ranged attack that would deal at least one type of damage you selected with Energy Shielding.

Requirements You're aware of the attack and are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against it.

You leverage the magical energy clinging to your body to counter similar harmful attacks. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Energy Explusion.name: Energy Explusion
Energy Explusion.description:
Requirements Your turret's array deals energy damage.

You've customized your turret to fire explosive blasts. Make a ranged Strike with your turret. On a hit, additional energy from this shot is expelled around your turret, dealing damage to creatures in your choice of a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around your turret or a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] from your turret. All creatures in the area take damage equal to your turret's ranged Strike, with a @Check[reflex|against:mechanic|basic] save against your mechanic class DC.

Energy Shielding.name: Energy Shielding
Energy Shielding.description:
While traversing the Diaspora, you've witnessed countless magical anomalies and survived to tell the tale. This persistent exposure to magical energy has rubbed off on you, leaving traces of magic behind that shield your body from harmful energy. Select one of the following types of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You gain resistance 5 to that damage type.

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do, select a different energy type.

Enhanced Echolocation.name: Enhanced Echolocation
Enhanced Echolocation.description: You've learned to quiet your other senses and focus your attention on your echolocation. The range of your echolocation imprecise sense doubles to 60 feet (or 120 feet underwater), and you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.0vqXr3SYakIa19k3]{Focus Senses} action.

Enlarge Quantum Field.name: Enlarge Quantum Field
Enlarge Quantum Field.description: Your quantum field slowly encroaches on reality. Increase your quantum field's radius by 10 feet. Until your quantum field deactivates, once per turn when you Sustain the quantum field, increase its radius by an additional 5 feet (to a maximum of 50 additional feet).

Enlightenment.name: Enlightenment
Enlightenment.description: You understand the true nature of your connection and how it stretches across the vast pillars of reality. Your vitality network has a maximum capacity of 200 Hit Points and regains 20 Hit Points at the start of each turn instead of 8. You can bond with any number of willing bonded creatures.

Esoteric Education.name: Esoteric Education
Esoteric Education.description:
For all their practicality, broader fields of study don't capture your imagination when there are more specialized disciplines you might explore. Choose two Lore skill subcategories. You gain the Additional Lore general feat for both skills.

Special You can take this feat three times. Each time you do, you gain the Additional Lore general feat for a new subcategory of Lore, and you become trained in one other Lore skill subcategory of your choice.

Etheric.name: Etheric
Etheric.description: You became a borai through a botched resurrection attempt, perhaps a magic spell disrupted, a religious rite gone awry, or faulty technology. Your soul is loosely tethered to your body, allowing you to temporarily shield your living form from the ravages of the void. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ZQO1CekVjlCGYTs4]{Soul Shield} reaction.

Excavating Bombardment.name: Excavating Bombardment
Excavating Bombardment.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You can use the explosive power of your weapons to create trenches. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack. You turn any number of contiguous squares within the area of your attack into a trench that can provide cover for a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creature. The gradual incline of this crude trench can be traversed without climbing, treating the square as difficult terrain.

The exact terrain that can be affected by this ability is at the GM's discretion, but should include most types of solid terrain or any locations that could conceivably be adjusted by weapon fire.

Expanded Senses.name: Expanded Senses
Expanded Senses.description:
You know that when it comes to surviving a dangerous situation, every moment counts. To that end, you've trained long and hard to improve your natural senses, pushing them to the limits of their ability. Select an imprecise sense you have, such as hearing or scent. The range of the selected imprecise sense increases to 120 feet.

Special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you do, select a different imprecise sense you possess.

Expanded Solar Reserves.name: Expanded Solar Reserves
Expanded Solar Reserves.description: Your starburst markings can store much greater reserves of solar energy, enabling you to heal yourself more frequently. The frequency of Siphon Solar Vitality increases to once per hour, rather than once per day.

Expansive Array.name: Expansive Array
Expansive Array.description:
You design additional custom arrays for your turret. Select two of the following arrays. Add the selected arrays to your list of available arrays.

  • 2d8 mental damage, range increment 60 feet, tech trait, mental weapon group
  • 2d8 poison damage, range increment 60 feet, tech trait, dart weapon group
  • 2d8 vitality damage, range increment 60 feet, tech trait, laser weapon group
  • 2d8 void damage, range increment 60 feet, tech trait, void weapon group

Special You can take this feat a second time. When you do, you must select different arrays.

Expansive Verse.name: Expansive Verse
Expansive Verse.description: Your songs become more complex and tinged with greater magic. Each day during your daily preparations, you can choose one common 2nd-rank spell from the occult spell list. You can cast this spell as an occult innate spell once before your next daily preparations.

Experienced Smuggler (Starfinder).name: Experienced Smuggler (Starfinder)
Experienced Smuggler (Starfinder).description:
You often smuggle things past the authorities. When the GM rolls your Stealth check to see if a passive observer notices a small item you've @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, the GM uses the number rolled or 10â€”whichever is higherâ€”as the result of your die roll, adding it to your Stealth modifier to determine your Stealth check result. If you're a master in Stealth, the GM uses the number rolled or 15, and if you're legendary in Stealth, you automatically succeed at hiding a small concealed item from passive observers. This provides no benefits when a creature attempts a Perception check while actively searching you for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} items.

Additionally, you can break down or assemble a weapon with the breakdown trait in 1 action.

Explosive Deflection.name: Explosive Deflection
Explosive Deflection.description: Grenades are volatile but you've learned to trigger them mid-air. You can trigger @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.xtjGns4zvJmDZZ1J]{Deflecting Fire} when you would be in the area of a grenade detonation. Determine if you succeed at your save before anyone else in the area. If you successfully save against a grenade using Deflecting Fire, you trigger the grenade midair, causing it to explode before it reaches you. Select a space of your choice directly between you and the attacker. The deflected grenade explodes in the selected space and you do not need to save again if you are in the new space.

Explosive Shot.name: Explosive Shot
Explosive Shot.description:
You've designed a nozzle that can be fitted onto single-target weapons, splitting the weapon's fire into dangerous new shapes. You gain the following new mod.

Explosive Shot (non-area weapon): The modded item deals 1 splash damage per weapon damage dice. This splash damage is the same damage type the modded item deals.

Explosive Surprise.name: Explosive Surprise
Explosive Surprise.description: You have mastered the infamous ysoki martial art of spitting a live grenade from your mouth. It takes 10 minutes to safely prepare a grenade and store it in your cheek pouch. As a single action, you can draw and throw this specially prepared grenade using your mouth. You don't need a free hand to do so.

Express Driver (Starfinder).name: Express Driver (Starfinder)
Express Driver (Starfinder).description:
You can optimize your vehicle's performance, coaxing extra speed and choosing paths to avoid slowdowns. When calculating your travel Speed for the day while Piloting a vehicle, you can attempt a @Check[type:piloting] check to increase your vehicle's travel Speed for long-term overland or aerial travel. The DC is determined by the GM but is typically based on the vehicle's piloting DC or a difficulty based on the environment, whichever is harder. On a success, increase your vehicle's travel Speed by half. This has no effect on your vehicle's movement in encounters.

This has no effect on starships travelling through the Drift.

Extend Directive.name: Extend Directive
Extend Directive.description:
Trigger Your turn begins, and you issued at least one envoy directive on your last turn.

With exceptional flair, you can repeat your orders with a single word or gesture. You immediately issue any one envoy directive that you issued on your previous turn. This does not extend any ongoing lead by example benefits.

Extended Vitality.name: Extended Vitality
Extended Vitality.description: You can feel and reach out to your bonded allies regardless of range. You can @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.y9tYChycW6xcdT7J]{Transfer Vitality} with any bonded ally as long as they are on the same planet as you.

Extreme Accuracy.name: Extreme Accuracy
Extreme Accuracy.description: When you Aim, the benefits apply if your mark is within range up to your weapon's fourth range increment. Additionally, you ignore the penalty for attacking your mark at up to four range increments away.

Fabricator.name: Fabricator
Fabricator.description:
You know how to configure and print items out of UPBs in creator capsules.
