You use technology to more efficiently and quickly produce technological item that you might need by employing effective 3D-printing tools. You must have the formula to create an item in a creator capsule and pay an amount of UPBs equal to the material price of the item. You Craft the item using a Computers check instead of a Crafting check, multiplying the result of the appropriate Computers or Crafting check by the rank of the crafting capsule (for example, a tactical creator capsule multiplies the result by 2).

Unlike normal Crafting, this process takes 1 hour instead of 4 days, but on a critical failure you ruin 50% of the raw materials used so far, instead of 10%. When you select this feat, you gain formulas for four common tech items of 2nd level of lower.

You cannot use this ability to create magical equipment unless you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.xWY5omyIcILNR7y1]{Magical Crafting}. If you have Magical Crafting, then you can also use this feat to use Computers to construct magitech items that have the Tech and Magical traits.

Face in the Crowd.name: Face in the Crowd
Face in the Crowd.description: You know how to get lost in a crowd and hide among it, moving like fluid within its ranks and losing yourself in the bustle. You can use cover from crowds to Hide and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus on your Stealth checks when in a crowd of at least 10 creatures and a +4 circumstance bonus on your Stealth checks when in a crowd of at least 100 creatures. Hidden creatures do not count as members of a crowd. Halve the number of creatures required to get these bonuses if you are a master in Deception.

Fanning the Hammer.name: Fanning the Hammer
Fanning the Hammer.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You hold down the trigger and continue blasting. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} attack ignoring the unwieldy trait on your weapon when using this action. You don't designate a primary target with this attack, and creatures you damage with this attack do not gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} condition.

Far-Reaching Mind.name: Far-Reaching Mind
Far-Reaching Mind.description: Through rigorous mental exercises or natural talent, your psychic senses extend farther than average. Increase the ranges of your limited telepathy and thoughtsense by 10 feet each.

Favored Disguise.name: Favored Disguise
Favored Disguise.description: You create a favored disguise that you can call upon at a moment's notice. When you Impersonate, you can decide that the disguise becomes your favored disguise. If you have a holoskin or can change shape, you can always adopt your favored disguise when Impersonating. You still roll Deception for the Impersonate check but count any critical failure results as failures instead. You can have one favored disguise and gain an additional favored disguise you can employ at expert, master and legendary proficiency in Deception.

Fearless.name: Fearless
Fearless.description: Whether it comes from a sense of duty or a desire to succeed, you rarely flinch when confronted by the horrors of the wider cosmos, and your allies are inspired by your strength. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead.

Fearsome.name: Fearsome
Fearsome.description:
You're as fearsome as a dragon. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Intimidation. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the Intimidating Glare skill feat.

Feign Death.name: Feign Death
Feign Death.description:
Trigger You take damage

You lie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and Impersonate a corpse. As long as you don't take any actions requiring anything other than your mind, you appear dead. To see through your ruse, a creature must succeed at a check against your Deception DC, either by Seeking or Recalling Knowledge. You can Ready an Action without ending this effect if you are a master in Deception.

Filtering Tentacles.name: Filtering Tentacles
Filtering Tentacles.description:
The sensory tentacles covering the lower part of your face are sensitive enough to detect toxins. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against ingested or inhaled poisons.

Special You can take this feat only at 1st level, and you can't retrain out of or into this feat.

Fish in A Barrel.name: Fish in A Barrel
Fish in A Barrel.description: As the old adage goes: hitting easy targets is like shooting fish in a barrel. You Aim, then make a ranged Strike at a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} creature not benefiting from cover. Treat a success as a critical success. If you roll a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the beginning of your next turn.

Fissile Budding.name: Fissile Budding
Fissile Budding.description:
Frequency once per day

You can use Change Shape to split two of your identities into two different bodies, each using a unique form and identity. Each copy Strides to an unoccupied square. Both you and your copy act on your turn and use the same pool of actions, the same multiple attack penalty, and the same pool of Hit Points, but if both forms take damage from the same effect, such as from an attack or spell with area damage, you apply the damage only once. In the case of an effect with a save that affects both forms, you take the worse result and apply it to both forms. When this effect ends, you choose one of the two forms as your actual form and the other version of you Strides once toward you before becoming an arm that melds with your body as soon as it occupies the same square as you. If you can't retrieve your arm, you lose the ability to Change Shape into that copy's form and lose the use of that limb until it regrows in 1 week. This effect automatically ends if you are reduced to 0 Hit Points, if you occupy the same square as your copy, or after 1 minute.

Fixation.name: Fixation
Fixation.description: You're fascinated with a particular specific topic, such as the religious rites of a small sect of worshippers, the process of spaghettification, or the songs sung by asterays. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} feat and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.W6Gl9ePmItfDHji0]{Assurance} feat for the chosen Lore.

Flashing Fit.name: Flashing Fit
Flashing Fit.description: Years of careful attention to your look have given you a deep understanding of the interplay between color, texture, and light, and you know how to make your outfit catch anyone's eye. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.RQjSQVZRG497cJhX]{Vibrant Pattern} as a 6th-rank primal innate spell that you can cast once per day. At 17th level, the spell increases to 8th rank.

Flatten Body.name: Flatten Body
Flatten Body.description: You can flatten your body completely to avoid getting hurt. Change Shape and Drop Prone to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} by hunkering down. You can Hide and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} due to the greater cover and don't lose the benefits of Take Cover when you Sneak.

Flicker Strike.name: Flicker Strike
Flicker Strike.description:
You attack a target with your solar weapon and use the speed of light to shift to another foe within range. Make a Strike with your solar weapon. If your attack succeeds, select a creature within a range equal to your current Speed. You teleport to any square in range that's within reach of the creature you selected and make another melee Strike against that creature. If your initial Strike fails, you don't teleport and the action ends.

Graviton-Attuned Increase the range to double your Speed.

Photon-Attuned If a Strike made as part of this action is a critical success, the struck target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of its next turn.

Flickering Shield.name: Flickering Shield
Flickering Shield.description:
You learn how to install a rudimentary shield that temporarily blocks damage. You gain the following new mod.

Flickering Shield (armor): The item produces a temporary shield that protects its wearer from harm. The creature wearing the modded armor gains temporary Hit Points equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier and regains Hit Points equal to your Intelligence modifier for every round the shield is active. The flickering shield lasts for 1 minute or until dismissed. The modded item or exocortex then becomes temporarily immune to your flickering shield mod for 10 minutes.

Floating Balance.name: Floating Balance
Floating Balance.description: You are accustomed to floating free in the wide ocean and don't lose your cool when you have nothing within reach. You don't gain the clumsy or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} conditions when untethered.

Floating Flight.name: Floating Flight
Floating Flight.description: The membranous webbing between your limbs and torso grows strong enough to function as true wings when you're floating. When you're in low or zero gravity, you gain a Fly speed equal to your Swim speed.

Fluid Anatomy.name: Fluid Anatomy
Fluid Anatomy.description:
Trigger An enemy's Strike against you is a critical hit.

Your anatomy instantly shifts to redistribute damage away from vital areas. The triggering attack deals only the amount it would deal on a hit (typically normal damage instead of double damage). Any other effects of the attack caused by a critical hit still occur, such as critical specializations. Until the beginning of your next turn, you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the triggering enemy.

Fly Anything.name: Fly Anything
Fly Anything.description: Your vast experience as a pilot lets you intuit how the most interesting vehicles function. You can pilot a ship even if it would be physiologically impossible for you, including those that require telepathy or other supernatural abilities. You can use Piloting instead of Crafting to Repair a part of a vehicle, starship or mech with a â€“2 circumstance penalty as long as you have the appropriate parts available to you. You can use Piloting instead of Computers to Hack a vehicle, starship or mech with a â€“2 circumstance penalty.

Focus Pheromones.name: Focus Pheromones
Focus Pheromones.description:
Frequency once per hour

You can purposefully deploy your pheromones to manipulate the reactions of those around you. If your next action is to attempt a Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}, a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}, or an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, roll that skill check twice and use the better result.

Fog of War.name: Fog of War
Fog of War.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

The smoke from your unleashed weapon fire conceals you from any enemies who may be left standing. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack. You leave behind a cloud of smoke within the area that lasts until the end of your next turn or until dissipated by a strong wind. Creatures in the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them.

Foil Senses (Starfinder).name: Foil Senses (Starfinder)
Foil Senses (Starfinder).description:
You are adept at foiling creatures' special senses and cautious enough to safeguard against them at all times. Whenever you use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoid Notice}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions, you are always considered to be taking precautions against special senses.

Some precautions might not be available depending on the situation and at the GM's discretion, such as hiding your state as being alive for a creature who senses life.

Folded Paradoxes.name: Folded Paradoxes
Folded Paradoxes.description: Your paradoxical nature has become multifaceted. You learn the advanced warp spell of the chosen paradox.

Follow Their Lead.name: Follow Their Lead
Follow Their Lead.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally Strides.

You synchronize your movement to that of your allies, moving alongside them to keep close in the fray. Stride after the triggering ally, remaining adjacent to your ally for the duration of their movement until they stop or you've moved a distance equal to your Speed, whichever occurs first.

Follow the Leader.name: Follow the Leader
Follow the Leader.description: Your allies implicitly trust your orders. You're always considered to be leading by example for all of your active envoy directives.

Follow-Up Fire.name: Follow-Up Fire
Follow-Up Fire.description:
Requirements You are wielding two guns and your last action was a ranged Strike that missed.

Frequency once per round

When at first you don't succeed, shoot again. Make a second ranged Strike using the weapon you're wielding that you didn't fire with. This Strike doesn't count the multiple attack penalty from the prior attack but does count towards future multiple attack penalties.

Fool the Camera.name: Fool the Camera
Fool the Camera.description: Using combinations of the right attire and actions at the exact moment, you know how to fool security cameras and tech items that confer special senses, such as scopes. Whenever you use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoid Notice}, Hide, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions, you are always considered to be taking precautions against special senses from tech items. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Stealth DC to Avoid Notice by cameras and technological hazards.

Free Thinker.name: Free Thinker
Free Thinker.description: Your independence makes it difficult for others to intrude on your mind. You gain mental resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1) and gain a +1 status bonus to saves against mental effects.

Frequent Drifter.name: Frequent Drifter
Frequent Drifter.description: Your connection to the Drift has strengthened, allowing you to travel through it more often. The frequency of @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.3Ahby46MKakn45pr]{Drift Hop} changes to once per hour.

Friendly Face.name: Friendly Face
Friendly Face.description: You can use Change Shape to transform into a specific individual. As long as you have studied the individual for at least 10 minutes, creatures you do not interact with will not suspect your disguise unless your behavior is markedly different, or the creature has an intimate familiarity with the individual.

Frightening Display.name: Frightening Display
Frightening Display.description: You disgorge your stomach out of your mouth in a disturbing display of your aberrant heritage. Attempt a single Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each enemy within 30 feet. Regardless of the results of your check, each creature is then temporarily immune to Frightening Display for 1 minute.

From Hope.name: From Hope
From Hope.description: You believe that even in the face of the impossible, from hope spring miracles. Much like Lajok's rekindled light, you always carry this spark of hope in your heart and can focus upon it to make magic. You regain 1 Focus Point, up to your usual maximum.

Fundamental Understanding.name: Fundamental Understanding
Fundamental Understanding.description:
Trigger A creature within your quantum field casts a spell that you don't have in your spell repertoire, or a trap or similar object casts such a spell. You must be aware of the casting.

As long as you are trained in the appropriate skill for the spell's tradition and it's a common spell, you automatically identify the spell being cast (you still roll to attempt to get a critical success, but can't get a worse result than a success). You or a visible ally within 60 feet targeted by this spell gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your saving throw or your AC against it (or a +2 if you rolled a critical success).

Furious Flap.name: Furious Flap
Furious Flap.description: The muscles that control your membranous wings are particularly well developed, and you know how to use them to catch enemies off guard with their power. Once per day while in an area of atmosphere, you can flap your wings to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.g8QqHpv2CWDwmIm1]{Gust of Wind} as a primal innate spell. If you're submerged in liquid, you can instead cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jfVCuOpzC6mUrf6f]{Hydraulic Push}. After you've cast the spell, you can move up to half your Speed (or half your swim Speed if submerged) as a free action.

Galactic Bond.name: Galactic Bond
Galactic Bond.description:
You can bond with a number of additional home worlds equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1), which count against your bond limit. Planetary Bond's edicts, anathemas, and effects now extend to all bonded planets.

At 14th level, add teleport to your primal spell list. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7DN13ILADW2N9Z1t]{Commune} ritual, but can only use Nature to cast this ritual.

At 18th level, treat all bonded planets as within the same solar system as you when casting a spell with the teleport trait. Regardless of your current location, you can cast wrathful storm as a primal innate spell once per day using your spell DC.

Galactic Explorer.name: Galactic Explorer
Galactic Explorer.description: Whether you're dodging shifting asteroids or emergent solar flares, exploring an undiscovered star system, or flying through a dangerous nebula, you're a star-faring pilot at the forefront of galactic exploration. You always count a success as a critical success when using Piloting to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.hsUKPqTdAvWwsqH2]{Navigate} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LXqcXRayK58inaKo]{Plot Course}, and you reduce the travel time it takes to fly to a destination by one day plus one day for every four days of travel (minimum 1).

Galaxy Brain.name: Galaxy Brain
Galaxy Brain.description:
Frequency once per day

In an instant, your mind becomes a psychic supercomputer. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute. You can use your extra action only to Recall Knowledge, make psychic shock Strikes, activate your psychic shock's boost trait, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive}, or activate abilities with the contemplative trait.

Gear Authentication.name: Gear Authentication
Gear Authentication.description: You make sure your most important piece of gear is always on hand and authenticated using the unique signature of your spell database. During your daily preparations, you can lock an item compatible with your programming language so only you can use it. Other creatures can pick up, hold, stow, and carry the item, but it will not function unless they succeed at a @Check[computers|against:computers|rollerRole:target] check to Hack it equal to 10 + your Computers modifier. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.CDhVCtDy0aBJMchp]{Access Remote Gear} action.

Gelid Bite.name: Gelid Bite
Gelid Bite.description: Your linnorm heritage has begun to manifest more as you've become more powerful. Your jaws Strike deals an additional @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage. On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the end of your next turn, unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|against:class-spell] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

General Training (Starfinder).name: General Training (Starfinder)
General Training (Starfinder).description:
Your adaptability manifests in your mastery of a range of useful abilities. You gain a 1st-level general feat. You must meet the feat's prerequisites, but if you select this feat during character creation, you can select the feat later in the process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different feat each time.

Get Down!.name: Get Down!
Get Down!.description:
Trigger A willing adjacent ally becomes the target of a ranged attack or is in the area of an effect that deals damage and requires a Reflex saving throw.

You pull a standing ally down to the ground to take cover from the triggering attack. You and your ally fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. Your ally gains the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} to hunker down and gains greater cover against the triggering ranged attack, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saves until the beginning of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Effect: Cover}

Get Them!.name: Get Them!
Get Them!.description: When you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FXlhxST6fuaFt3Nh]{Get 'Em!}, you can choose any number of enemies within range instead of a single target.

Get Your Head in the Game!.name: Get Your Head in the Game!
Get Your Head in the Game!.description: You scold an ally within 30 feet for failing to pay attention, being taken by surprise, or being thrown for a loop. The target suppresses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} condition for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} and loses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition. If the target is off-guard due to a continual effect and would immediately regain the off-guard condition, such as when Balancing on a narrow surface or in zero-gravity, you instead suppress that instance of the off-guard condition for the same number of rounds that you suppress the fatigued condition. This does not prevent the target from gaining the off-guard condition in other ways. The target then becomes immune to Get Your Head in the Game! for 1 hour.

Get in There!.name: Get in There!
Get in There!.description:
You urge your allies to either hustle into the fight or get out of the way. Until the beginning of your next turn, you and your allies within 100 feet that can sense you gain a +5-foot status bonus to Speed. As your envoy level increases, so does this distance. Increase the distance by an additional 5 feet at 7th level, 12th level, and 17th level.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.QGL2W4n9DS2knbWJ]{Effect: Get in There!}

Lead by Example If you Step or Stride before the end of your turn, you can signal your allies to follow your lead. Each of your allies within 100 feet who can sense you can immediately Step or Stride up to half their Speed (rounded down to the nearest 5-foot increment) as a reaction.

Gifted Mentor.name: Gifted Mentor
Gifted Mentor.description: You have a knack for mentoring others. Whenever you successfully Aid an ally, you increase the circumstance bonus that you would grant them by +1, or by +2 on a critical success. Whenever an ally Follows the Expert, and the expert they choose to follow is you, the circumstance bonus they gain to their skill check based on your proficiency is increased by +1.

Gliding Wings.name: Gliding Wings
Gliding Wings.description:
The winglike membranes that stretch between your arms and torso let you maneuver while floating without a solid point to push off from. While in low gravity or zero gravity, you can take the Push Off action without having a solid surface within reach.

In addition, when falling in such an environment, you can move 5 feet horizontally in the direction of your choice for every 20 vertical feet you fall. Subtract this distance moved horizontally from the distance you fell when calculating fall damage.

Glimpse of the Bloom.name: Glimpse of the Bloom
Glimpse of the Bloom.description: Through years of practice, you've honed your ability to see through tricks and illusions of the First World. Once per day, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight} as a primal innate spell; use the higher of your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, minus 10 for any associated counteract checks.

Glitch Pulse.name: Glitch Pulse
Glitch Pulse.description:
Your devices can emit a disrupting pulse that causes tech to malfunction. You gain the following new mod.

Glitch Pulse (exocortex or weapon): Strikes from the modded exocortex or weapon disrupt technology. On a hit, Strikes cause a random tech item held by the target to gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 3} condition for 1 round. If the creature has the tech trait, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|against:mechanic] save against your class DC.

Critical Success The creature is immune to your glitch pulse for 24 hours.

Success No effect.

Failure The creature is glitching 3 for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is glitching 3 for 1 minute.

God Mode.name: God Mode
God Mode.description: You understand the nuanced beauty of arcane code and modify it in ways other spellcasters can hardly fathom. You can use up to three technomancer spellshape feats as free actions and apply all of them to the next spell you cast this turn. You can apply a fourth spellshape feat using Jailbreak Spell, but you can only apply the jailbreak benefit of up to two spellshape feats to the spell you cast.

Got 'Em!.name: Got 'Em!
Got 'Em!.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger An ally damages the target of your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FXlhxST6fuaFt3Nh]{Get 'Em!} with an attack.

You provide a quick follow-up to your ongoing directive, letting your ally become invigorated when they successfully attack your designated target. Your ally gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level, or equal to your level if the Strike was a critical hit. If your ally has a circumstance bonus to damage rolls from your Get 'Em! because you are leading by example, increase the number of temporary Hit Points by that amount. These temporary Hit Points last until the start of the ally's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.TlGsIXpYAJsnrizm]{Effect: Got 'Em!}

Special At 14th level you can use Got 'Em! twice per round, and at 18th level you can use it three times per round.

Grandmother's Blessing.name: Grandmother's Blessing
Grandmother's Blessing.description: Lao Shu Po notices your devotion. You can shroud yourself in darkness, and when you pray, she may even deign to give you a morsel of information. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pkcOby5prOausy1k]{Read Omens} as 4th-rank divine innate spells. You can Cast each Spell once per day. You can see through the darkness created by your own darkness spells without difficulty, as if you had greater darkvision.

Grandmother's Chosen.name: Grandmother's Chosen
Grandmother's Chosen.description: Your steadfast faith in Lao Shu Po has her attention. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} as a 7th-rank innate divine spell once per day. Additionally, once per month, whenever you would die, your body instead transforms into a swarm of dispersing rats. [[/r 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} later, these rats regather in a safe space of the GM's choosing (a site dedicated to Lao Shu Po, if possible), reforming your body. You are returned to life at your maximum Hit Points.

Grandmother's Lore.name: Grandmother's Lore
Grandmother's Lore.description: You cleave close to Lao Shu Po's teachings and aren't afraid to lie, cheat, or steal to get what you desire. Thanks to your extra devotion, you gain the trained proficiency rank in Deception and Thievery. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Lao Shu Po Lore.

Grasping Tendrils.name: Grasping Tendrils
Grasping Tendrils.description:
You've adapted more of your tendrils and limbs with complex musculature and cellular structure, improving articulation and fine motor skills. Increase your number of arms by two. At any time, one pair of your hands is designated as your active hands. You can change this designation from one pair of hands to another by taking the Switch Active Hands action, which is a single action. You can only perform actions with your active hands.

Special You can take this feat multiple times.

Gravitic Dampener.name: Gravitic Dampener
Gravitic Dampener.description: You remotely activate dampeners in your exocortex that slow motion and increase gravity. Either your turret, your drone, or one of your deployed mines radiates a 10-foot radius emanation of difficult terrain, which moves with the drone. It is immune to difficult terrain created by its own aura. This aura lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Gravitic Mines.name: Gravitic Mines
Gravitic Mines.description:
Your mines push or pull creatures in a burst of concentrated gravity. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ccVcznj9KVYHLVaY]{Deploy} a mine, choose one of the following effects for that mine:

Black Hole: When your mines detonate, they pull creatures 5 feet toward the mine (10 feet plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on a critical failure).

Big Bang: When your mines detonate, they push creatures 5 feet away from the mine in a random direction (10 feet plus knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

This is forced movement and does not trigger reactions. If this movement would move a creature into a space it can't occupy, the creature stops moving in the last space it can occupy.

Grazing Shot.name: Grazing Shot
Grazing Shot.description:
Requirements You have a mark.

You take your time to line up a shot that's sure to hit. Make a ranged Strike with your gun at your mark. It gains the following failure effect.

Failure Your attack deals minimum damage to the target. (Calculate this damage as if every die you would roll has a result of 1.)

Greater Magic Hack.name: Greater Magic Hack
Greater Magic Hack.description: You learn the greater magic hack of your chosen programming language.

Grenade Spell.name: Grenade Spell
Grenade Spell.description:
Requirements You are holding a grenade.

You deliver your spells with a bang. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with a burst effect that requires a Reflex save, the spell does not immediately take effect, but it instead is installed into the held grenade. Until the end of your next turn, any creatures caught in the Area Fire of the grenade are also affected by the installed spell; creatures do not make a separate Reflex save against the spell and instead use the same result they rolled against the grenade.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, you can install any spell into a grenade. In that case, creatures roll a separate saving throw against your spell DC if it's not a Reflex save. If you apply the effects of this spellshape to a spell with a basic Reflex save, you can use your spell DC instead of your class DC for the grenade.

Guarded Thoughts.name: Guarded Thoughts
Guarded Thoughts.description: Your psychic training allows you to block attempts to read your thoughts and ward off mental intrusion. Any effect that specifically attempts to read your mind to glean information must succeed at a counteract check against the higher of your class DC or your spell DC to do so successfully; otherwise, it gains no information. The counteract level is equal to half your level rounded up.

Guilt Trip.name: Guilt Trip
Guilt Trip.description:
Trigger A creature you can see damages you with a melee Strike.

You give your attacker a look of utter disappointment so heartbreaking that it causes them to feel shame for their actions. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[will|against:class-spell] saving throw against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} from the guilt. On a critical failure, they fail to follow through on the attack, reducing the triggering damage dealt to you by their Strength modifier.

Hair Trigger (Starfinder).name: Hair Trigger (Starfinder)
Hair Trigger (Starfinder).description:
Trigger The last creature you aimed at since the start of your last turn uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action.

Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You attempt a ranged Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Hammer the Nail.name: Hammer the Nail
Hammer the Nail.description: You adjust the angle of your firepower to maximize the impact of your shot on your foes' bodies. Increase the distance you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} your opponent with @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.6avX89eWVlIZg75D]{Shoving Shot} to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success. In addition, on a critical success, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} after being Shoved. When you use Shoving Shot, you also Shove the target 5 feet on a failure.

Hampering Shot.name: Hampering Shot
Hampering Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You aim to hinder your foe. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, then make a ranged Strike at your mark. If the Strike hits, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn.

Hang In There!.name: Hang In There!
Hang In There!.description:
You encourage yourself or an ally, psyching them up for a coming challenge and granting them temporary Hit Points. Select yourself or an ally within 30 feet, then attempt a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:20] check. If you have master proficiency in Diplomacy, you can instead attempt a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:30] check to increase the temporary Hit Points gained on a successful check by 5. If you have legendary proficiency, you can instead attempt a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:40] check to increase the temporary Hit Points gained on a successful check by 10. These temporary Hit Points last for one minute. The target is then temporarily immune to your Hang in There! for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.lfG1m2ww3mdZY5jA]{Effect: Hang In There!}

Critical Success The target gains temporary Hit Points equal to double their level.

Success The target gains temporary Hit Points equal to their level.

Failure The target is unaffected, and you can't use Hang in There! again for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is unaffected, and you can't use Hang in There! again for 1 hour.

Hardlight Illusion.name: Hardlight Illusion
Hardlight Illusion.description:
You weave hardlight technology into your illusions to make them more believable. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with the illusion trait, creatures cannot attempt to disbelieve your illusion by merely touching or attempting to damage it, but they can still use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to examine it and attempt to disbelieve your illusion. When a creature succeeds (but not critically succeeds) at a Perception check or Will save to disbelieve the illusion, you can reprogram it as a reaction by attempting a Computers check against the target's Perception DC. If you succeed, the target fails to disbelieve the illusion.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape and modify an illusion spell that deals mental damage, that spell deals another appropriate type of damage based on the type of illusion. This damage does not need to be nonlethal, can deactivate regeneration, and otherwise functions like normal damage.

Harmonic Convergence.name: Harmonic Convergence
Harmonic Convergence.description: Dissonance grants you a modicum of clarity and a brief second wind in stressful situations. When you use an action with the disharmony trait, you gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level.

Harmonic Sensitivity.name: Harmonic Sensitivity
Harmonic Sensitivity.description: You've developed keen sensory organs that have an amazing sensitivity to soundâ€”and you know how to put them to use. You become trained in Performance or gain the Assurance skill feat with Performance if your are already trained in that skill. In addition, you can accurately recall a melody or lyrics you've heard within the last week, granting you a +2 circumstance bonus to all Deception and Performance checks that involve mimicking speech or a specific sound.

Harmonic Shielding.name: Harmonic Shielding
Harmonic Shielding.description: Your hypersensitivity to soundwaves has conditioned your body to resist loud noises and shield you from their harmful effects. You gain sonic resistance equal to half your level. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a sonic effect, you get a critical success instead.

Harness Cosmic Forces.name: Harness Cosmic Forces
Harness Cosmic Forces.description: You're among the most powerful of sarcesians and can harness the cosmic forces of the universe to create incredible stellar phenomena. Select one of the following spells, which you can cast once per day as a 7th-rank arcane innate spell: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0jadeyQIItIuRgeH]{Eclipse Burst} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst}.

Haughty Obstinacy (Starfinder).name: Haughty Obstinacy (Starfinder)
Haughty Obstinacy (Starfinder).description: Your powerful ego makes it harder for others to order you around. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a mental effect that attempts to directly control your actions, you critically succeed instead. If a creature rolls a failure on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} you using Intimidation, it gets a critical failure instead (so it can't try to Coerce you again for 1 week).

Headstrong.name: Headstrong
Headstrong.description: You became a borai through your own stubborn willfulness. When you died, you refused to accept your own defeat and clung to your corpse, forcing your soul back into your body and giving you life along with it. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Will saving throws against fear and effects that would make you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, and a +1 circumstance to your Will DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you.

Healing Mines.name: Healing Mines
Healing Mines.description:
You've designed a unique type of explosive device that administers a burst of healing medicine to nearby creatures. You gain the following new mod.

Healing Mines (exocortex): You've packed featherlight cartridges with sterile syringes full of concentrated analgesics. Your mines heal the amount of Hit Points they would have dealt as damage.

Heart of Planets Lost.name: Heart of Planets Lost
Heart of Planets Lost.description: You grew up hearing stories about Damiar and Iovo, the long-destroyed sarcesian home worlds remembered today only in legends, shattered rock, and the hearts of your people. You gain the Additional Lore general feat for Damiar Lore, Iovo Lore, and Diaspora Lore.

Heightened Paranoia.name: Heightened Paranoia
Heightened Paranoia.description:
You witnessed the ritual that supposedly rekindled Sota's flame up close, and while it was certainly impressive, you don't believe it should've worked. You can't seem to shake the feeling that something else is at work behind the scenesâ€”something dangerous and unknown. Whatever it is, you intend to face this threat head on. When you succeed on a Will saving throw against an effect that could impose the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, you get a critical success instead.

Special You can't select this feat if you have the Determined Optimist feat.

Heightened Thoughtsense.name: Heightened Thoughtsense
Heightened Thoughtsense.description:
Your psychic awareness expands, granting you sharper perception at close range and a wider sensory field overall. Increase the range of your vague thoughtsense by 10 feet. In addition, you gain thoughtsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 5 feet.

At 9th level, your vague thoughtsense becomes an imprecise sense.

Hellknight Dedication (Starfinder).name: Hellknight Dedication (Starfinder)
Hellknight Dedication (Starfinder).description:
Your infernal countenance is a scourge. You gain expert proficiency in Intimidation (or in another skill in which you're trained of your choice, if you were already an expert in Intimidation). You treat medium armor as light armor when determining your proficiency, and you treat heavy armor as medium armor. You customize your armor using specialized Hellknight regalia, gaining the armor specialization effects of that armor and one additional armor upgrade. Your resistance (or reduction from critical hits) from that armor's specialization is 1 higher than normal. In addition, while wearing your Hellknight regalia, you gain an item bonus to Intimidation checks equal to 1 + your armor's resilience value.

Hellknight Orders

Hellknight OrderEdictsInfernal Damage and Resistance
Order of the Chainpunish lawbreakerselectricity
Order of the Crucibletest civilizationscold
Order of the Eclipsecontrol dangerous informationvoid
Order of the Pyrepurge subversive media with firefire

Helping Hand.name: Helping Hand
Helping Hand.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

In the blink of an eye, you ready yourself to help your ally with a task. This counts as preparing to help an ally for the purposes of using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} reaction. You must still explain to the GM exactly how you're helping.

Heroic Last Stand.name: Heroic Last Stand
Heroic Last Stand.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements You have less than one-quarter of your Hit Points remaining.

You fight fearlessly for your friends. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 minute. As long as you have these temporary Hit Points, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Will saves against fear effects and a +2 circumstance bonus to your Will DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you.

Heroâ€™s Edge.name: Heroâ€™s Edge
Heroâ€™s Edge.description: You fight hardest when the odds are at their most dire, and the specter of death looms over you. As long as you have temporary Hit Points from @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.a9ER2amvCuQEJODm]{Heroic Last Stand}, your Strikes and spells deal additional damage. You gain a status bonus to damage with your Strikes equal to the number of weapon damage dice. Spells you cast from spell slots gain a status bonus to damage equal to the level of the spell; this bonus applies only to spells that deal damage and don't have a duration.

Heroâ€™s Perseverance.name: Heroâ€™s Perseverance
Heroâ€™s Perseverance.description: Like the heroes who inspire you, you rally yourself to persevere against death itself. When you use Heroic Last Stand, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice your level for 1 minute, rather than equal to your level for 1 minute.

High Voltage.name: High Voltage
High Voltage.description: You've modified your drone's power cell to create and store excess electricity, which your drone can release in a sudden jolt. Your drone gains the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.KMq4iGwE0RU2WpLU]{Electrical Discharge} action.

High-Tech Medic.name: High-Tech Medic
High-Tech Medic.description:
You know the galaxy is a dangerous place, and you've made a few technological breakthroughs to help you make the most of limited medical supplies. You can store up to 3 items with the healing trait in your custom rig. You gain the following new mods.

Concentrated Dosage (item): You disassemble the item to deliver a powerful dose of analgesics. If a targeted creature has the clumsy or sickened condition, the item decreases the value of that condition by 1. At 6th level, you can choose to suppress persistent damage afflicting the target until the beginning of your next turn. At 12th level, you can choose to grant the target fast healing equal to your Intelligence modifier or the item's level (whichever is higher) until the beginning of your next turn.

Healbot (drone exocortex): You command your exocortex to deliver stored medication to a nearby ally. Your drone administers the item as an action with the manipulate trait. Healing items administered in this way heal an additional amount of Hit Points equal to your Intelligence modifier or half the item's level, whichever is higher.

Historian.name: Historian
Historian.description: You become trained in a Lore skill of your choice. You can spend 10 minutes checking your notes or research materials to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about a piece of history with any Lore skill in which you are not trained, using your highest Lore modifier instead of your modifier with that skill.

History Buff.name: History Buff
History Buff.description: You have cataloged countless customs, histories, and traditions. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ZYoC630tNGutgbE0]{hypercognition} once per day as a 3rd-rank occult innate spell. You can use your modifier for the Lore skill you chose for Historian in place of any other skill modifier when making a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check while casting hypercognition.

Hologram Skeptic.name: Hologram Skeptic
Hologram Skeptic.description: You have an eye for holograms and can easily spot the tiny glitches and imperfections that others might miss. Even if you aren't Searching, you always attempt a check to disbelieve holograms and effects with the illusion and tech traits that normally require you to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Search} or Interact with them.

Holy Talisman.name: Holy Talisman
Holy Talisman.description: You can construct and bless a temporary religious symbol of your deity in 10 minutes. While such talismans are traditionally scraps of paper with the symbol drawn on them, they can take many forms, including body art, a sticker, or even a sanctified virtual emoji. You can create a talisman only for yourself and for the deity your worship. Once per day, you can choose to gain a +2 status bonus to initiative rolls if engaged in an act that corresponds to your deity's edicts. If you violate your deity's anathema, the talisman destroys itself, and you take a â€“1 status penalty to initiative rolls until your next daily preparations.

Homeguard.name: Homeguard
Homeguard.description: Your Homeguard training has prepared you for anything. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls, and when you tie an adversary's initiative roll, you always go first.

Homing Mote.name: Homing Mote
Homing Mote.description: You've come to rely on ranged motes as much as you do your solar weapon. Triple the range of your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.0o7v0LwOjvvNJRCw]{Solar Shot}. When using Solar Shot against foes within its original range, you ignore @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} and cover the target has.

Hug Master.name: Hug Master
Hug Master.description: Born from the belief that a good, solid hug can make everything better, you've adapted your hugging talents to the battlefield. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.KxaYlC50zzHysJj8]{Titan Wrestler} skill feat. Additionally, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude DC to avoid being Grappled.

Hunker Down.name: Hunker Down
Hunker Down.description: You dash across the battlefield and hunker down behind cover before unleashing hell on your enemies. You Stride and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}. You can either Detonate Mine, make a ranged Strike with your turret, or your drone can make a Strike.

Hurl Ally.name: Hurl Ally
Hurl Ally.description:
Requirements You are adjacent to an ally or your ally is riding you and you have one or more hands free.

You use your innate strength to hurl an ally across the battlefield. Pick up an adjacent ally of your size or smaller and throw them to an unoccupied space you can see within 20 feet, or within 40 feet if you throw your bonded partner. Their movement doesn't trigger reactions. Your ally ends this movement on their feet and treats the fall as 20 feet lower, or 40 feet lower if you throw your bonded partner.

Hurry!.name: Hurry!
Hurry!.description: You urge an ally to pick up the pace and contribute more to the events happening around them. One ally within 30 feet who can sense you becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} 1 for 1 round. They can use the extra action to Interact, Step, or Stride. The target is then immune to Hurry! for the next 10 minutes.

Hybrid Technique.name: Hybrid Technique
Hybrid Technique.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You can combine methods into a new deadly hybrid technique. Choose two soldier feats that take 2 actions and require you wield a weapon with one or more specific traits. Make a single @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} attack with the benefits and additional effects of both feats.

Hyper.name: Hyper
Hyper.description: You're hyperactive and full of energy, often bounding into trouble faster than your companions can keep up. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

Hypersensitive Antennae.name: Hypersensitive Antennae
Hypersensitive Antennae.description: Your antennae become far more sensitive, enabling you to better pinpoint the location of thinking creatures. Your thoughtsense becomes a precise sense.

I'll be Back.name: I'll be Back
I'll be Back.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements You were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and regain consciousness.

Even when you're downed, you somehow get right back into the thick of things once recovered. You can immediately Stand and Interact to draw a weapon or grab an unattended weapon.

I'm the Real One!.name: I'm the Real One!
I'm the Real One!.description:
Trigger You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by another creature or you grab or restrain another creature.

Requirements You can use Change Shape to assume the appearance of that creature.

You Change Shape to assume the appearance of the other creature. All other creatures must use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to attempt a Perception check against your Deception DC to determine which creature is real and which is an imitation. A creature who doesn't know which creature you are must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] when targeting either of you with an attack, spell, or other effect. If the check fails, the attack, spell, or effect targets the other creature instead.

Abilities such as telepathy or the mystic's group chat feature may automatically allow a creature to determine which creature is which, but an aware creature must still use the Point Out action to indicate to others which creature is which. An imitated creature might have a signal or phrase that indicates to their allies which creature is which, but doing so in the din of battle is an action with the auditory or visual trait.

Icy Spelunker.name: Icy Spelunker
Icy Spelunker.description: You spent time exploring the icy caves of Kalo-Mahoi's crust, and climbing comes nearly as easily to you as walking. You gain a Climb speed of 25 feet, and you treat difficult terrain from ice and snow as normal terrain.

Impeding Shot.name: Impeding Shot
Impeding Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You hinder your target. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, then make a ranged Strike at your mark. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn. If the target is flying, it also falls 10 feet.

Impressive Lungs.name: Impressive Lungs
Impressive Lungs.description: You have excellent lung capacity. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.aJUXbe9HJVvv0Mxa]{Breath Control} general feat. You do not need to breathe for up to 10 minutes after leaving a vacuum.

Improved Bio-Cannon.name: Improved Bio-Cannon
Improved Bio-Cannon.description: Your bio-cannon evolves. The range on your bio-cannon increases to 40 feet. Each time you use your bio-cannon, you can choose to grant your bio-cannon the area (line) trait as a free action.

Improved Blood Sense.name: Improved Blood Sense
Improved Blood Sense.description: Your ability to detect the bloodied wounds of others improves as you can seek out wounded foes. Blood sense becomes a precise sense with a range of 60 feet against any target with persistent bleed damage.

Improved Conductivity.name: Improved Conductivity
Improved Conductivity.description: By imitating your ancestors' diet, taking synthetic supplements, or unlocking your genetic potential with magic, you've enhanced your bioelectrical network. All your Strikes or spells that deal electricity damage or have the electricity trait gain the arc trait. If you're wielding an active forcefield, it regenerates twice its normal HP for 1 round after you hit an enemy with an arc attack.

In Another Life.name: In Another Life
In Another Life.description: When you rest, you see versions of yourself in other realities. During your daily preparations, select one ancestry feat for your ancestry that you meet the prerequisites for and don't already have. You gain that feat until your next daily preparations.

Inappropriate Joke.name: Inappropriate Joke
Inappropriate Joke.description:
Trigger Your target within 30 feet uses a concentrate action.

You tell a joke that disrupts your target's concentration and throws them off their rhythm. Make a Performance check against their Will DC. The target is immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure You laugh at your own joke and can't use actions with the auditory trait until the end of your next turn or until you spend an action to catch your breath.

Incognito Spell.name: Incognito Spell
Incognito Spell.description:
Through sheer mental effort, you can simplify the incantations and gestures needed to cast, leaving them barely noticeable. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, the spell gains the subtle trait, hiding the shining runes, sparks of magic, and other manifestations that would usually give away your spellcasting. The trait hides only the spell's spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish into thin air.

Jailbreak If you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.EE07CnQmn8Xg4gkd]{Jailbreak Spell} to use this spellshape, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} one creature using Arcana instead of Intimidation by making the effects of the spell seem effortless on your part.

Incredible Improvisation (Starfinder).name: Incredible Improvisation (Starfinder)
Incredible Improvisation (Starfinder).description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You attempt a check using a skill you're untrained in.

A stroke of brilliance gives you a major advantage with a skill despite your inexperience. Gain a +4 circumstance bonus to the triggering skill check.

Infernal Armaments.name: Infernal Armaments
Infernal Armaments.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

You infuse your weapons with the might of Hell. For the next minute, on your first weapon Strike each round, you gain a status bonus to damage equal to twice the number of weapon damage dice; this extra damage is determined by your chosen Hellknight order.

Infernal Bulwark.name: Infernal Bulwark
Infernal Bulwark.description: Armor you wear gains the bulwark trait. You become trained in heavy armor, or become an expert in heavy armor if you were already trained. Your Hellknight regalia grants you resistance equal to half your level when you wear it, determined by your chosen Hellknight order.

Infinite Aim.name: Infinite Aim
Infinite Aim.description: You're a sharpshooter even without a scope or stance. You can @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} as a free action.

Infinite Magic.name: Infinite Magic
Infinite Magic.description: You draw spells from other worlds, even when your own magic reserves are spent. Twice per day, you can cast a 9th-rank or lower spell after you've run out of spell slots of the appropriate spell rank; the two spells you cast with this feat must of different spell ranks.

Infodump.name: Infodump
Infodump.description:
You muster myriad minutiae that you subsequently use to overwhelm a creature's mind with pointless trivia. Attempt a check to Recall Knowledge against the Will DC of a creature you're aware of within 60 feet; you can use any skill for which you can Recall Knowledge, not just a skill associated with the target's traits. Rather than remembering useful information, you recite facts at the target. Regardless of your result, the creatures within 60 feet become temporarily immune to your attempts to Infodump with that skill for 24 hours.

Critical Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Failure The target is unaffected.

Critical Failure You trip over your own thoughts, becoming stupefied 1 until the beginning of your next turn.

Special You can Infodump using speech or limited telepathy. If you Infodump through speech, this ability gains the auditory trait.

Inject Serum.name: Inject Serum
Inject Serum.description: You skillfully administer various medicinals using injection weapons. You load an injection weapon with a poison, potion, serum, or other consumable or injected item. You can load the dart into an injection weapon as part of the same action.

Inner Wellspring.name: Inner Wellspring
Inner Wellspring.description:
Frequency once per day

In a monumental feat of mental fortitude, you dig deep and draw on the memories of your lost ancestral homeworld of Golarion, tapping into inner reserves of power to pull off just one more miracle. You recover 1 Focus Point.

Instant Deployment.name: Instant Deployment
Instant Deployment.description:
Trigger You roll initiative.

You're always ready to unleash your exocortex. If you have a drone exocortex, your drone Strides. If you have a mine or turret exocortex, you can @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ccVcznj9KVYHLVaY]{Deploy Mine} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.1vWiNk1jbqCq4O16]{Deploy Turret}.

Instant Install.name: Instant Install
Instant Install.description: You've worked a few shortcuts into your custom rig, enabling you to install and uninstall upgrades swiftly. If you use your custom rig to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.d4vJxq49lUb7fGXq]{Install Upgrade}, rather than a repair toolkit, you can Install Upgrade as a single action.

Instant Reload.name: Instant Reload
Instant Reload.description:
Frequency once per round

Hours of practice swiftly loading magazines has finally paid off. You can reload as a free action.

Instinctive Aim.name: Instinctive Aim
Instinctive Aim.description: You draw your gun and take careful aim with the same motion. You Interact to draw a gun, then @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} with that gun.

Intensified Psychic Shock.name: Intensified Psychic Shock
Intensified Psychic Shock.description:
You focus your telepathic attacks further, broadcasting your psychic power with greater range and area. Your psychic shock unarmed attack gains the boost (1d4) trait. By spending 10 minutes in intense concentration, you can reconfigure your mind to apply one of the following benefits to your psychic shock. This benefit lasts until you reconfigure to another benefit.

  • Extended Shock: Increase the range increment of your psychic shock by 15 feet.
  • Mind Crusher: Your psychic shock gains the fatal d8 trait.
  • Peer Pressure: Your psychic shock gains the arc trait, but it deals mental damage rather than electricity damage.
  • Psychic Wave: Your psychic shock gains the splash trait.

Internal Chemistry.name: Internal Chemistry
Internal Chemistry.description: You tweak your anatomy and bodily systems to metabolize pharmaceuticals more efficiently. Consumable items that have the healing trait and restore Hit Points to you restore an additional number of Hit Points to you equal to half your level.

Internal Compartment (Starfinder).name: Internal Compartment (Starfinder)
Internal Compartment (Starfinder).description: You can hide a small object of up to light Bulk inside a hollow cavity on one of your forearms. It takes 3 Interact actions to store an object in this way. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to the DCs of checks for others to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} objects stored inside your arm. If you store a weapon in your arm, you can use a single action to Interact to draw the weapon into the hand corresponding to your internal cavity, then Strike with the weapon.

Internal Respirator (Starfinder).name: Internal Respirator (Starfinder)
Internal Respirator (Starfinder).description: Your body can internally synthesize oxygen for limited periods of time. When you hold your breath, you can do so for an additional hour by rebreathing from your internal air reservoirs. At the end of this hour, your air reservoirs are expended. Refilling your empty air reservoirs takes 10 minutes of exposure to breathable air.

Intimidating Shot.name: Intimidating Shot
Intimidating Shot.description: You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a foe within your ranged weapon's range by firing it into the air, using ammo equal to the weapon's expend. This check doesn't take a â€“4 circumstance penalty if the target doesn't share a language with you.

Intimidating Taunt.name: Intimidating Taunt
Intimidating Taunt.description:
You taunt your enemy mercilessly. Attempt an @Check[type:intimidation|defense:will] check and compare it to the Will DC of one enemy creature within 60 feet. The target is then temporarily immune to any use of Intimidating Taunt for 1 hour. This action has the auditory trait or visual trait, depending on how you taunt your enemy.

Critical Success On their next turns, any hostile actions that the creature takes must include you as a target or include you in the area as long as you are visible to the target, otherwise the action takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty if its an attack or reduces the save DC by 2.

Success As critical success, but only the first hostile action that the creature takes is affected.

Failure The creature is unaffected.

Intuitive Talent.name: Intuitive Talent
Intuitive Talent.description:
Frequency once per hour

You enjoy embracing new experiences and have a knack for picking up new skills and talents, sometimes over the course of countless lifetimes, as your semi-dead nature grants you a wider perspective. Choose a skill that you're untrained in. Until the beginning of your next turn, you become trained in the chosen skill.

Iomedae's Barrage.name: Iomedae's Barrage
Iomedae's Barrage.description:
Frequency once per day

You channel your spirit into a mighty barrage from a celestial plasma cannon. Iomedae's barrage Auto-Fires in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] or a @Template[type:line|distance:30], dealing @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2 - 1))d6[fire], (floor(@actor.level/2 - 1))d6[spirit]|traits:holy] damage with the holy trait (@Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)]). At 12th level and every 2 levels thereafter, the fire and spirit damage each increase by 1d6. A creature that gets a critical failure on this Reflex save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Iomedae's Helm.name: Iomedae's Helm
Iomedae's Helm.description: You touch an adjacent ally who is affected by a spell or other magical effect with the mental trait due to failing a Will save and has a duration of no longer than 1 minute. That ally can immediately attempt a Will save against the effect's DC, ending the condition on a success. This can't end the effect for any creatures other than your target ally. Regardless of the result of the save, your ally is temporarily immune to Iomedae's Helm for 10 minutes.

Iomedae's Shield.name: Iomedae's Shield
Iomedae's Shield.description:
You manifest your faith as a shield. Your armor and the armor of up to five allies you can see within 30 feet gains the benefits of an activated @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.equipment.Item.WgLegYXfJWtPOB3m]{Tactical Force Field} upgrade with 14 Hit Points that replenishes 2 Hit Points on your turn but does not protect from critical hits like a normal force field. The force field lasts for one minute. After receiving the benefits of Iomedae's Shield, you and your allies are immune to the effect for one hour.

At level 10, this becomes a @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.equipment.Item.8yEnhqeRKBxO02M2]{Superior Force Field} with 26 HP and replenishes 5 Hit Points on your turn, and at level 16, this becomes an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.equipment.Item.Hqxyg3xDDoqYLNO3]{Ultimate Force Field} with 37 HP and replenishes 7 Hit Points on your turn.

Iomedae's Sword.name: Iomedae's Sword
Iomedae's Sword.description: You've trained to fight the ancient enemies of lost Golarion. When you deal damage to a demon, devil, dragon, or undead with a weapon, you deal persistent spirit damage with the holy trait equal to the number of weapon damage dice. When you deal damage to one of these creatures with a spell cast from a spell slot that does not have a duration, you deal persistent spirit damage with the holy trait equal to the spell's rank.

It's Who You Know.name: It's Who You Know
It's Who You Know.description: You call on your extensive network for help with skulduggery. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.plBGdZhqq5JBl1D8]{Gather Information} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ftG89SjTSa9DYDOD]{Create a Forgery}, you do it in half the normal time.

Just Kidding.name: Just Kidding
Just Kidding.description:
Trigger An ally critically fails to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, Request, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

You attempt to play off a social misstep as a joke. Attempt a Performance check against the same DC as your ally's check. If you succeed, your ally treats their critical failure as a failure.

Just the Thing....name: Just the Thing...
Just the Thing....description:
Cost the Price of the chosen item

You've traveled far and wide, bringing supplies and equipment from place to place and picking up interesting objects in your travels. In fact, you've got an interesting item rightâ€¦ here! You Interact to pull an item you hadn't previously declared that you purchased out of your pocketâ€”this item must be any common item of half your level or less with a Bulk of 1 or less. It must be a piece of adventuring gear (from the table in Starfinder Player Core or other sources of adventuring gear) and can't be a weapon, armor, ammunition, magic item, pharmaceutical item, or other treasure.

Kalo Lore.name: Kalo Lore
Kalo Lore.description:
Growing up among the blooms and glowing spires of Kalo-Mahoi has instilled in you a deep appreciation of the beauty around you, both natural and constructed. You're trained in Crafting and Nature. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the Additional Lore general feat for Kalo Lore.

Kasatha Lore.name: Kasatha Lore
Kasatha Lore.description:
You become trained in Diplomacy and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Kasatha Lore.

Kasatha Weapon Elegance.name: Kasatha Weapon Elegance
Kasatha Weapon Elegance.description:
You've learned how to adapt your martial expertise to wield other weapons. When wielding a weapon you aren't proficient with, treat your level as your proficiency bonus.

At 11th level, you become trained in all weapons.

Kasathan Weapon Familiarity.name: Kasathan Weapon Familiarity
Kasathan Weapon Familiarity.description:
Your people have instilled in you a respect for melee combat, and you've trained to wield a few more elegant examples in battle. You gain access to all uncommon weapons with the kasatha trait. You have familiarity with weapons with the kasatha trait plus the dueling sword, plasma sword, shock truncheon, and singing spearâ€”for the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these weapons, you get its critical specialization effect.

Keep Them in Your Sights.name: Keep Them in Your Sights
Keep Them in Your Sights.description: You always keep a target marked and in your sights, even if they move. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, the benefits apply if your mark is within your weapon's first or second range increment, rather than only within the first.

Kick It into Overdrive.name: Kick It into Overdrive
Kick It into Overdrive.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger Your turn begins.

With a steadying breath and a moment of intense focus, you push yourself beyond your limits, gaining incredible speed for a short period of time. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of your turn and you can use the extra action only to Stride.

When you use this ability, you can instead choose to become quickened until the end of your next turn, but at the end of this duration, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 2 rounds as your body recovers. You can still only use the extra action from quickened to Stride with this effect.

Kill Shot.name: Kill Shot
Kill Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You take careful aim at your mark and shoot to kill. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, then make a ranged Strike against your mark. If this attack is a success (but not a critical success), you deal maximum damage. Calculate this damage as if every die you would roll has a maximum result. On a critical success, roll the result normally, but if the double damage would be less than the result of a maximum damage on a normal success, use the maximum damage on the success instead.

If you spent three actions and your attack was a critical success, then you deal maximum damage and double the damage of that result as normal.

Kill Steal.name: Kill Steal
Kill Steal.description:
Trigger An ally ends their turn.

Requirements You're wielding a gun and an enemy was hit two or more times by the same ally this turn.

You fire a quick shot at a creature your ally is focusing their attacks on. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} at a creature that meets the requirements, then make a Strike against that creature.

Kindle Blaze.name: Kindle Blaze
Kindle Blaze.description:
Trigger You take fire damage.

Be they solar rays or blazing flames, light and heat are a part of you. For 1 minute, you glow from within, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius (and dim light to the next 30 feet). While you glow in this way, your body is flush with warmthâ€”you treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against attacks, spells, and other effects that have the cold trait.

Kiss it Better.name: Kiss it Better
Kiss it Better.description:
Requirements You have a hand free and are adjacent to an ally who isn't at full Hit Points.

You perform a token medical effort to convince an ally they've recovered from an injury. Attempt a Deception check with the same DC as for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}. On a success, the target gains half the corresponding amount of Hit Points as temporary Hit Points. These temporary Hit Points last 1 round. Kiss It Better doesn't remove the wounded condition. Increase the DC by 2 if you aren't holding or wearing a medkit. The target is temporarily immune to Kiss it Better for 24 hours.

Knight of Golarion Dedication.name: Knight of Golarion Dedication
Knight of Golarion Dedication.description: You have familiarity with all weapons in the sword weapon group. For the purposes of proficiency, treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons. If you are at least expert, you gain that weapon's critical specialization effect. You've studied lost Golarion's ancient cultures. You become trained in two of the following that you were not already trained in: Golarion Lore, Iomedae Lore, or a Lore skill associated with an ancestry or culture from Lost Golarion, such as Goblin, Halfling, Human, or Orc.

Know your Target.name: Know your Target
Know your Target.description:
Requirements One or more creatures are currently your assets.

You observe your asset to get a read on them. This involves listening to what they say, studying their body language, observing how they interact with other people and the environment, and so forth. You get an impression of their thoughts and mental capabilities. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your envoy class DC. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your Know Your Target for 1 day.

Critical Success The target becomes aware you're observing them.

Success You learn whether the target's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers are higher or lower than your own.

Failure You intuit your target's vague surface thoughts and you learn whether the target's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers are higher or lower than your own.

Critical Failure As failure, but you can intuit your target's vague surface thoughts for 1 minute. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

Large Reach.name: Large Reach
Large Reach.description: Using your large size, you can extend your reach to attack targets that are farther away. When you wield a melee weapon that requires two hands and doesn't have reach, you can change between a typical two-handed grip and an extended two-handed stretch using an Interact action. Weapons wielded in your extended stretch gain a reach of 10 feet.

Lashunta Lore.name: Lashunta Lore
Lashunta Lore.description: You become trained in Occultism and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Lashunta Lore.

Learning Experience.name: Learning Experience
Learning Experience.description: You're always interested in experiencing new sensations and opening your mind to new ideas. Before you roll damage from a persistent effect, you can choose to take half damage from the effect. When you do, you automatically fail your flat check to end the persistent damage and you can immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} as a free action to recall information related to the source of the persistent damage. If you have any special abilities or free actions that would normally be triggered when you Recall Knowledge, you can't use them with this action.

Legend Weaver.name: Legend Weaver
Legend Weaver.description: You're an incredibly talented storyteller, making legends come to life.
