You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ucf8eynbZMfUucjE]{Illusory Scene} as a 6th-rank occult innate spell. You can cast this spell once per day. When you cast illusory scene in this way, the spell automatically adapts to suit its audience. A deaf creature that witnesses the illusion additionally sees the characters in the scene visually signing their dialogue. A blind creature that witnesses the illusion additionally hears an audio description of the scene. A deafblind creature that witnesses the illusion additionally receives a psychic impression of the scene and its dialogue in their mind.

Lifebond.name: Lifebond
Lifebond.description: Your deep connection to the natural world allows you to communicate with all living things. You can speak with animals and speak with plants. Any creature you summon is considered part of your bond and doesn't count against the maximum number of creatures in your bond. During your daily preparations, you learn one of the following spells and can cast it as though it were a signature spell that day: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4YnON9JHYqtLzccu], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lpT6LotUaQPfinjj], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hs7h8f4Z1ZNdUt3s], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jSRAyd57kd4WZ4yE].

Light 'Em Up.name: Light 'Em Up
Light 'Em Up.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

Your opponents can run, but they can't hide! You spray your area weapon in the general direction of an unseen enemy, revealing its location. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} attack. If the primary target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, you don't need to attempt a flat check to target it, and if it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, the DC of the flat check to target it is 5. When you suppress a concealed creature with this attack, the debris around it helps reveal its current position and no flat check is needed to target it; If it is hidden, the DC of the flat check to target it becomes 5 and the creature can't become undetected. This benefit lasts as long as the creature remains @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed}.

Line 'Em Up.name: Line 'Em Up
Line 'Em Up.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You fire a single bullet that flies through multiple foes. Make a ranged Strike with your gun at a target within your first range increment. Apply this attack against all creatures in a straight line between you and your target. This attack ignores any lesser cover the targets would provide one another. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature you hit. Line 'em Up counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty.

Linguistic Mastery.name: Linguistic Mastery
Linguistic Mastery.description: You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]{truespeech} as a 5th-rank occult innate spell once per day on yourself only. You gain a +1 status bonus to Diplomacy checks for the duration of the spell when speaking to creatures with whom you already shared a language before Casting the Spell.

Linguistic Prodigy.name: Linguistic Prodigy
Linguistic Prodigy.description: Years of intense study and cultural immersion have enabled you to more easily learn new languages. You gain two additional languages of your choice, chosen from among the common and uncommon languages available to you. Every time you take the Multilingual feat, you gain another new language in addition to the two you gain from that feat.

Linnorm Bite.name: Linnorm Bite
Linnorm Bite.description: Your ancestors swore allegiance to a linnorm long ago. Though your family is no longer bound to serve the creature, a bit of its influence remains in you, manifesting in particularly long and sharp teeth. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the finesse and unarmed traits.

Living Battery.name: Living Battery
Living Battery.description:
Your body produces an overabundance of electrical energy, which you can emit as a blast of lightning or to power technological devices. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kBhaPuzLUSwS6vVf] cantrip as a divine innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

When you cast electric arc, the spell's targets become "1 or 2 creatures or tech items (in any combination)." If you target a tech item, that item isn't damaged. Instead, it gains one of the following benefits.

  • If the item is a battery, the battery regains 2 charges per spell rank.
  • If the item has a usage and is powered by a battery, that item's usage is reduced to 0 for 1 round per spell rank.
  • If the item needs a continuous external power source (such as an item plugged into an electrical outlet or power grid) and is currently off or lacking a power source, that item turns on for 1 round per spell rank.

Living Typhoon.name: Living Typhoon
Living Typhoon.description: Your destructive power has become second nature as enemies stand in awe of your overwhelming firepower. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attacks as a single action. However, you can never make more than two Area Fire or Auto-Fire attacks in the same round.

Load-Bearing Hero.name: Load-Bearing Hero
Load-Bearing Hero.description:
Trigger You and one other adjacent ally make a Reflex or Fortitude save from the same source.

Whether holding up a crumbling ceiling or jumping into a fireball, you interpose yourself between the worst effects and the rest of your party. The result of your save becomes one degree worse, but the result of your ally's save becomes one degree higher.

Long Whiskered.name: Long Whiskered
Long Whiskered.description: Your whiskers function as advanced electroreceptors, allowing you to orient yourself more easily. At the end of each round in which you are @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered}, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, you ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} conditions imposed by being in zero-g for 1 minute.

Look Alive!.name: Look Alive!
Look Alive!.description:
You warn your ally to move away from danger. You can use Watch Out! before an ally in range attempts a Reflex save in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to their Reflex save against the triggering effect.

When you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.JZxj1PyAM54d1GEP]{Watch Out!} and the triggering attack fails or critically fails, or your ally succeeds or critically succeeds at the saving throw, they can also Stride up to 10 feet as a free action. They can Fly or Swim instead of Striding if they have the corresponding movement type.

Loping Stride.name: Loping Stride
Loping Stride.description: You have endured difficult land journeys and move with an impressive pace. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

Lucky Improviser.name: Lucky Improviser
Lucky Improviser.description: You're a master improviser, with a bit of talent at everythingâ€”even if you have no idea what you're doing. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.9jGaBxLUtevZYcZO]{Untrained Improvisation} general feat. In addition, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.n6OScMCKEfSAuG1S]{Beginner's Luck} action.

Luminous Wings.name: Luminous Wings
Luminous Wings.description: Your energy wings shed bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet). You can extinguish or rekindle this light using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Machine Magic.name: Machine Magic
Machine Magic.description: You can Craft hybrid items. When you select this feat, you gain formulas for four common hybrid items of 2nd level of lower. You must have the Inventor feat to craft hybrid formulas.

Machine Saboteur.name: Machine Saboteur
Machine Saboteur.description: You were created to fight other synthetic creatures, and your attacks unleash destructive nanites that disrupt their systems. When you roll a critical hit against a creature with the tech trait, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 1}.

Magical Guardian.name: Magical Guardian
Magical Guardian.description: Your desire to protect the people you care about from harm has kindled the spark of magic in your soul, and you can share that spark with others. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.RA7VKcen3p56rVyZ]{Forbidding Ward} cantrips as divine innate spells at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up. Whenever you cast one of these spells on your bonded partner, you increase the range of the spell to 60 feet, rather than 30 feet.

Magical Linguist.name: Magical Linguist
Magical Linguist.description: You never let the inability to communicate stop you from chatting with nufriends! You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BBvV7qoXGdw09q1C]{Speak with Animals} once per day as a 2nd-rank primal innate spell, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qvwIwJ9QBihy8R0t]{Speak with Plants} once per day as a 3rd-rank primal innate spell, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vTQvfYu2llKQedmY]{Translate} once per day as a 3rd-rank primal innate spell.

Magical Savior.name: Magical Savior
Magical Savior.description: When push comes to shove, you're more than willing to give your life in place of an ally's. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yHujiDQPdtXW797e]{Spirit Link} as a 3rd-rank divine innate spell. You can cast this spell once per day. If you cast this spell on your bonded partner, spirit link is heightened to 4th-rank and you can increase the range of spirit link to 60 feet, rather than 30 feet.

Management Material.name: Management Material
Management Material.description: Whether through lucky circumstance or your own hard work, you've learned the decorum of the corporate world and are comfortable faking your way through everything from completing a routine occupational task to negotiating a high-stakes business deal. Anyone who speaks with you regarding a job, workplace, or occupational skillset assumes you are a professional in that setting unless you intentionally present yourself differently. You can use Society to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on a professional or to Impersonate a type of professional or a specific individual professional. If you use the normally required skills in those situations, you receive a +1 circumstance bonus to the check instead.

Manifold Evolution.name: Manifold Evolution
Manifold Evolution.description: You've catalogued genetic code from countless ancestries and can draw upon any of them to enhance and evolve your body. Increase the number of ancestries you can select with @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.Cyua98uitiwSFRIa]{Convergent Evolution} to six. You gain two additional ancestry feats you qualify for of 13th level or lower, chosen from among the ancestries selected with Convergent Evolution. You can retrain one or both of these selected feats once per day during your daily preparations.

Manifold Masters.name: Manifold Masters
Manifold Masters.description: You've broadened your senses and are better able to comprehend the unseen answers all around you. When you use Student of the Unseen during your daily preparations, you gain Additional Lore twice.

Mantarider.name: Mantarider
Mantarider.description: You have trained in the ceremonial art of combat mounted upon a manta and can apply your experience to other forms of mobile combat. Reduce the penalty when attacking from a vehicle that has moved within the last round to 0 (or â€“2 if the vehicle is uncontrolled or any action in the last round had the reckless trait). You don't take a penalty to Reflex saves while mounted.

Martial Disciple.name: Martial Disciple
Martial Disciple.description: You've chosen to follow the path of your deity's most warlike aspect, beginning to master the use of their favored weapon. You become trained in your deity's favored weapon. If your deity's favored weapon is uncommon, you also gain access to that weapon. If your deity's favored weapon is a simple weapon or unarmed attack, increase the damage die size of that weapon by one step when you are wielding it.

Masked.name: Masked
Masked.description: Your masked face prevents others from scrutinizing your appearance, and you've learned to leverage this uncertainty to your advantage in social situations. While your mouth is covered, increase the DC of any Perception check made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} against you by 2. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}, make a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

Masks Under Masks.name: Masks Under Masks
Masks Under Masks.description: Even if you are forced to reveal your natural appearance, you have an additional layer of security in the form of a backup shapeshifting identity. Choose one form during your daily preparations. Waving away your ability to transform as some unrelated magic or technology, you gain a +3 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to Lie that the chosen form is your true form. You can tell lies that protect your identity even against magical spells, and effects like truesight reveal the chosen form as your true form. You revert to this form if you become the target of a spell or effect that causes you to unwillingly shift back to your true form.

Master Code Cracker.name: Master Code Cracker
Master Code Cracker.description: The theoretical limits of both magic and technology are mere suggestions for a technomancer of your caliber. You can apply the original jailbreak benefits in addition to the jailbreak benefits of spells you modify with @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.tsJhRqRqLNX5bhLF]{Double Jailbreak}.

Master Plan.name: Master Plan
Master Plan.description: During your daily preparations, you can review stratagems for the day's adventures with up to five allies. Later, you can quickly advise them on your schemes using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.legVVfxhFM9dUw2Y]{New Plan!} reaction.

Master Troll.name: Master Troll
Master Troll.description:
Requirements You or your target are using a comm unit, datapad, or other computer.

You have curated a collection of viral memes and infosphere lingo, which you use as an arsenal to enhance your trickery. Attempt a @Check[type:deception|defense:will] check against the target's Will DC. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and on a critical success they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. In addition, the target's reaction gives you information about them as though you had attempted to Recall Knowledge using an appropriate skill and received the same result on your roll. The target is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Masterful Imitation.name: Masterful Imitation
Masterful Imitation.description: You've studied certain creatures enough that you can transform into them. If you are a master in a Lore skill that can be used to identify a category of creatures, you can use Change Shape to transform your appearance to that of a Small or Medium creature of that category.

Maximize Profits.name: Maximize Profits
Maximize Profits.description: You've learned to maximize your potential earnings. Whenever you would fail an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} check, you get a success instead.

Meandering Mind.name: Meandering Mind
Meandering Mind.description:
Requirements Your quantum field is active.

You allow your mind to wander to things you find pleasant, briefly shutting out all realities and protecting you from harm. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws until the start of your next turn. While your mind is meandering, if you roll a success at a saving throw against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead.

Mediator.name: Mediator
Mediator.description: You're a talented diplomat or mediator who's skilled at making a good impression and accustomed to finding compromises, brokering deals, and forging strong social connections. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Diplomacy. If you would automatically become trained in Diplomacy (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

Meditative Analysis.name: Meditative Analysis
Meditative Analysis.description: You briefly meditate on the nature of your foe and their role in the wider cosmos. Attempt a check to Recall Knowledge about a creature. If your check is successful, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next Strike with a solar weapon against the target this round. If your Strike hits, you can choose which attunement benefit you gain for that strike. The subject of your check is temporarily immune to Meditative Analysis for 1 day.

Meditative Recovery.name: Meditative Recovery
Meditative Recovery.description:
Frequency once per day

You find that meditation soothes your body and mind. You rest for 10 minutes to enter a state of deep meditation, causing you to regain a number of Hit Points equal to your level. For the following 10 minutes, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against mental effects.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.Kw4MvC1bHXcZuzEZ]{Effect: Meditative Recovery}

Memories of Ashok.name: Memories of Ashok
Memories of Ashok.description: With unparalleled focus, you can tap into and sift through the memories of every contemplative who has come before. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hp6Q64dl7xbdn4gQ]{Collective Memories} ritual once per week as the primary caster. When you do so, you can ignore the rare incense cost; if you do so, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} after completing the ritual.

Memory Matrix.name: Memory Matrix
Memory Matrix.description:
You refuse to surrender your autonomy and have erected mental bulwarks and technological protocols to safeguard your mind and memories. Whenever you attempt a Will save against a spell or effect that would give you the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} condition, roll that save twice and use the higher result (this is a fortune effect). If you would start your turn confused or controlled, you can immediately attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5]. On a success, you fight that mental control, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of your turn rather than acting against your will. If you roll a 20 on this flat check, you immediately end the confused or controlled condition.

Note: This is not automated

Memory Recovery.name: Memory Recovery
Memory Recovery.description: You retain instincts and fragmentary memories from the androids who previously occupied your body. During your daily preparations, you can tap into these archived memories to become trained in one skill of your choice. This proficiency lasts until you prepare again. Since this proficiency is temporary, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a skill increase or a permanent character option like a feat.

Menacing Laughter.name: Menacing Laughter
Menacing Laughter.description: Your laughter (or suitable war cry) can somehow be heard over the din of your weapons fire. Attempt an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each creature within 30 feet who is @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed}.

Menacing Snarl.name: Menacing Snarl
Menacing Snarl.description:
Requirements A creature within 30 feet has the frightened condition.

You snarl ferociously at a creature within 30 feet, menacing them with bared teeth. Increase the value of the target's frightened condition by 1. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your Menacing Snarl for 24 hours.

As long as the target is frightened, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to melee Strikes against that creature, and damage dealt to the creature by your melee Strikes deals an additional @Damage[1[mental]] damage per damage die.

Mental Deflection.name: Mental Deflection
Mental Deflection.description:
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell with the mental trait.

Requirements You have at least 1 Focus Point.

When a foe Casts a Spell that has the mental trait and you can see or otherwise detect its manifestations, you can use your psychic powers to disrupt it. You expend 1 Focus Point to counter the triggering creature's casting of the spell. You then attempt to counteract the triggering spell using your spellcasting counteract modifier.

Mental Interference.name: Mental Interference
Mental Interference.description:
Transfer Cost 2

Requirements You are within 30 feet of an enemy that can see you.

You project your bond into the target's mind to cause a bout of hesitation-inducing sympathy. Roll a check with your connection skill against the target's Will DC. The target is them temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Critical Success The flash of insight imposes a â€“1 status penalty to attack rolls and a â€“3 status penalty to Will saves on the target for 1 minute. This effect ends early if it uses a single action with the concentrate trait to shake off the effects of the interference or immediately after you target the creature with a hostile action.

Success As critical success, but the penalty to Will saves is â€“2.

Critical Failure The brief connection causes you to lower your guard. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the next attack the target attempts against you before the end of your next turn.

Merged Senses.name: Merged Senses
Merged Senses.description:
Frequency once per hour

Your telepathic connection with your animal companion improves, enabling you to experience the world as one. You project your senses into your animal companion. When you do, you lose all sensory information from your own body, but can sense through your familiar's body for up to 1 minute. You can Dismiss this effect.

Metabolic Manipulation.name: Metabolic Manipulation
Metabolic Manipulation.description: Through careful experimentation and selective adaptation, you've manipulated your immune system, metabolism, and internal chemistry, enabling you to better fight off illness and infection. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.N8Xz5fuW6o7GW124]{Fast Recovery} skill feat and the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.SWdnbvmfQf8BQiJX]{Targeted Immunization} action.

Metabolize Soul.name: Metabolize Soul
Metabolize Soul.description:
Frequency once per day

You force your body to metabolize a portion of your animating soul to rapidly heal your wounds and prolong your life. You regain 3d8 Hit Points plus a number of additional Hit Points equal to your level (@Damage[(3d8+@actor.level)[healing]]).

Method Actor.name: Method Actor
Method Actor.description: You create and take on new personas, completely immersing yourself in their mindset. It takes 7 days of downtime to workshop a new character. Each new character you workshop can have a totally unique set of anathema and edicts. By taking 10 minutes to center yourself, you can immerse yourself completely in the persona of a character you've workshopped. Violating that character's anathema, failing to uphold their edicts, acting incongruously with their backstory or personality, or critically failing on a Performance check as part of your character causes you to drop this persona and lose the benefits of this feat for the next 24 hours. While in character, you can use Performance in place of Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, Impersonate, Lie, Gather Information, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, or Request.

Meyel's Melody.name: Meyel's Melody
Meyel's Melody.description: Divine rhythm pulses through your blood. You gain a +2 status bonus to Performance checks. In addition, you can use Performance to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}. If you listen to music while resting, you regain a number of Hit Points equal to your level.

Mighty Guardian.name: Mighty Guardian
Mighty Guardian.description: The magical spark you use to protect others grows in power. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d7Lwx6KAs47MtF0q]{Share Life} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HTou8cG05yuSkesj]{Status} as 2nd-rank divine innate spells, once per day each.

Mind Over Matter.name: Mind Over Matter
Mind Over Matter.description: Your telekinetic capabilities extend beyond personal levitation, allowing you to handle nearby objects with precision. Your telekinesis grants you the equivalent of two additional hands, following the rules for characters with more than two hands as detailed in Starfinder Player Core. However, each of the telekinetic hands can wield only items of 1 Bulk or less. The @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oW81CfM9ebxXnrw3]{Switch Hands} action gains the contemplative trait when you switch to or from your telekinetic hands.

Mind-Blowing Spell.name: Mind-Blowing Spell
Mind-Blowing Spell.description: You cast a spell that's suffused with visual effects from another world, shocking those who interact with its casting. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, any creature that attempts to use a reaction triggered by your Cast a Spell activity takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and skill checks rolled as part of the reaction. Any creature that fails an attack roll or skill check rolled as part of the reaction takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty to AC against the spell's spell attack roll and a â€“2 circumstance penalty to saving throws against the spell.

Mindrender.name: Mindrender
Mindrender.description: You've honed your thoughts into a deadly weapon that can shatter a foe's mind. You gain a psychic shock ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet and the agile trait. The weapon deals 1d4 mental damage and is in the mental weapon group.

Mindward Shield.name: Mindward Shield
Mindward Shield.description:
Your solar shield acts as an anchor for your mind as much as your body. When you Raise your Shield, you gain the shield's circumstance bonus to Will saves.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction, damage you take as a result of a Will save can trigger that reaction, even if the damage isn't physical damage.

Mobile Aim.name: Mobile Aim
Mobile Aim.description: You're rarely still, and you've learned to reliably hit your targets even while moving. You Stride, then @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} with a gun you're wielding.

Mobile Deployment.name: Mobile Deployment
Mobile Deployment.description: You rapidly deploy your exocortex while on the move. You Stride twice. At any point during this movement, you can Deploy Mine or Deploy Turret.

Modify Drone.name: Modify Drone
Modify Drone.description: You designed the drone linked to your exocortex to be adaptable. You can apply mods to your drone as if it were a weapon, applying the benefits of those mods to any weapon in its integrated weapon mount.

Molecular Modification.name: Molecular Modification
Molecular Modification.description:
You modify your body to resist a certain type of damage. You gain resistance to acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, piercing, poison, slashing, or sonic damage equal to half your level.

Special You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, select a different damage type.

Momentum.name: Momentum
Momentum.description:
Requirements Your last action this turn was a successful melee Strike.

You use the momentum of your last attack to maneuver around the battlefield, either by leaving photonic images or making great gravity-assisted leaps. Step twice.

Graviton-Attuned Increase the movement of your Step actions to 10 feet.

Photon-Attuned You leave an afterimage in the square you moved out of at the beginning of this action. This image lasts until the end of your next turn or until another creature enters the space. This afterimage counts as an ally to you and your allies for the purposes of flanking.

Monitoring Bond.name: Monitoring Bond
Monitoring Bond.description: As long as you and your bonded partner are on the same plane of existence and both alive, you can communicate telepathically together and both remain aware of one another's present state, general direction and distance from one another, and if they are conscious, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or dying. You both know any conditions affecting one another, except those that the affected character does not know about.

Moodscales.name: Moodscales
Moodscales.description: Your scales automatically change color to match your current temperament. This has the same effect as a @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.equipment.Item.yr7MpJwceskjf46w]{Moodskin} augmentation, though it doesn't count as an augmentation and doesn't count toward your implant limit. When you select this feat, you can decide which colors correspond to each mood. Your keen awareness of your mood grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against emotion effects. If you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead.

Mounted Unity.name: Mounted Unity
Mounted Unity.description: Your ability to bear your bonded partner into battle has further improved, and you act as one body and one mind. When your bonded partner rides you as a mount, you gain three actions at the start of your turn, rather than the two you normally would.

Mournful Howl.name: Mournful Howl
Mournful Howl.description:
Requirements You're within 30 feet of an ally with the dying condition.

The sight of an ally near death overwhelms you with sorrow. In an act of frustration, you unleash a mournful, keening howl that forces your enemies to share in your heartbreak. You deal @Damage[floor((@item.level - 1)/2)d6[mental]|traits:nonlethal] nonlethal mental damage to all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] (@Check[will|against:class-spell|basic] save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher). The damage increases by 1d6 for every two levels you have beyond 13th.

Multidisciplinary Mechanic.name: Multidisciplinary Mechanic
Multidisciplinary Mechanic.description:
In addition to industrial and technological engineering, you've studied a specialized form of invention. Select either biotech, magitech, or necrotech. In addition, you become trained in the associated skill and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} feat in the associated lore.

Biotech: Your inventions incorporate synthetic or vatgrown flesh, or they might resemble hybrid organic machines. You become trained in Nature. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Biotech Lore.

Magitech: Your devices shimmer with arcane runes or hybrid circuitry, or defy reality with their strange configurations. Your exocortex's Strikes gain the magic trait. You become trained in Arcana. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Magitech Lore.

Necrotech: Your grisly tech might resemble a necrotic heart pulsating inside a metal ribcage or a bone. You become trained in Religion. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Necrograft Lore.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.zsXV8mcHVZqx6FVj]{Critical Explosion} feat and plant a mine, you can choose to deal a different type of damage depending on your choice of discipline. If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.ZSUPsqeMBDTaX2H4]{Explosive Shot} feat, when you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.neyS5TJB8fTmQEKu]{Modify} a weapon with Explosive Shot, you can choose the splash damage dealt to be a different type of damage depending on your choice of discipline. Biotech deals acid damage, magitech deals force damage, and necrotech deals void damage.

Multitalented (Starfinder).name: Multitalented (Starfinder)
Multitalented (Starfinder).description: You've learned to split your focus between multiple classes with ease. You gain a 2nd-level multiclass dedication feat, even if you normally couldn't take another dedication feat until you take more feats from your current archetype.

Multitasker.name: Multitasker
Multitasker.description: You've become so accustomed to maintaining and manipulating your network of mines, you can activate them without a thought. You're permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. You can use your extra action to Command your drone, fire your turret, or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.S3iCDy8ppR8eXp8V]{Detonate Mine}.

Multiverse Magic.name: Multiverse Magic
Multiverse Magic.description: Your paradoxical nature allows you to access magic not associated with your spellcasting tradition. You can have one spell in your spell repertoire (not one on your paradox's spell list) that is not from your spellcasting tradition. Select this spell when you select this feat. You can cast that spell as a spell of your spellcasting tradition and it becomes a signature spell. You can change the spell you choose when you gain a level.

Muzzle Flash.name: Muzzle Flash
Muzzle Flash.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You aim to distract your foe. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, then make a ranged Strike at your mark. If the Strike hits, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of your next turn if it's within your first range increment.

My Little Friend.name: My Little Friend
My Little Friend.description:
Frequency once per round

Whether it is your first, your most powerful, or just your most expensive, you have a weapon you favor over any other. You can only have one such favored weapon. If you lose your favored weapon, you can name a new one during your daily preparations. When you suppress a target with an attack from your favored weapon, attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} that creature as a free action. A creature targeted by this is immune for the next 24 hours.

Nanite Form.name: Nanite Form
Nanite Form.description:
@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.7NVUO2qlKudKzPve]{Effect: Nanite Form}

You discorporate into a swarm of nanites for up to 1 minute or until you spend a single action to return to your normal shape. You become Huge, gain the swarm trait, and gain a fly Speed of 40 feet. As a swarm, you have the following characteristics.

  • You're immune to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} conditions.
  • You have weakness 5 to area and splash damage.
  • You can occupy the same space as other creatures and must do so to use your damaging ability.
  • As a 2-action activity, you can deal @Damage[10d6[acid]] damage to all creatures sharing your space (basic Reflex save with a DC equal to your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher).
  • You can't speak, Cast Spells, use manipulate actions requiring your hands, Activate magic items, or make any Strikes with your normal body.
  • You don't gain the swarm mind ability, so you're still affected normally by mental effects.

Nanite Surge (Starfinder).name: Nanite Surge (Starfinder)
Nanite Surge (Starfinder).description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You attempt a skill check requiring 3 actions or fewer.

You stimulate your nanites, forcing your body to temporarily increase its efficiency. You gain a +2 status bonus to the triggering skill check. In addition, your circuitry glows, lighting a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] with dim light for 1 round.

Natural Ambition (Starfinder).name: Natural Ambition (Starfinder)
Natural Ambition (Starfinder).description: You were raised to be ambitious and always reach for the stars, leading you to progress quickly in your chosen field. You gain a 1st-level class feat for your class. You must meet the prerequisites, but you can select the feat later in the character creation process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.

Natural Grace.name: Natural Grace
Natural Grace.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You fail an Acrobatics check or Reflex saving throw.

You have almost supernatural control of your movements which can sometimes save you in dangerous situations. You can reroll the triggering skill check or saving throw, using the second result even if it's worse.

Natural Hunter.name: Natural Hunter
Natural Hunter.description:
You have the keen instincts of a hunter and know to go for the throat. If you're a sharp-toothed vlaka, the damage you deal with your jaws increases to 1d8, and your jaws lose the finesse trait and gain the grapple trait. Otherwise, you gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the finesse and unarmed traits.

In either case, whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die, in addition to the other effects of a critical hit.

Natural Skill (Starfinder).name: Natural Skill (Starfinder)
Natural Skill (Starfinder).description: Your ingenuity allows you to learn a wide variety of skills. You gain the trained proficiency rank in two skills of your choice.

Necrotized.name: Necrotized
Necrotized.description: You became a borai intentionally, through necromantic experimentation conducted by yourself before your death or another individual after your death. This experimentation has strengthened your defenses against death but has also made you look more like a corpse than a living being. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.I0BhPWqYf1bbzEYg]{Diehard} feat and death effects no longer kill you if they reduce you to 0 Hit Points. This keeps you from being automatically killed or from having your dying value automatically decrease, but it doesn't make you immune to other parts of the spell or effect. For example, you can still take mental damage and become frightened by a vision of death, you just don't instantly die from it.

Network Attunement.name: Network Attunement
Network Attunement.description:
Transfer Cost 5 per target

Target any number of your bonded allies within 120 feet

Temporarily attuning your vitality network to the spiritual wavelength of your allies allows them to access it as if it were second nature. Until the start of your next turn, at the beginning of each of the target's next turns they can choose to gain an additional reaction that can only be used to make transfer reactions, or gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition and can use the extra action that round for only transfer actions.

Network Connection.name: Network Connection
Network Connection.description:
You concentrate your telepathy toward a bonded ally within 120 feet and invite them into a temporary understanding of your connection. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell and the target would be affected, choose one: either that spell only affects the target, or that spell doesn't affect your target.

If the next action you use has the transfer trait and uses the same target, your vitality network regains up to 4 of those lost Hit Points; if you are master in your connection skill, it regains 6 Hit Points instead; if you are legendary, it regains 8 Hit Points. Your vitality network can never regain more Hit Points than was spent to use the transfer action and can't exceed its maximum capacity.

Network Shield.name: Network Shield
Network Shield.description:
Transfer Cost half the prevented damage

Trigger You are hit by an attack.

You condense the energy of your vitality network into a shield. Your shield's appearance is your choice, but always relates to your connection; for example, an Akashic mystic's shield might appear as a globe of glowing text, and a shadow mystic's shield might coalesce from shadows. You gain resistance equal to twice your level against all damage from the triggering attack or effect.

New Epiphany.name: New Epiphany
New Epiphany.description: Through dedication or happenstance, you've branched out to explore other connections to the fundamental building blocks of the cosmos. You learn the initial epiphany spell of the connection matching the prerequisite.

Nightvision Adaptation (Starfinder).name: Nightvision Adaptation (Starfinder)
Nightvision Adaptation (Starfinder).description: The nanites in your ocular processors have adapted to darkness, enhancing your ability to see in the dark. You gain darkvision.

Nimble Tail.name: Nimble Tail
Nimble Tail.description: You have an incredibly nimble tail that helps you balance in zero gravity; this could be a hereditary gift from your ancestors as they adapted to spaceflight or the result of personal augmentation. You can use your tail to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FF5KgZHj345s2moq]{Push Off} while in zero-g. In addition, you ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} penalties while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero gravity.

Nimbus Block.name: Nimbus Block
Nimbus Block.description: You've combined the strength of your defensive powers such that your solar nimbus bolsters your solar shield. When you Shield Block a melee attack with your solar shield, as long as either you or your shield take damage from the attack, you can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.fy5RQYfWhum3Bz9H]{Nimbus Surge} as a free action.

Not in the Face!.name: Not in the Face!
Not in the Face!.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with a melee attack.

You wave your arms to shield your face from harm and cower, acting meek and pitiful. Attempt a @Check[type:deception|defense:will] check against the triggering creature's Will DC. After the effects conclude, the triggering creature is immune to Not in the Face! for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.rtTEYQpD1VvUWc58]{Effect: Not in the Face!}

Critical Success Your attacker has second thoughts about harming you and is thoroughly thrown off. It takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty to attack and damage rolls against you until the start of its next turn.

Success Your attacker is thrown off. It takes a â€“1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against you until the start of its next turn.

Failure Your attacker is temporarily thrown off. It takes a â€“1 circumstance penalty to the triggering attack roll.

Critical Failure Your attacker is unaffected.

Objects in Motion.name: Objects in Motion
Objects in Motion.description:
Requirements Your last action was a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}.

You leverage your knowledge of energy, mass, and motion against your opponents to manipulate their battlefield positioning. The Shoved creature continues moving. They're pushed back an additional 5 feet, or 10 feet if the required Shove was a critical success. If they would collide with a solid surface due to this movement, you immediately attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} them as a free action, even if they're no longer within your reach.

Off the Top of my Head.name: Off the Top of my Head
Off the Top of my Head.description:
Frequency once per day

Your incredible processing power and near-perfect recall allow you to refocus even in stressful situations. You regain 1 Focus Point, up to your usual maximum.

Offensive Defense.name: Offensive Defense
Offensive Defense.description:
Requirements You have a forcefield upgrade in your armor or are holding a shield with the tech trait.

You overcharge your defensive screen to create a concussive blast that repulses nearby foes. You take the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} action, using your forcefield or shield instead of a weapon. This attack deals @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] damage and is in the shield group. It affects creatures within 5 feet of you and has the tracking +1 trait. A creature who fails or critically fails its Reflex save against your Area Fire is knocked back 5 feet.

If you have the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.class-features.Item.8J94LU3sVZv12P2e]{Primary Target} class feature, the follow-up Strike to Offensive Defense uses your forcefield or shield.

Special If you use a superior forcefield or shield, this attack has the tracking +2 trait; if elite, it does @Damage[3d10[bludgeoning]] damage; if ultimate, it has the tracking +3 trait; if paragon, it deals @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] damage.

Offensive Subroutine (Starfinder).name: Offensive Subroutine (Starfinder)
Offensive Subroutine (Starfinder).description: Nanites augment your attacks. You can choose to activate @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.7ekJi7J2ZPURhCVM]{Nanite Surge} when you attempt an attack roll, instead of when you attempt a skill check. If you do, you gain a +1 status bonus to the triggering attack roll.

One with the Void.name: One with the Void
One with the Void.description: The ichor pulsing through your veins is more liquified void energy than blood, and it protects your flesh from similar substances. You have void resistance equal to half your level.

Only Slightly Dead.name: Only Slightly Dead
Only Slightly Dead.description: Your living body is flush with vitality, which easily hides your ichor-filled veins from sight. You don't have to attempt Deception checks against a creature's Perception DC to successfully Impersonate yourself as a living member of your ancestry or hide your borai heritage, nor do you require a disguise kit for such Impersonations. This is a non-magical effect that doesn't protect against detection, revelation, or scrying effects. Additionally, when a creature actively attempts a Perception check against you, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to your Deception DC, but only for the purposes of seeing through your disguise when you're Impersonating yourself as a living member of your ancestry or otherwise attempting to hide your borai heritage.

Opening Roar.name: Opening Roar
Opening Roar.description:
At the start of a combat encounter, if you are aware of your foes and aren't attempting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, you can roll Intimidation for your initiative and can use the result to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} one foe within range.

Additionally, if you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.ePObIpaJDgDb9CQj]{Battle Cry} feat, you can Demoralize up to two creatures within 60 feet of you who you're aware of.

Opening Volley.name: Opening Volley
Opening Volley.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun and melee weapon or a combination weapon.

You shoot your target, then follow up with a melee attack to keep the pressure on your foe. Make a ranged Strike with the required weapon. If the Strike is successful, your next melee attack this round against the same target gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll.

Opportune Retort.name: Opportune Retort
Opportune Retort.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails on a melee attack roll against you.

You take advantage of the opening in your foe's defenses. Make a ranged Strike against the triggering creature.

Opportunistic Hug.name: Opportunistic Hug
Opportunistic Hug.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails on a melee Strike's attack roll against you.

Requirements The triggering creature is within your reach, you have at least one free active hand, and your target is no more than one size larger than you.

You seize the opportunity to give your foe a big hug to help them feel better or calm down. You attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the triggering creature.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.KxaYlC50zzHysJj8]{Titan Wrestler} skill feat, you can use Opportunistic Hug against creatures up to two sizes larger than you, or up to three sizes larger than you if you're legendary in Athletics.

Otherworldly Spell.name: Otherworldly Spell
Otherworldly Spell.description: Your spell has an odd appearance or cosmetic effect. It seems to come from another world, making it harder to identify and counter. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, creatures with the ability to Cast that Spell don't automatically know what the spell is. In addition, creatures that witness your spellcasting take a â€“2 circumstance penalty to checks to identify the spell with Recall Knowledge and checks to counteract the spell and its effects.

Out of the Park.name: Out of the Park
Out of the Park.description: The explosive force of your attacks can send an enemy flying. When you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.iSlWZqm8Qswm4eTe]{Scattering Fire}, the primary target of your area attack is pushed outside of the furthest edge of your area attack instead of being Shoved.

Overclock Focus.name: Overclock Focus
Overclock Focus.description:
Trigger You cast a non-cantrip spell that is not jailbroken.

Requirements Your gear is overclocked.

Your magical circuit becomes part of your thought routines. You route the excess energy from your spell back into yourself, regaining 1 Focus Point.

Overclock Spell.name: Overclock Spell
Overclock Spell.description:
Transfer Cost the spell's rank

You infuse your magic with vital energy that empowers the target of your spell. If your next action is to cast a spell, bonded creatures you target with that spell becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of your next turn and can use the extra action each round for only Strike and Stride actions.

Overclock Spell Database.name: Overclock Spell Database
Overclock Spell Database.description:
Trigger You cast a non-cantrip spell that is not modified by Jailbreak Spell.

Requirements Your gear is overclocked.

You route the excess energy from your spell into your spell database. Once during the next minute, you can Cast a Spell directly from your spell cache, up to the same rank as the triggering spell, without using a spell slot.

Overcome Shame.name: Overcome Shame
Overcome Shame.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger You critically fail a melee or ranged Strike against an enemy.

You clear your mind of distractions and focus on your foe, determined to overcome the shame of your dishonorable failure lest it forever blemish your reputation. The next time you attempt to Strike the triggering creature before the end of your turn using the same weapon you used for the triggering Strike, you roll the attack roll twice and use the higher result. If the attack roll fails, you become overwhelmed with shame, gaining the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition until the end of your next turn.

Overcrowd (Starfinder).name: Overcrowd (Starfinder)
Overcrowd (Starfinder).description: Your physiology is slight, and you can pack into small spaces with others of similar stature. As long as you are Small, you can end your movement in the same square as a Small ally. Only two creatures total can share the same space when using this ability or a similar one.

Overkill.name: Overkill
Overkill.description: Sometimes there's no better way to assure success than to pin a hapless enemy with concentrated firepower. When you suppress a target of an attack with an area or automatic weapon and only one creature was in the area of the attack, or you used the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.UXJXXzfsc5rB4IPW]{Concentrated Shot} feat, the target takes persistent bleed damage equal to a single one of your weapon dice. If you critically hit with your primary target Strike, add a second die to the persistent damage.

Overvolt Resistor.name: Overvolt Resistor
Overvolt Resistor.description:
You overcharge your spell to arc past your enemy's defenses. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, the spell ignores an amount of the target's resistance to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage equal to your level. This applies to all damage the spell deals, including persistent damage and damage caused by an ongoing effect of the spell, such as the wall created by wall of fire. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, you deal damage equal to your level even if the target is immune to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. Only ignore the first listed immunity this way, even if the target has immunities to multiple listed damage types.

Overwatch.name: Overwatch
Overwatch.description:
Trigger A @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} creature within the first range increment of your ranged weapon makes a ranged attack or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You concentrate fire on a specific target operating within your weapon's threat range. Make a ranged Strike against that triggering creature. If using a weapon with the area trait, treat this as a Strike made using primary target. If your attack is a critical hit and the triggering action was a move action, you disrupt that action. Ignore the unwieldy trait on your weapon when using this reaction.

Overwhelming Assault.name: Overwhelming Assault
Overwhelming Assault.description: You overcome the defenses of @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} foes. Your multiple attack penalty for attacks against suppressed targets is â€“4 (â€“3 with an agile weapon) on your second attack of the turn instead of â€“5, and â€“8 (â€“7 with an agile weapon) on your third or subsequent attack of the turn, instead of â€“10.

Overwhelming Ego.name: Overwhelming Ego
Overwhelming Ego.description: You can focus your mental Strikes with truly devastating precision. Whenever you critically hit using your psychic shock unarmed Strike, you get its critical specialization effect. The first time each round you hit an enemy you can sense with your thoughtsense using a psychic shock Strike, you deal an additional @Damage[1d4[persistent,mental]] damage to your target.

Overwhelming Shot.name: Overwhelming Shot
Overwhelming Shot.description: You pierce through your foe's resistance with a well-timed shot. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, then make a Strike at your mark and select one of the following damage types: acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, mental, piercing, poison, slashing, or sonic damage. Your shot ignores an amount of the target's resistance to the selected damage type equal to your level. If the creature has a weakness to the selected damage type, increase that weakness by an amount equal to half your level. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

Pahtra Lore.name: Pahtra Lore
Pahtra Lore.description: You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics and Performance. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Pahtra Lore.

Pardon Me!.name: Pardon Me!
Pardon Me!.description: You distract your foes with a clever comment as you maneuver around them. You can use Deception instead of Acrobatics to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through}. When you successfully Tumble Through using Deception, the foe whose space you passed through is @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the end of its next turn.

Parkour.name: Parkour
Parkour.description:
Frequency once per round

You dash forward, unhindered by obstacles or walls. Stride up to your Speed. You must start your movement on a horizontal surface. During this movement, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} over obstacles and gaps, and run up vertical surfaces, like walls, at your full Speed. If you end the Stride off the ground, you fall after taking your next action, or when your turn ends, whichever comes first (though you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}, if applicable).

Partitioned Focus.name: Partitioned Focus
Partitioned Focus.description:
Frequency once per day

Your brain can process complex calculations subconsciously and save the answers for when they're needed most. You gain 1 Focus Point. If you don't spend this Focus Point by the end of this turn, you lose it.

Peek.name: Peek
Peek.description: You attack, then duck out of the way to avoid retaliation and errant gunfire. Make a ranged Strike, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}.

Percussive Maintenance.name: Percussive Maintenance
Percussive Maintenance.description:
Requirements You are holding a tech item that has the glitching condition. You try to repair an item by smashing it against a hard surface. Attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:10].

Critical Success Reduce the glitching condition by 2.

Success Reduce the glitching condition by 1.

Perfectly Attuned.name: Perfectly Attuned
Perfectly Attuned.description: You have absolute control and understanding of your attunement with the stellar forces of the cosmos. If you would become graviton or photon-attuned, you instead become perfectly-attuned. When you are perfectly-attuned, you can choose which attunement bonus to benefit from (either graviton or photon-attuned) when using any of your abilities. If any of your abilities require you to be in a specific attunement state, being perfectly-attuned counts as your choice of graviton or photon-attuned.

Perfectly Balanced.name: Perfectly Balanced
Perfectly Balanced.description: You have come closer to finding balance between two extremes of energy, learning how to expel or draw in excess heat when necessary. You gain resistance 5 to cold and fire. Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.XVudQmpGOVKJ9Vsy]{Redirect Energy} reaction.

Permanent Mod.name: Permanent Mod
Permanent Mod.description: As a 10-minute activity with the concentrate and manipulate traits, you can apply one permanent mod to a non-consumable item. This mod does not count toward your total number of maintained mods and lasts until you next apply a mod in this way.

Persistent Confidence.name: Persistent Confidence
Persistent Confidence.description: Even if nobody believes in you, you believe in yourself. You can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.acXO91SG91Rrft1d]{Confident Actualization} once per hour, rather than once per day.

Persistent Protection.name: Persistent Protection
Persistent Protection.description: You trust that your deceased bonded partner is with you, even from beyond the grave. You can use Spirit's Protection once per hour, rather than once per day.

Persistent Quantum Field.name: Persistent Quantum Field
Persistent Quantum Field.description:
Frequency once per day

By spending more time to manifest it you can create a stable quantum field. This functions as @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.WtIVuQcabH6Gqg6i]{Warp Reality} with a duration of 1 minute.

Pharmaceutical Crafting.name: Pharmaceutical Crafting
Pharmaceutical Crafting.description: You can Craft medicinal items and poisons, though some have other requirements. When you select this feat, you gain formulas for four common pharmaceutical items of 2nd level or lower.

Phishing Expertise.name: Phishing Expertise
Phishing Expertise.description: You are skilled at phishing fraud schemes that disguise your infosphere accounts, digital fingerprint, and other data to fool users into giving you valuable information. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ftG89SjTSa9DYDOD]{Create a Forgery} using Computers instead of Society. Digital forgeries are compared against your Computers DC. Using information gained from a successful forgery usually requires additional checks, including Deception and Society, and casting too wide a net runs the risk of a potential victim figuring out your ruse and turning you in to the authorities.

Phreaker.name: Phreaker
Phreaker.description: You've learned how to hack using traditional methods that are more convenient but often less secure, such as calling a data center's automatic help line and entering a unique tone to access a connected server. You can use Computers to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.RF8xNJ8QsMwogerB]{Hack} a system using any computer, comm unit, or terminal instead of a hacker's toolkit. If you are expert in Computers and the equipment you use is at least 3rd level, you gain a +1 item bonus to Disable a Device or Hack.

Pin Down.name: Pin Down
Pin Down.description:
Requirements Your last action was an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack, and you are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You can @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppress} creatures in your blast zone by pinpointing a shot to impact near them. Select one creature that was in the area of effect of your prior attack. That creature must attempt a save against your attack again, as though it were in the area of effect from the prior attack. This effect suppresses the target, but doesn't deal damage or create any of your attack's normal effects.

Pinpoint Thoughtsense.name: Pinpoint Thoughtsense
Pinpoint Thoughtsense.description: You can track the minds around you with astonishing precision. Your thoughtsense becomes a precise sense.

Pirate Spell.name: Pirate Spell
Pirate Spell.description: You're quick to copy and paste spells you like into your cache. When you successfully use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.onqxEjE7qYDBT6nV]{Counterspell} to counteract a spell that affects targeted creatures or an area, you can install a temporary copy of that spell into your spell cache that lasts until you use Download a Spell to replace a prepared spell with the temporary copy or your next daily preparations, whichever comes first.

Pirate's Parry.name: Pirate's Parry
Pirate's Parry.description:
Trigger An adjacent enemy attempts a melee Strike against you.

Requirements You are wielding a gun and a melee weapon with the agile trait or a phase cutlass.

You parry the triggering Strike with your melee weapon, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC against the attack. If the triggering Strike is a critical failure, you may attempt a ranged Strike against the triggering creature. This ranged Strike does not trigger reactions from the target.

Planetary Bond.name: Planetary Bond
Planetary Bond.description:
Your bond has grown into a kinship with all that lives on your planet. You're constantly under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BBvV7qoXGdw09q1C]{Speak With Animals} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qvwIwJ9QBihy8R0t]{Speak With Plants} while on your planet. You are considered a native of any planet in your bond. Creatures native to your planet feel an instinctual connection to you, granting a +2 to Diplomacy checks when making a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} from them. Particularly helpful creatures may agree to minor tasks like delivering messages or spying on an area, but they won't do dangerous jobs or fight for you.

You vow to protect your bonded world. Gain the following edicts and anathemas.

Edicts defend your world from extraterrestrial threats, protect its natural resources from exploitation, form bonds with lifeforms on your planet

Anathemas disturb or harm your planet's ecosystem, plunder your planet's natural resources, exploit your planet's lifeforms

If your powers are lost due to anathema, you lose the effects of this feat and cannot bond with another planet only if you repent by conducting an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual.

Planetary Reincarnation.name: Planetary Reincarnation
Planetary Reincarnation.description: Your bonded world revives you. Add breath of life to your primal spell list. When casting breath of life while on a bonded planet, if the target of the spell is a member of your bond, the spell gains the transfer trait and you can restore additional Hit Points equal to the transfer cost you pay as part of casting the spell (or double the transfer cost if you the target follows the edicts and anathema of Planetary Bond). If you are on a bonded planet, you can cast breath of life on yourself when you would die, even if you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

Plant Rumor.name: Plant Rumor
Plant Rumor.description:
Trigger A check is attempted using Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation compared with a creature's Will DC.

You intercede in a conversation to subtly damage a creature's reputation and make their argument less compelling. The creature targeted by the check gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Will DC for that check.

Plasma Ejection.name: Plasma Ejection
Plasma Ejection.description:
You unleash an ejection of plasma, hitting every creature in your choice of a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] centered on yourself or in a @Template[type:line|distance:30]. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2)+1)d6[fire]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC. A creature that critically fails its save takes @Damage[1d8[persistent,electricity]] damage.

Graviton-Attuned A creature failing the save is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Photon-Attuned Increase the fire damage to d8s.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6 (or 1d8 if you're photon-attuned).

Plated Deflection.name: Plated Deflection
Plated Deflection.description: You've mastered using your own plate scales or worn armor to absorb devastating strikes. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.996KZtdnXGPSYtgs]{Plate Deflection} reaction.

Plentiful Adaptation.name: Plentiful Adaptation
Plentiful Adaptation.description: You can transform your limbs more often. The frequency of @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.q65trZhn6OgdxRxN]{Adaptive Locomotion} becomes at will.

Plentiful Synthesis.name: Plentiful Synthesis
Plentiful Synthesis.description: Your body can create and metabolize remedies regularly. The frequency of Synthesize Medicinal increases to once per hour, rather than once per day.

Power Slide.name: Power Slide
Power Slide.description:
1 to 3 actions

You throw the vehicle into a barely controlled skid, turning sharply to evade pursuit. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.OxF2dvUCdTYHrnIm]{Drive} with a â€“2 penalty to your Piloting check, gaining the effects of the Drive action for the same number of actions you spent to Power Slide. At the end of the movement, if you succeed, you can turn the vehicle up to 90 degrees. If you critically succeed at your Piloting check, you can instead turn the vehicle up to 180 degrees.

Powerful Exhalation.name: Powerful Exhalation
Powerful Exhalation.description: Your ability to breathe energy is unparalleled. The area of your Dragonkin Breath increases to a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] and the damage dice are d6s instead of d4s. If you have the critical specialization effect of any weapon, a creature that gets a critical failure on their Reflex save against your dragonkin breath are affected by its corresponding critical weapon specialization effect.

Practiced Escape.name: Practiced Escape
Practiced Escape.description:
Trigger A creature grabs, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilizes}, or restrains you.

You've trained in close quarters combat and react instinctively to attempts to pin you down or keep you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. If you succeed or critically succeed, you can also Stand or Step.

Predator's Eye.name: Predator's Eye
Predator's Eye.description: Through a combination of experience and primal magic, you've developed a bestial eye that can see as well as any predator. You gain darkvision.

Predatory.name: Predatory
Predatory.description:
Battle is a dance, and you've honed your body into an instrument as exquisite as it is deadly. When you select this feat, you gain your choice of a claw unarmed attack or a jaws unarmed attack. Both of these attacks are in the brawling weapon group.

A claw unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing damage and has the agile, finesse, pahtra, and unarmed traits.

A jaws unarmed attack deals 1d6 piercing damage and has the finesse, grapple, pahtra, and unarmed traits.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these attacks, you get its critical specialization effect.

Special You can take this feat a second time. If you do, select the second attack from the options above.

Predict Outcome.name: Predict Outcome
Predict Outcome.description:
Frequency once per hour

You spend 10 minutes opening yourself to the mysteries of the multiverse by peering across the timelines or analyzing probability simulations. You gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury}, except you learn only about the dangers ahead; any results of "good" are instead "nothing," and results of "mixed" are instead "bad." If you are legendary in Arcana or Occultism, you take only 1 minute to Predict Outcome.

Predictive Positioning.name: Predictive Positioning
Predictive Positioning.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger An enemy damages you.

You react to danger by repositioning to a space you would occupy in a different reality, free from incoming danger. You gain resistance to all damage against the triggering attack equal to 2 + your level. You instantly teleport up to your Speed to an area within your quantum field. This movement doesn't trigger reactions based on movement and ignores hazards and terrain, but can't pass through walls or other such obstructions.

Prehensile Tail.name: Prehensile Tail
Prehensile Tail.description: Your tail functions like an extra limb and is capable of some precision tasks. You can wield and hold one extra hand's worth of weapons and equipment with your tail, and you can use your tail to perform Interact actions. You tail is considered one pair of hands for the purposes of designating your active hands with the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oW81CfM9ebxXnrw3]{Switch Active Hands} action.

Press-Gang the Soul.name: Press-Gang the Soul
Press-Gang the Soul.description:
Trigger You reduce an enemy to 0 Hit Points with a phase cutlass.

Your phase cutlass steals some of the enemy's vitality, press-ganging it into eternal servitude. As long as you are wielding a @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.equipment.Item.vq4W4iN2SBH44gJW]{Phase Cutlass} with stolen vitality, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.ahrdUKm1HXw7EyFw]{Wisp Ally} as a divine innate spell at will, heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level. You can only have active wisps up to the number of enemies you've press-ganged with your void cutlass. The first time each round you Strike with your phase cutlass, you immediately gain the effects of the Sustain a Spell action, which you can use only to extend the duration of and control a wisp ally spell cast using that phase cutlass.

Prismatic Display.name: Prismatic Display
Prismatic Display.description: You rapidly shift the colors of your skin to throw off the senses of those around you. Attempt a @Check[deception|against:perception] check against the Perception DCs of all creatures within melee reach. On a success, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of your turn (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical success). Regardless of the result of your check, each creature is then temporarily immune to Prismatic Display for 10 minutes.

Prismeni Lore.name: Prismeni Lore
Prismeni Lore.description:
As someone touched by the Drift, you've learned how to remain hidden and navigate the wider cosmos. You become trained in Piloting and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Prismeni Lore.

Programmer.name: Programmer
Programmer.description: You can write computer programs. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} using Computers, spending your time programming apps for clients. You can also program your own apps by Crafting items with the virtual trait. You can help Craft tech items that don't have the virtual trait with characters who have the Fabricator or Machine Magic skill feats, but you can only cover half the item's cost in raw materials.

Programming Prodigy.name: Programming Prodigy
Programming Prodigy.description: You are adept at learning and writing new code. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.v7Bt6hjmzYnLFLeG]{Magical Shorthand} skill feat without needing to meet its prerequisites. Further, when you roll a critical failure on your check to Learn a Spell, you get a failure instead.

Proleptic Parry.name: Proleptic Parry
Proleptic Parry.description:
Trigger A Telepredicted creature targets you with a mental effect.

Requirements You have a bonus against the target using Telepredict.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Will saving throws against the triggering effect. Increase this bonus to +2 if you've dealt mental damage to the target since the last time you used Telepredict. If you roll a critical success on the saving throw, the target takes @Damage[5d4[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of your next turn.

Propulsive Shield.name: Propulsive Shield
Propulsive Shield.description:
You fire blasts of solar energy through your raised shield, harnessing its gravitational force to propel your attacks. When you use Solar Shot while you have your Solar Shield raised, you can deal 1 damage per damage die of your Solar Shot to your solar shield (bypassing its Hardness). If you do, increase the Solar Shot's range by 10 feet and add effects based on your attunement.

Graviton-Attuned Add bludgeoning damage equal to the amount dealt to your solar shield. Gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} attempt on a critical success.

Photon-Attuned Add fire damage equal to the amount dealt to your solar shield. Increase the persistent fire damage on a critical success to [[/r 1d8]].

Protect the Pack.name: Protect the Pack
Protect the Pack.description:
Requirements You're adjacent to an ally.

You're determined to protect your allies from harmâ€”even if it hurts! Select one adjacent ally. Until the beginning of your next turn, you shield them with your body; any lesser cover you grant them is instead standard cover, though they can't use standard cover granted by you to Hide.

Protective Subroutine (Starfinder).name: Protective Subroutine (Starfinder)
Protective Subroutine (Starfinder).description: Your nanites augment your defenses. You can choose to activate @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.7ekJi7J2ZPURhCVM]{Nanite Surge} when you attempt a saving throw instead of when you attempt a skill check. If you do, you gain a +2 status bonus to the triggering saving throw.

Proximity Alert Mines.name: Proximity Alert Mines
Proximity Alert Mines.description: Whenever you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ccVcznj9KVYHLVaY]{Deploy a Mine}, you can choose to make the deployed mine a proximity alert mine. If you do, the mine automatically @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.S3iCDy8ppR8eXp8V]{Detonates} when a creature enters or leaves a square within the burst area of the mine. This does not take an action, and you can't choose to delay the mine's detonation when it would trigger.

Psychic Bully.name: Psychic Bully
Psychic Bully.description: You can leverage your telepathic abilities to influence the minds of others, imparting orders or enflaming fears. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aIHY2DArKFweIrpf]{Command} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} as 1st-rank innate occult spells. You can Cast each Spell once per day.

Psychic Constellation.name: Psychic Constellation
Psychic Constellation.description: You effortlessly juggle an assortment of gear with your telepathy, giving you the appearance of a solar cerebellum orbited by planetoid items.
