You gain a second set of telekinetic hands, per Mind Over Matter, granting a typical contemplative six hands total. While at least one of your telekinetic hands is empty, you can deflect incoming attacks, granting your fist attack the parry trait. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.fQJ8xyZH3Dch5xtN]{Eccentric Orbit} free action.

Psychic Investigator.name: Psychic Investigator
Psychic Investigator.description: You can use your telepathic abilities to quickly assess your circumstances or subtly glean information from the minds of others. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ZYoC630tNGutgbE0]{hypercognition} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC]{mind reading} as 3rd-rank occult innate spells. You can cast each of these occult innate spells once per day.

Psychic Mastery.name: Psychic Mastery
Psychic Mastery.description: Your psychic abilities have grown stronger allowing you to tap into entirely new dimensions of psychic power. Choose one common 2nd-rank spell from the occult spell list. You can Cast that Spell as an innate occult spell once per day.

Psychic Paragon.name: Psychic Paragon
Psychic Paragon.description: Your psychic abilities have grown stronger. Choose one common 6th-rank spell from the occult spell list. You can cast that spell as an occult innate spell once per day.

Psychic Scholar.name: Psychic Scholar
Psychic Scholar.description: You can transfer vast amounts of information to the minds of others in mere moments. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D442XMADp01qJ7Cs]{Mindlink} as a 1st-rank innate occult spell twice per day.

Psychic Talent.name: Psychic Talent
Psychic Talent.description: Your psychic abilities have developed beyond simple communication. Choose one cantrip from the occult spell list. You can cast this cantrip as an occult innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Pungent Astrazoan.name: Pungent Astrazoan
Pungent Astrazoan.description: You emit the reeking smell of rotting meat when you disgorge your stomach. While you can thoroughly mask the scent by shapeshifting to eat like other species, disgorging your stomach to intentionally emit this vile odor can come in handy when you are trying to dissuade predators, whether they are hungry beasts or murderous mobsters. You become trained in Deception and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.HEBXaS656MZTiWFu]{Lengthy Diversion} skill feat as a bonus feat, even if you don't meet its prerequisites.

Punishing Salvo.name: Punishing Salvo
Punishing Salvo.description:
Requirements Your last action this turn was an Area Fire attack.

A concentrated barrage can bring most enemies low. You make a follow-up ranged Strike against your primary target. Ignore the unwieldy trait on your weapon when using this action. This does not make a new area attack, and is treated as a Strike made using primary target.

Push It.name: Push It
Push It.description: You can push your vehicle's performance beyond the limits envisioned by its makers. Whenever you succeed at a Piloting check, the vehicle you are piloting gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to all its Speeds until the end of your turn. If you critically succeed, this bonus increases to +15 feet.

Quantum Aura.name: Quantum Aura
Quantum Aura.description: Each time you use Warp Reality to activate your quantum field, you can choose for your quantum field to be an aura around you that moves with you. If you do, your Warp Reality action gains the aura trait and the quantum field you create is a 10-foot-radius emanation targeting you.

Quantum Entanglement.name: Quantum Entanglement
Quantum Entanglement.description: You prevent creatures from leaving your quantum field and returning to reality. Until the start of your next turn, any creature who begins their turn inside your quantum field must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] saving throw against your witchwarper class DC to move outside your quantum field. On a failure, the action is disrupted. A creature who succeeds at this save is immune to your Quantum Entanglement for 24 hours.

Quantum Negation.name: Quantum Negation
Quantum Negation.description: You expose a target to a reality in which they don't exist. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.v36BFgWfkkfJ07Gq]{quantum negation} warp spell.

Quantum Recycle.name: Quantum Recycle
Quantum Recycle.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You cast a 2nd rank or higher spell where the spell targets a creature or area within your quantum field.

You expertly manipulate the effects of your quantum field to ensure that some of the energy from your spell is preserved and can be harnessed again. You regain an expended spell slot one spell rank lower than the triggering spell.

Quantum Research.name: Quantum Research
Quantum Research.description: You become a true embodiment of your paradox and surpass what mortals can achieve in your reality. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

Quantum Transposition.name: Quantum Transposition
Quantum Transposition.description: You reposition your quantum field by slipping it through a crack in the fabric of reality to a new position within 100 feet. You can't use this feat if your quantum field is an emanation.

Quick Install.name: Quick Install
Quick Install.description: You take only 1 minute to Install an Upgrade. If you're legendary in Crafting, you can Install an Upgrade as a 3-action activity.

Quick Stow (Starfinder).name: Quick Stow (Starfinder)
Quick Stow (Starfinder).description:
Frequency once per round

You are adept at quickly moving items into your cheek pouches. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} to store one held item in your cheek pouches (provided it fits).

Quick Swap.name: Quick Swap
Quick Swap.description:
Trigger You are wielding a two-handed weapon and an enemy creature moves adjacent to you.

You can switch weapons in stressful situations to quickly set yourself up to punish incoming foes. You stow your current weapon and draw another two-handed weapon. If you have multiple sets of arms, you can instead choose a set to become active.

Quickened Processor.name: Quickened Processor
Quickened Processor.description: You can quickly identify your surroundings, and you can use that information to your advantage while in the midst of danger or while in the process of piloting vehicles in hazardous situations. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks for initiative rolls and a +2 circumstance bonus to Piloting checks for initiative rolls.

Quine Relay.name: Quine Relay
Quine Relay.description:
Trigger Your turn begins.

You run a simple routine that maintains your spells without much effort. You immediately gain the effects of the Sustain a Spell action, allowing you to extend the duration of one of your active technomancer spells.

Quip.name: Quip
Quip.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet is damaged by an ally's Strike.

You follow up on your ally's success by hurling a cunning, well-timed taunt at a foe. Attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

Radiant Bonds.name: Radiant Bonds
Radiant Bonds.description: When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.y9tYChycW6xcdT7J]{Transfer Vitality}, once you finish transferring Hit Points, you can select another ally to be the target of Transfer Vitality without spending additional actions. You can continue this process for each ally in your bond.

Radiant Zone.name: Radiant Zone
Radiant Zone.description:
The reality you conjure is much brighter than your own. The area of your quantum field becomes bright light. Creatures in your quantum field must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your class DC; creatures with light blindness treat their result as one step worse.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round and dazzled for 1 minute. The creature can spend an Interact action rubbing its eyes to end this blinded condition.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't use an Interact action to end the blinded condition.

Range Sniper.name: Range Sniper
Range Sniper.description:
You've trained to engage your foes from afar and leverage your keen vision to improve your accuracy. You reduce the penalty for attacking beyond your first range increment by 1, to a minimum of 0. If you're in a vacuum, you instead reduce the penalty for attacking beyond your first range increment by 2, to a minimum of 0.

In addition, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.K2wMNyK4JGwgrjVL]{Line Up the Shot} action.

Raptor's Eye.name: Raptor's Eye
Raptor's Eye.description: Your eye magnifies distant targets as well as a scope. You can adjust your sight in that eye as a single action to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} a specific creature with a +2 circumstance bonus to your Perception check, or Seek to search a 10-foot square up to 100 feet away for any undetected or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creatures or objects. You don't take penalties for an object or creature being too far away unless you are more than 2 miles away.

Reactive Firewall.name: Reactive Firewall
Reactive Firewall.description:
Requirements Your gear is overclocked.

A wall of data bursts from your overclocked gear to shield you from harm. The attacker must roll its attack roll a second time and take the lower result.

Reactive Shapeshifting.name: Reactive Shapeshifting
Reactive Shapeshifting.description:
Trigger You roll initiative.

You can change at a moment's notice. You Change Shape and gain a +2 circumstance bonus on the triggering initiative roll if you used Deception to roll initiative.

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You lash out at an occupied foe. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Ready For Trouble.name: Ready For Trouble
Ready For Trouble.description: You learned your lesson after one-too-many encounters with deadly mechanisms and rigged ruins. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.Sjq5APWrjTGUl5zO]{Danger Awareness} feat. You can use Delve Lore to disarm traps from alien or historically significant locations.

Ready Reload.name: Ready Reload
Ready Reload.description:
Requirements You're wielding a two-handed ranged weapon with a reload of 2 or more, and your last action was an attack action that consumed ammunition from the weapon.

Reloading a weapon can be a delicate process, but you've mastered how to do so in the middle of combat, beginning the process while still in the act of firing your weapon. You Interact to reload your weapon, reducing its reload cost by 1. Unlike most Interact actions, you don't need a free hand to reload your ranged weapon in this way.

Ready for Anything.name: Ready for Anything
Ready for Anything.description: When you aren't proactively directing allies, you can focus on a situation's shifting circumstances and prepare to react. At the end of each of your turns, if you didn't use an envoy directive that turn, you gain one additional reaction, which you can use before the beginning of your next turn for any envoy reaction.

Ready to Roll.name: Ready to Roll
Ready to Roll.description:
Trigger You roll initiative.

You instinctively react to trouble by directing your allies to act at the exact moment that their intervention would matter most. Take an action that has the directive trait. The directive lasts until the end of your first turn. If you lead by example for this directive during your first turn, the directive lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

Reality's Anchor.name: Reality's Anchor
Reality's Anchor.description: You're akin to an anchor for the reality that you exist within and can achieve a deeper focus when given time to meditate on your nature. Whenever you Refocus, completely refill your focus pool and gain one bonus focus point until your next daily preparations.

Realized Epiphany.name: Realized Epiphany
Realized Epiphany.description:
Transfer Cost 20

Frequency once per minute

You've come to learn that your vitality network isn't just a manifestation of your magic, it's a metaphysical manifestation of your magic's will. If your next action is to cast an epiphany spell, you don't spend a Focus Point to cast it.

Rebel's Scrutiny.name: Rebel's Scrutiny
Rebel's Scrutiny.description: You've come to realize that your people are being taken advantage of, and have refined your collaboration instinct in response, developing a keen eye toward power dynamics and injustice and training yourself to help only those who deserve it. Ignore all penalties from the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.class-features.Item.DNGzeVZPYMKFuwbh]{Overeager Enthusiasm} ability. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive}, and a +1 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}.

Refined Chassis.name: Refined Chassis
Refined Chassis.description: You've further upgraded your drone. It becomes a graceful or burly companion.

Reflect Spell.name: Reflect Spell
Reflect Spell.description: When you successfully use Counterspell to counteract a spell that affects targeted creatures or an area, you can turn that spell's effect back on its caster. When reflected, the spell affects only the original caster, even if it's an area spell or it would normally affect more than one creature. The original caster can attempt a save and use other defenses against the reflected spell as normal.

Reflexive Hypotheses.name: Reflexive Hypotheses
Reflexive Hypotheses.description:
No matter how engrossed you are in other tasks, part of your mind can't help but stay curious about your surroundings.

You become trained in a Lore skill about a specific environment, planet, plane, or settlement. You can move at full Speed while using the Investigate activity.

Choose one of the following: Arcana, Nature, Occultism, Religion, or Society. While using any other exploration activity, you also Investigate your surroundings, though only to Recall Knowledge using the chosen skill and any Lore skills you have.

Relentless Aim.name: Relentless Aim
Relentless Aim.description: When determining if you have line of effect to a target you've aimed at, you can choose one solid surface within your weapon's first range increment to ricochet your shot to hit your target. You must be aware of the target and its position, and do not need to attempt a flat check to affect a hidden creature. If the creature is undetected, the GM still rolls a flat check in secret to see if you missed, but the flat check becomes DC 5.

Relentless Endurance.name: Relentless Endurance
Relentless Endurance.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You take damage.

You come back stronger, ready to continue the fight and push onward in battle. You gain 1d8+4 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute. Increase this amount by 1d8+4 for every 4 levels you have beyond 2nd level.

Reliable Grace.name: Reliable Grace
Reliable Grace.description: You have exceptional control over your body. You can use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.P0U67IIRVAktfuil]{Natural Grace} once per hour, rather than once per day.

Remote Access.name: Remote Access
Remote Access.description: You can communicate wirelessly with technological devices within 10 feet, allowing you to attempt Computers checks on these devices without a user interface or hacking kit. If you can already attempt Computers checks at range, you increase the distance that you can do so by an additional 10 feet.

Remote Operation.name: Remote Operation
Remote Operation.description: You've learned how to operate machines from a distance by interfacing with your exocortex. You can use a hacking toolkit to operate a vehicle, and you don't need to be inside the vehicle to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.uS3qDAgOkZ7b8ERL]{Drive} it. You can remotely operate a vehicle or other machine you can see within 30 feet at the GM's discretion.

Repair Module (Starfinder).name: Repair Module (Starfinder)
Repair Module (Starfinder).description:
Frequency once per day

You trigger your body's repair programming, causing your body's nanites to heal your wounds. You gain fast healing equal to half your level for 1 minute. While Repair Module is active, you can't use other abilities that require the use of your nanites.

Resonant Weapon.name: Resonant Weapon
Resonant Weapon.description: You release a pulse of spiritual energy into one weapon you're holding, making it resonate with immaterial soul stuff. Until the beginning of your next turn, your weapon gains the effects of the ghost killer weapon fusion. At 17th level, Strikes with the weapon deal 1d6 additional spirit damage.

Restorative Shapeshifting.name: Restorative Shapeshifting
Restorative Shapeshifting.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger You use Change Shape.

You renew and reinforce your body with elements of your new form. You gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level (minimum 1) that last until the end of your next turn.

Return to the River.name: Return to the River
Return to the River.description: You have a soul-deep connection to the River Between. When you're in mortal peril, the River Between beckons you home and into its embrace. When you would die, you don't. Instead, you are encased in a cocoon of golden solar energy and disappear, teleporting across the galaxy to the River Between. [[/gmr 2d6 #days]]{2d6 days} later, this chrysalis hatches, and you emerge fully healed in a random location along the River Between in the Diaspora.

Reunite.name: Reunite
Reunite.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements You and your bonded partner are on the same planet.

With a centering breath, you fill your mind with thoughts of your bonded partner and will yourself to their side. You teleport into an unoccupied space of your choice adjacent to your bonded partner. If there is no adjacent space available, you teleport into the closest unoccupied space.

Revitalized by the Drift.name: Revitalized by the Drift
Revitalized by the Drift.description:
The Drift revitalizes your spirit and restores your vitality, healing your wounds. If you rest for 10 minutes while within the Drift, you gain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier Ã— your level (@Damage[(@actor.level *@actor.system.abilities.con.mod)[healing]]). This is cumulative with any healing you receive from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}.

Once per hour, you can focus or meditate on your inherent connection to the Drift. This is a 10-minute activity that has the concentrate and exploration traits. When you do, you are treated as if you had rested for 10 minutes while in the Drift, save that the number of Hit Points you regain from this feat is halved.

Revivification Protocol (Starfinder).name: Revivification Protocol (Starfinder)
Revivification Protocol (Starfinder).description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition and are about to attempt a recovery check.

Your nanites are programmed to automatically revive you. You're restored to 1 Hit Point, lose the dying and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions, and can act normally on this turn. You gain or increase the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} condition as normal when losing the dying condition in this way.

Ride the River Between.name: Ride the River Between
Ride the River Between.description: Reaching across space, you connect with the River Between and seize a fragment of its solar stream, inundating the battlefield in golden light and solar energy. This trickle of the River Between fills a @Template[type:line|distance:100] that is 10 feet in diameter, starts from your square, and remains for 1 minute. Once the river forms, you can move to any square within the river (this movement does not trigger reactions). The area is bright light and counts as a vacuum for the purposes of a sarcesian using their energy wings. Non-sarcesians in the area when you use Ride the River Between, or who later enter the area, must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class-spell] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure). Creatures affected by this ability are temporarily immune for 24 hours. The DC of this save is equal to the higher of your spell DC or class DC.

Rip Current.name: Rip Current
Rip Current.description: You have a mystical connection to the powerful currents of Kalo-Mahoi and their interactions with the blooms, and you've learned to call upon them to wash powerful outsiders away through portals between planes. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} as an 8th-rank primal innate spell that you can cast once per day. You can cast the spell targeting up to 10 willing creatures, who treat the results of their Will save as two degrees of success lower.

Robust Recovery.name: Robust Recovery
Robust Recovery.description: You learned folk medicine to help recover from diseases and poisons, and using it diligently has made you especially resilient. When you Treat a Disease or a Poison, or someone else uses one of these actions on you, increase the circumstance bonus granted on a success to +4, and if the result of the patient's saving throw is a success, the patient gets a critical success.

Rocket Boosters.name: Rocket Boosters
Rocket Boosters.description: You incorporate rocket boosters into your drone's chassis. Your drone gains a fly Speed of 20 feet. Additionally, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.RxWzbcEMvoBFduQ8]{Activate Thrusters} action.

Rocket Jump.name: Rocket Jump
Rocket Jump.description:
Requirements You are wielding an area (burst) weapon or missile launcher.

You fire your weapon as you jump, using the explosion to propel yourself to new heights or just out of a situation more dangerous than an explosion. You make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, using your weapon to add a status bonus to the distance traveled equal to double the burst or splash radius of your weapon. You must be somewhere within the area of the weapon's area attack, but you don't have to save against the effect of your attack.

Movement made as part of this action does not trigger reactions, though the Area Fire still triggers them normally.

Root Access.name: Root Access
Root Access.description: You have cracked the root access of arcane magic itself. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

Ruin Delver.name: Ruin Delver
Ruin Delver.description: You're fascinated by the ancient ruins scattered across Lajok's surface and orbit. Whether you're a scrapper harvesting materials for reuse, an innovator looking for a unique technological wonder, or a scholar hoping to glean secrets of the past, you enter these ancient sites, heedless of the danger. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find hazards, to skill checks to disable hazards, to AC against attacks made by hazards, and to saves against hazards.

Run Hot.name: Run Hot
Run Hot.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area trait.

You hold down the trigger and push your weapons to their absolute limits with a ceaseless barrage of constant firepower. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} attack with a weapon you're currently wielding. Immediately after resolving this attack, make a second Area Fire with the same weapon. Ignore the unwieldy trait on your weapon when using this action. Creatures affected by the second Strike gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their save.

After you use this action, your weapon needs to cool off and cannot be used until after your next turn or until you take any amount of cold damage.

Run, Cowards!.name: Run, Cowards!
Run, Cowards!.description: You use your weapon to help corral panicked enemies. An enemy who critically fails a save against your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round. If you were visible, they flee from you, otherwise they flee from the site of impact.

Running Shot.name: Running Shot
Running Shot.description:
Requirements You are wielding a gun.

You rush forward, firing a precisely aimed shot at your enemy while you're on the move. @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} and then Stride up to your Speed. At any point during this movement, you can make a ranged Strike with the gun you're wielding.

Safemode Spell.name: Safemode Spell
Safemode Spell.description:
You can alter offensive spells to be less deadly. If your next action is to Cast a Spell that deals damage and doesn't have the death or void trait, that spell gains the nonlethal trait.

Jailbreak If you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.EE07CnQmn8Xg4gkd]{Jailbreak Spell} to use this spellshape, you can choose to make the spell an illusion that deals nonlethal mental damage. If the spell requires a Fortitude or Reflex save, it becomes a Will save. If the spell requires a spell attack roll against AC, you make your spell attack roll against the target's Will DC instead. The spell gains the illusion and mental traits.

Sales Pitch.name: Sales Pitch
Sales Pitch.description: You've perfected the art of convincing others to see things your way. You can use [[/act make-an-impression skill=business-lore]]{Business Lore} or [[/act make-an-impression skill=corporate-lore]]{Corporate Lore} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} and, on a success or critical success, you shift your target's attitude one step higher. Whether or not Make an Impression is successful, the target becomes temporarily immune to Sales Pitch for 24 hours.

Sanctify Space.name: Sanctify Space
Sanctify Space.description:
Requirements You have a religious symbol of a deity.

Frequency once per day

You dedicate a 30-foot area to a deity by using the deity's religious symbol and saying a 10-minute prayer. If you are legendary in Religion, you can dedicate a 60-foot area. Until the next time you make daily preparations, all creatures in the area who follow the deity's edicts gain a +1 status bonus to AC, attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws against any creatures who violate the deity's anathema in the area. Once a creature violates the deity's anathema within the sanctified space, they are susceptible to this effect, even if they leave the area and return. Likewise, once a creature fails to uphold the deity's edicts while within the sanctified space, it no longer receives this bonus, even if it leaves the area and returns. Creatures who are in egregiously negative standing with a deity may not use this feat to sanctify a space for that deity, and subject to the GM's discretion, may violate that deity's anathema simply by being in a sanctified space.

Sanctuary Kin.name: Sanctuary Kin
Sanctuary Kin.description: Your magical spark wards your allies, protecting them from attacks. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8xRzLhwGL7Dgy3EZ]{Sanctuary} as a 1st-rank divine innate spell once per day. You can cast the spell as a reaction triggered when your bonded partner is the target of an attack, as long as your partner is within 40 feet and you can perceive them and their attacker. If you do, the spell has a range of 40 feet and can target only your bonded partner.

Sarcesian Lore.name: Sarcesian Lore
Sarcesian Lore.description: You've taken the lessons of your people to heart. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Arcana and Piloting. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the Additional Lore general feat for Sarcesian Lore.

Sarcesian Weapon Familiarity.name: Sarcesian Weapon Familiarity
Sarcesian Weapon Familiarity.description:
You're accustomed to fighting from afarâ€”really far! You gain access to weapons in the sniper group and all uncommon weapons with the sarcesian trait. You have familiarity with weapons in the sniper group and all weapons with the sarcesian traitâ€”for the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons, and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these weapons, you get its critical specialization effect.

Scatter Thoughts.name: Scatter Thoughts
Scatter Thoughts.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You're targeted by a mental effect.

As your ancestors once broke away from the Swarm's hive mind, you can shield your mind from detection by using similar techniques that your ancestors once mastered. You block the intruding effect by scattering your thoughts, making you immune to the triggering mental effect for the next minute.

Scattering Fire.name: Scattering Fire
Scattering Fire.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

Your overwhelming onslaught scatters enemies like leaves in the wind. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack. Enemies who fail their saves against the attack are Shoved 5 feet away (10 feet on a critical failure). If using an area (burst) weapon, the target of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} is pushed away from the center point. Your primary target is Shoved 5 feet on a hit and 10 feet on a critical hit.

A Shoved creature loses any benefits it had from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Taking Cover} (including against your follow-up Strike made against your primary target).

Scavenger.name: Scavenger
Scavenger.description: You can repurpose parts from technological creatures. You can use the body of a technological creature to help Craft items, expending it toward the item's raw material cost as well. (The GM makes the determination if the creature's entry doesn't list any valuable materials from its body.) If the creature or one of the creature's abilities, including spells, uses a trait shared by the item you're Crafting, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your check. If you spend additional days working on the item, reduce the price using the creature's level instead of your own. Certain items may require specific creatures in their Craft requirement.

Scope Sight.name: Scope Sight
Scope Sight.description: Viewing your marks through a scope is as instinctive as opening your eyes. Whenever you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, you can Interact to Activate a sight weapon upgrade.

Scramble Tech.name: Scramble Tech
Scramble Tech.description: With a thought, you can infect a technological creature or device with a short-lived virus, causing the object to glitch and malfunction. You gain @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.N4yo1ViE9yKLTHRE]{discharge} as a 3rd-rank divine innate spell. You can cast this spell twice per day.

Scrub Psyche.name: Scrub Psyche
Scrub Psyche.description:
Trigger You or an ally fail a save against a mental effect while within your quantum field.

All traces of the triggering effect are scrubbed from the target's conscious mind, allowing them to reroll a saving throw against the triggering effect. You must use the second result, even if it's worse.

Search High and Low.name: Search High and Low
Search High and Low.description:
You alert your allies to look for enemies and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} things in a stressful situation, coordinating their efforts so they can do so more efficiently. Until the beginning of your next turn, you and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}. As your envoy level increases, so does this bonus. Increase the bonus to +3 at 7th level, +4 at 12th level, and +5 at 17th level.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.mOlTj0d2wr550HnE]{Effect: Search High and Low}

Lead by Example If you Seek before the end of your turn, each of your allies within 100 feet who can sense you can also immediately Seek as a free action.

Secret Numbing Saliva.name: Secret Numbing Saliva
Secret Numbing Saliva.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements Your last action was a successful Strike with your stomach-mouth unarmed attack.

Your stomach-mouth secretes numbing saliva into your target, exposing them to the poison.

Numbing Saliva (injury, poison)

Saving Throw Fortitude

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 clumsy 1 and @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and suppressed (1 round)

Self-Destruct.name: Self-Destruct
Self-Destruct.description:
Requirements your turret is Deployed and within 100 feet.

You overload your turret's systems, causing it to selfdestruct in a volatile explosion. Your turret deals @Damage[((floor((@actor.level - 2)/2))d6)[piercing],1d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]. Creatures in the area can attempt a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save against your class DC. Your turret is destroyed.

Level (+2) The piercing damage increases by 1d6.

Self-Repairing Exocortex.name: Self-Repairing Exocortex
Self-Repairing Exocortex.description: You integrated self-repairing nanites into the casing of your exocortex. Either your drone or your turret gains fast healing 5. If it takes electricity damage, this fast healing deactivates until the end of your next turn.

Sense Abnormalities.name: Sense Abnormalities
Sense Abnormalities.description: You have a sixth sense for ambient magic. You can sense the presence of magic auras as though you were always using a 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl] spell. This detects magic in your field of vision only. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, you gain the benefits of a 3rd-rank detect magic spell on things you see (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking). You can turn this sense off and on with a free action at the start or the end of your turn.

Sense Emotions.name: Sense Emotions
Sense Emotions.description: You can detect the emotions of others, though you lack the ability to sort out the complexities of these emotions. You gain emotion sense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet. This means you can detect and determine the location of creatures that possess emotions. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected creatures within the range of your emotion sense who's under an emotion effect, such as rage, the frightened condition, or any spell with the emotion trait.

Sense Magic's Song.name: Sense Magic's Song
Sense Magic's Song.description:
You hear the thrum of magic as if it were a swirling, shifting melody, a harmonic chord, or a percussive beat, pulsing in tune with your heart. You can detect the presence of magic as though you were always using a 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{detect magic} spell. This detects magic within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30].

At 13th level, the rank of detect magic increases to 3rd. At 17th level, the rank of detect magic increases to 4th.

Sensitive Antennae.name: Sensitive Antennae
Sensitive Antennae.description:
Your antennae are covered in fine hairs, making them more sensitive to psychic vibrations than most. You gain thoughtsense as a vague sense with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your antennae to determine if a creature is within range. Your thoughtsense detects only thinking creatures, so a creature that is unthinking or otherwise immune to mental effects can't be perceived using your thoughtsense. This does not give you the ability to read or understand their thoughts.

At 9th level, this becomes an imprecise sense.

Septocular.name: Septocular
Septocular.description: You've learned to grow additional eyes all over your body, enhancing your visual processing and the range of your eyesight. When you use Change Shape, you can choose to gain all-around vision until you change forms again. During this time, you take a â€“3 circumstance penalty to Deception checks and Deception DCs to Impersonate a different ancestry, unless the ancestry you are Impersonating normally has seven or more eyes.

Sequester Form.name: Sequester Form
Sequester Form.description:
Trigger You're targeted by a mental effect.

You can shield your consciousness by blocking one of your neural networks from the others, cutting yourself off from the identity until it's safe. You Change Shape and become immune to the triggering mental effect. You are no longer immune and the mental effect continues to affect you if you Change Shape into any form that shares an ancestry with that form before the duration of the mental effect expires.

Share Quantum Aura.name: Share Quantum Aura
Share Quantum Aura.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

You temporarily share your quantum field with an ally. You cause your quantum field to emanate from an ally you can see instead of yourself. The ally gains all the benefits of your quantum field, and your warp spells originate from your ally instead of you until your quantum field deactivates. If you cast warp spells at other targets, you must still have line of sight to the target, but the spell originates from your ally for purposes of determining its range and line of effect.

Shatter Spell.name: Shatter Spell
Shatter Spell.description:
You don't simply defuse enemy spellsâ€”you shatter them in a blast of magical force. If the next action you use is to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG] and you successfully counteract the target, one creature of your choice occupying the same space as the spell effect or magic item takes force damage equal to 1d4 Ã— the target's counteract rank with a basic Reflex save against your spell DC; if the target has a trait corresponding to a type of damage, such as fire, this effect deals that damage instead of force.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, choose one: you can deal damage to every creature in the area of the spell effect or adjacent to the targeted magic item, or you can deal 1d6 damage Ã— the target's counteract rank instead of 1d4 damage.

Shattering Impact.name: Shattering Impact
Shattering Impact.description:
You pour all your effort into making a single attack with your solar weapon that has such force it shatters the weapon. Strike with your solar weapon. Increase the size of the weapon damage die by one step. Your solar weapon shatters and must be manifested to continue using it.

Graviton-Attuned If you hit your target, they take a â€“10-foot status penalty to Speed until the start of your next turn.

Photon-Attuned If you hit your target, they take additional persistent fire damage equal to half your level rounded up.

Shell Shower.name: Shell Shower
Shell Shower.description:
Frequency once per round

Whether you got tired of getting hit in the face or slipping on bullet cases in the middle of a fight, you've learned how to direct your weapon's spent ammunition or vented energy while firing off a barrage. After you make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack with a weapon, make any number of adjacent squares difficult terrain. If a square was already difficult terrain, it instead becomes greater difficult terrain.

Shielded Turret.name: Shielded Turret
Shielded Turret.description: You've added armored plates or deflective shielding to your turret, to better protect you and any allies who hunker down behind it. Your turret provides cover, rather than lesser cover. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Taking Cover} behind your turret provides greater cover.

Shift Energy.name: Shift Energy
Shift Energy.description:
You draw on magical energy from another reality and infuse it into a spell you cast in this reality. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that deals damage, the spell instead deals a different type of damage, determined by rolling a d6, as detailed on the table below. If the result is a type of damage already dealt by the spell, roll again until you get a different result. This applies to all damage the spell deals, including persistent damage and damage caused by an ongoing effect of the spell, such as the damage caused by @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.2ILhSSU3F0VcU4rL]. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

D6Damage Type
1acid
2cold
3fire
4electricity
5void
6sonic

Shifter's Eye.name: Shifter's Eye
Shifter's Eye.description: You are a master at spotting other people in disguise. When you come within 10 feet of a creature that is disguised, transformed, or Impersonating a specific creature, the GM rolls a secret Perception check for you to realize that the creature is disguised, even if you didn't spend an action to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} against that creature.

Shifter's Feint.name: Shifter's Feint
Shifter's Feint.description: You suddenly change your appearance to create an opening for your next attack. Change Shape and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint}. You gain a circumstance bonus to your Deception check to Feint equal to the number of steps between your sizes when you Change Shape (+1 if you are one size smaller or larger, +2 if you are two sizes smaller or larger, and so on). Regardless of the results of your check, each creature who observes you Change Shape is temporarily immune to Shifter's Feint for 1 minute.

Shifter's Orientation.name: Shifter's Orientation
Shifter's Orientation.description: Your malleable body makes it easier for you to reposition and rebalance yourself. Once every 10 minutes, when you Change Shape, you can gain the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.gntsQUBAauW7K9zI]{Reorient} cantrip.

Shifter's Reach.name: Shifter's Reach
Shifter's Reach.description: You can stretch your body into long tentacular limbs to strike enemies from further away. For 1 minute, increase your reach when you're delivering touch range spells and making unarmed Strikes to 10 feet. This doesn't change the reach of your melee weapon attacks.

Shifter's Shove.name: Shifter's Shove
Shifter's Shove.description: You use the explosive momentum of shifting to help push a creature away from you. Change Shape into a larger size and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}. You gain a circumstance bonus to your Athletics check to Shove equal to the number of steps between your sizes when you Change Shape (+1 if you are one size larger, +2 if you are two sizes larger, and so on).

Shifter's Squeeze.name: Shifter's Squeeze
Shifter's Squeeze.description: You can easily contort and resize your limbs to squeeze into smaller spaces. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics. If you are already trained in Acrobatics (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.3G8xUlgCjRmRJNfP]{Quick Squeeze} feat.

Shifting Smuggler.name: Shifting Smuggler
Shifting Smuggler.description: When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.34E7k2YRcsOU5uyl]{Change Shape}, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.qVNVSmsgpKFGk9hV]{Conceal an Object} inside a cavity in your body or Interact to grab an object stored inside your body. You can store up to four items of light Bulk or less if you are Large, three items of light Bulk or less if you are Medium, or two items of light Bulk or less if you are Small. If you Change Shape into a smaller-sized body, the excess items fall to the ground in your square. None of these items can have a dimension longer than 1 foot.

Shirren Lore.name: Shirren Lore
Shirren Lore.description: You become trained in Diplomacy and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Shirren Lore.

Shockwave Pulse.name: Shockwave Pulse
Shockwave Pulse.description:
Your items can release a sudden pulse of force to topple enemies over. You gain the following new mod.

Shockwave Pulse (grenade, weapon): The item releases a pulse of force upon use. If the item has the area trait, all creatures who fail their save against the item are additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. Otherwise, a creature damaged by the item is knocked prone unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:mechanic] save against your class DC.

Shot on the Run.name: Shot on the Run
Shot on the Run.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

By readying your weapon while on the move, you can do some of your weapon's setup in advance of firing. Stride up to your Speed and make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack.

Shoving Shot.name: Shoving Shot
Shoving Shot.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You use the blast of your weapon to push back your adversary in preparation for an explosive shot. Attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} a target within your weapon's first range increment, and then make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} ranged attack, selecting the target of your Shove as the primary target. This attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as your Shove. If using an area (burst) weapon, the target of the Shove is pushed away from the center point. If your Shove failed, decrease the save DC of your area attack by 1 (or 2 on a critical failure).

Shroud of Shattered Spirits.name: Shroud of Shattered Spirits
Shroud of Shattered Spirits.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An enemy's Strike or targeted effect would hit you and you weren't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by that enemy.

Your mere presence attracts restless spirits, haunted objects, spiritually active substances and fragmented souls, like a magnet attracts iron. You manifest these spirit shards in a chaotic whirlwind around you that you barely control with your thoughts. You become concealed until the beginning of your next turn, and the flat check for concealment applies to the triggering Strike or effect that would have hit you. If the flat check fails, the Strike or effect misses you.

Sidestep.name: Sidestep
Sidestep.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting you fails or critically fails.

You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue to the creature next to you. You redirect the attack to a creature of your choice that is adjacent to you and within reach of the triggering attack. The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

Signal Boost.name: Signal Boost
Signal Boost.description:
You can extend the reach of your magic. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.

Jailbreak If you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.EE07CnQmn8Xg4gkd]{Jailbreak Spell} to use this spellshape, you increase the spell's range by 60 feet.

Silent Tide.name: Silent Tide
Silent Tide.description: Stalking great finned beasts through the kelp forests of Kalo-Mahoi has taught you to move silently and smoothly through the cover of foliage. While sneaking, you ignore difficult terrain caused by foliage and underbrush and treat greater difficult terrain caused by foliage or underbrush as difficult terrain. In addition, you can move at your full swim Speed when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} while swimming. If you have another ability that allows you to move at full speed while Sneaking, you also gain a +2 status bonus to checks to Sneak while Swimming.

Siphon Solar Vitality.name: Siphon Solar Vitality
Siphon Solar Vitality.description: Your starburst markings store solar energy that you can tap into to revitalize your body and magically heal your wounds. You regain Hit Points equal to @Damage[(@actor.level+ 1d6)[healing]](1d6 plus your character level). If you're in an area of natural sunlight, you instead regain Hit Points equal to @Damage[((2*@actor.level)+1d6)[healing]] (1d6 plus twice your character level).

Size of the Ancients.name: Size of the Ancients
Size of the Ancients.description:
Frequency once per day

You undergo a rapid physical change, increasing in size to rival dragonkin of the ancient past. You grow to size Huge. Your equipment grows with you, but it returns to its natural size if removed or dropped. Your reach increases by 5 feet (or by 10 feet if you are a shipborn dragonkin), and you gain a +4 status bonus to melee damage. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes. You can end this transformation early as a single action that has the concentrate trait.

Skillful Encouragement.name: Skillful Encouragement
Skillful Encouragement.description:
You offer an ally advice and encouragement, granting them the inspiration they need to push themselves further in the face of a challenge. During a combat encounter, select an ally within 60 feet. That ally gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their skill checks until the beginning of your next turn. That ally then becomes temporarily immune to your Skillful Encouragement for 1 hour. If you said this advice verbally, Skillful Encouragement gains the auditory trait. If you signed this advice, Skillful Encouragement gains the visual trait.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.TMarUs51Jg7v3g3f]{Effect: Skillful Encouragement}

Skirmish Strike.name: Skirmish Strike
Skirmish Strike.description: You attack as you move, staying mobile as you fight and keeping your enemies on their toes. Either Step and then Strike, or Strike and then Step.

Skittermander Lore.name: Skittermander Lore
Skittermander Lore.description:
You're gregarious and friendly, but also passionately interested in the history of your people, and go out of your way to learn your traditional stories and unearth lost secrets. You become trained in Diplomacy and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Skittermander Lore and you learn Morandomandranan, the original skittermander language which has long been suppressed by the Veskarium.

Skulking Strike.name: Skulking Strike
Skulking Strike.description:
Trigger An enemy occupying the same space as you uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You launch an attack from below. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Skyguard.name: Skyguard
Skyguard.description: You earned your space legs in the Skyguard, Kalo-Mahoi's space navy. You become trained in Piloting, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Piloting checks to Navigate and Stunt. If you're already trained in Piloting, you become trained in another skill of your choice. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.2lOCqbscRL2rTCCx]{Stunt Maneuver} skill feat, even if you don't meet the prerequisites of the feat.

Sleep Mode.name: Sleep Mode
Sleep Mode.description:
Trigger You roll for initiative.

You store dormant magic into your gear during your daily preparations. Your gear becomes overclocked.

Slip from Sight.name: Slip from Sight
Slip from Sight.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You successfully use Stealth to Hide and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from all your current foes, or you successfully use Stealth to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} and become undetected to all your current foes.

Whether through the use of technology, magical talent, the blessing of Lao Shu Po, or uncanny luck, you slip from sight completely, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} for 1 minute, or until you take a hostile action.

Smooth Diversions.name: Smooth Diversions
Smooth Diversions.description:
You're practiced in the art of diverting attention quickly and subtly. When you succeed at an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}, you can immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} or Step as a free action. If your check critically succeeded against one or more creatures, you can instead choose to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FXlhxST6fuaFt3Nh]{Get 'Em!} as a free action instead.

In addition, creatures only become aware you were trying to trick them if you critically fail to Create a Diversion. Otherwise the creature assumes that your diversion was part of your regular bravado.

Smug Affirmation.name: Smug Affirmation
Smug Affirmation.description: Having overcome countless challenges in your rise to power, your self-confidence isn't just bluster and brains; it's supported by empirical evidence! Your Shielding Arrogance reaction can now also trigger whenever a foe within range of your thoughtsense critically fails an attack against you or critically fails a skill check attempted against you (such as an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you or an Acrobatics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble} around you). Increase the number of temporary Hit Points you gain from Shielding Arrogance to [[/r 2d8]] plus your character level. Increase this by [[/r 1d8]] at 13th level and by an additional [[/r 1d8]] at 17th level.

Sniper Stance.name: Sniper Stance
Sniper Stance.description: Lying low is part of your tactical acumen. You don't take a penalty to attack rolls with guns while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. In addition, you can spend one action to reposition yourself while remaining prone and ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} penalty until the beginning of your next turn.

Soft Reboot.name: Soft Reboot
Soft Reboot.description:
Trigger You Jailbreak Spell and your gear is no longer overclocked.

You recapture just enough magic to quickly overclock your gear again. Your gear becomes overclocked.

Solar Barrage.name: Solar Barrage
Solar Barrage.description: You can fire off multiple shots with your solar flare in short succession. Make two Solar Shots against separate targets and with a â€“2 circumstance penalty. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made both attacks.

Solar Rampart.name: Solar Rampart
Solar Rampart.description: Your training has helped you adapt to ever-heavier armor. You are trained in heavy armor. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in medium armor, you also gain that proficiency in heavy armor. You treat armor you wear of 2 Bulk or higher as though it were 1 Bulk lighter (to a minimum of 1 Bulk).

Solar Shield.name: Solar Shield
Solar Shield.description:
Your solar manifestations now include the ability to create a small shield of celestial energy. This energy shield does not require a hand to use, as it floats near you. You can Raise a Shield, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

While the shield is raised, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your shield. The shield has 5 + 2 Ã— your level Hit Points and no Hardness. Your shield can't be broken, but if it's destroyed, you cannot manifest a new shield for 10 minutes. If your shield vanishes due to you losing attunement, when you Attune to reform it, the shield returns with however many Hit Points it previously had. The shield regains all its lost Hit Points during your daily preparations or whenever you rest for at least 10 minutes, even if it's been destroyed.

Graviton-Attuned Your shield has Hardness equal to half your level rounded up.

Photon-Attuned If your shield is destroyed, adjacent enemies must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your class DC or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure they are instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.q5W7fV1wXvqBFxt8]{Effect: Solar Shield}

Soldier's Training.name: Soldier's Training
Soldier's Training.description:
Constant drills and combat experience leave you with reflexes capable of making snap decisions. Choose one soldier class feat you have that is or grants a reaction. At the start of your turn, you gain an additional reaction that you can only use for the selected class feat or an action granted by the selected class feat.

You can change the reaction selected for this feat when you make your daily preparations as long as the new feat meets the requirements.

Soothing Anchor.name: Soothing Anchor
Soothing Anchor.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Requirements Your last action was to use the anchoring action granted by your anchor.

You concentrate more deeply on your anchor to soothe yourself. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to your witchwarper level, which last for 1 round.

Soul Furnace.name: Soul Furnace
Soul Furnace.description:
Frequency once per day per affliction

Your soul becomes fuel, burning away your life force to stem the tide. Choose an affliction on yourself, such as a curse, disease, or poison. Lose a number of Hit Points equal to the level of the affliction. Make a new saving throw against the affliction as though you were at the end of its listed interval. If you roll a failure on this save, then there is no effect. If you roll a critical failure on this save, you get the failure result instead.

Soul Sustenance.name: Soul Sustenance
Soul Sustenance.description: Your soul is nearly whole and can sustain your living body indefinitely, without the need for outside nourishment. You don't need to eat or drink.

Space Pirate Dedication.name: Space Pirate Dedication
Space Pirate Dedication.description:
As a plunder-seeking spacefarer, you become trained in Piloting, or become an expert in it if you were already trained. You have familiarity with all cutlasses, flails, rapiers, and weapons with the razing trait. For the purposes of proficiency, treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons. If you are at least expert, you gain that weapon's critical specialization effect.

Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.8zWFGKRXg1SxIwFH]{Holo-Roger} action.

Sparkling Performance.name: Sparkling Performance
Sparkling Performance.description: Your presence lights up the stage. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} using Performance instead of Deception. If you are master in Performance, you can create sparkles when you attempt a Performance skill check, casting dim light in a 20-foot radius. If you are legendary in Performance, you can cast bright light in a 20-foot radius and attempt to counteract a darkness effect using your Performance modifier as your counteract modifier.

Spatial Drift.name: Spatial Drift
Spatial Drift.description: You can instinctively find shortcuts through space, allowing you to go further faster, much like the Drift is used to take shortcuts through the stars. To you, distance is malleable. Your speed increases by 5 feet. Increase the range increment of ranged weapons you wield by 10 feet, or by 25 feet if the weapon has a range of over 100 feet.

Special Delivery.name: Special Delivery
Special Delivery.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait and are adjacent to an ally.

You can quickly adapt your weapon to launch your ally, either with the force of the weapon or its explosion, and launch them across the battlefield. Pick a willing adjacent ally of up to your size or smaller and move them to an unoccupied space you can see within the first range increment of your weapon. Their movement doesn't trigger reactions. Your ally ends this movement on their feet and doesn't take damage from the fall. If your ally ends this movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against an enemy within their reach as a reaction. If that attack hits, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed}.

Spectra Ascendant.name: Spectra Ascendant
Spectra Ascendant.description: Whether through a quirk of your bloodline, the interference of powerful spectra, or Triune's blessing, your body has been flooded by the essence of the Drift, transforming you into a spectra. You cease aging. You gain darkvision, the cosmic trait, and a fly Speed equal to your land Speed. While you're in the Drift, your fly Speed is equal to double your Speed. Once per day as a 2-action activity, you can fire a powerful laser blast in a @Template[type:line|distance:120], dealing @Damage[7d12[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)|basic:true] save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher). This effect has the concentrate, fire, light, and manipulate traits.

Spectrasoul.name: Spectrasoul
Spectrasoul.description: You have a close connection to spectra and became a prismeni due to their presence or interference. You can communicate mentally with spectra and with intelligent constructs with the tech trait within 30 feet. You don't need to share a language to communicate with such creatures in this way. This doesn't give you any special access to their thoughts and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

Speed of Thought.name: Speed of Thought
Speed of Thought.description: You have honed your telekinetic maneuverability, enabling greater bursts of speed. Increase your fly Speed by 5 feet. In addition, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.r1bUsyDwcwuN3MUG]{Telekinetic Sprint} action.

Speedrun.name: Speedrun
Speedrun.description: You briefly hack reality, allowing you to pass through walls, ignore damage, and phase through enemies. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.q0uvyDi1wQgre2u3] magic hack.

Spell Circuit.name: Spell Circuit
Spell Circuit.description:
You create a network of magical circuitry linking your spell cache to magical hardware in your possession. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell from a spell chip or spell gem, you do not have to be holding the item.

Jailbreak If you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.EE07CnQmn8Xg4gkd]{Jailbreak Spell} to use this spellshape with a spell gem, you can pick another of your spell gems with an equal or higher item level that is consumed instead.

Spell Library.name: Spell Library
Spell Library.description: You've expanded your spell cache to learn more spells than most. During your daily preparations, you can add one spell of each rank you know to your spell cache until your next daily preparations.

Spell Protection Protocol.name: Spell Protection Protocol
Spell Protection Protocol.description: You run an app that temporarily diverts incoming spell energy. You or an ally within 30 feet gain a 5-foot aura that grants the target and allies within the aura a +1 status bonus to saving throws against spells and effects with the magic trait. Increase this bonus to +3 against spells you cast. The aura lasts until the end of your next turn, and you can Sustain it, to a maximum duration of 3 rounds.

Spellshape Modifier.name: Spellshape Modifier
Spellshape Modifier.description:
Trigger Your turn begins.

You fuse magic scripts available on the infosphere with your custom spell code, granting you access to spellshapes you don't normally know. Until the end of your turn, you gain a single spellshape feat from the technomancer class that has a level requirement of no more than half your level. You cannot apply the jailbreak benefit of that spellshape feat.

Spellsurge Ammo.name: Spellsurge Ammo
Spellsurge Ammo.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger You cast a non-cantrip spell.

You siphon spell energy into one weapon or grenade you're wielding. Until the end of your turn, the weapon or grenade deals extra force damage equal to the rank of the spell and gains the magical trait if it didn't have it already. If the spell deals damage, the extra damage becomes the same type as the triggering spell.

Spinning Blades.name: Spinning Blades
Spinning Blades.description: Your drone can spin around while attacking with its integrated weapons. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ZMP8wqASFRTl8gfc]{Spin to Win} action.

Spiritual Eye.name: Spiritual Eye
Spiritual Eye.description:
Frequency once per round

You have developed a supernatural sense in one of your eyes that lets you discern whether or not a creature is susceptible to spirit damage. Attempt a @Check[type:religion] check against the target's Will DC or Deception DC (whichever is higher). The target is then immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success As success, and you determine whether or not the creature has resistance or weakness to effects with the holy or unholy trait that deal spirit damage, whether or not the creature is undead, and whether or not the creature is possessed.

Success You determine whether or not the creature is susceptible to spirit damage.

Critical Failure Your eye catches a glimpse or absence of spiritual energy, leading you to believe the creature is susceptible to spirit damage when it is not, or vice versa.

Spiritâ€™s Protection.name: Spiritâ€™s Protection
Spiritâ€™s Protection.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You fail a saving throw.

In times of great stress, you can still feel the flickers of your deceased partner's heartbeat pounding in time with yours, steering you to safety or girding your mind from assault. Their spirit still protects you from beyond the grave. You can reroll the triggering saving throw and use the better result.

Split Tunneling.name: Split Tunneling
Split Tunneling.description:
You program a ranged spell to split off from your target and connect to a second foe. If your next action is to Cast a Spell without a duration that requires an attack roll against a single target, you can choose a second target within range. You roll a single attack roll and compare the result to the AC of both targets. This counts as one attack for your multiple attack penalty. To the second target, the spell deals only half the amount of damage it would normally deal for its degree of success, and it has no effects beyond the spell's initial damage (such as imposing conditions or penalties).

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape and fail to affect your primary target (whether your attack fails or the target is immune to the spell), your secondary target becomes your primary target, taking full damage and all effects of the spell.

Spot Healing.name: Spot Healing
Spot Healing.description:
Transfer Cost the amount you heal + 2

Trigger An adjacent bonded ally takes damage.

You quickly expend energy from your vitality network toward a bonded ally. the target regains a number of Hit Points you choose up to twice your level.

Spread the Love.name: Spread the Love
Spread the Love.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You line up your attack to blast two targets within your blast zone with equal ferocity. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} attack. Choose two different targets within the area of the attack as primary targets when resolving this attack.

Sprint.name: Sprint
Sprint.description: You sprint at top speed, whether to chase down a foe or flee a dangerous situation. Stride up to four times. You can increase the number of actions this activity takes to 3 to Stride up to six times.

Star Brand.name: Star Brand
Star Brand.description:
Requirements Your last action this turn was a successful Strike with a solar weapon or a successful Solar Shot.

You mark the target of your last attack with a potent brand of solar energy that keeps it visible and improves the effects of your attacks against them. Triple the range of your Solar Shot when targeting a branded creature. An @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creature affected by the brand, or who later becomes invisible, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} instead. If the branded creature was already concealed for any other reason, it is no longer concealed.

The brand lasts until the creature is slain, you mark another creature with a brand, or 10 minutes pass.

Statistical Anomaly.name: Statistical Anomaly
Statistical Anomaly.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You critically fail a saving throw or skill check.

It's unclear whether your luck is very good or very bad; more research may be necessary. Reroll the triggering check or save and use the second result. If the triggering skill check is for Delve Lore or the triggering saving throw is to avoid a trap's effects, you may reroll and use the better result instead.

Stellar Paragon.name: Stellar Paragon
Stellar Paragon.description:
You extend the control of stellar forces to affect your foes. Creatures that hit you with an attack suffer consequences based on your attunement.

Graviton-Attuned The creature takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty to their attacks for the next round after hitting you. If they strike you again, then they increase the penalty to a â€“3 circumstance penalty stacking with their multiple attack penalty.

Photon-Attuned The creature takes @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage.

Stellar Rush.name: Stellar Rush
Stellar Rush.description:
You rush forward, empowered by your stellar energies, getting into the thick of combat with ease. Stride twice. You gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to your Speed during these moves.

Graviton-Attuned When you finish your Strides, enemies within 15 feet of you must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your class DC. On a failure, the foes are pulled directly towards you, ending in an adjacent square if possible. You select the order which foes are moved.

Photon-Attuned The squares you moved through during your stride are suffused with solar energy until the start of your next turn. Creatures on each side of the squares are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from creatures on the opposite side. Creatures in these spaces are unaffected.

Stellar Shield Collapse.name: Stellar Shield Collapse
Stellar Shield Collapse.description:
Trigger Your Solar Shield is destroyed while you have it raised.

Requirements You haven't used Black Hole or Supernova within the last 10 minutes.

Your Solar Shield collapses on itself, with destructive results.

Graviton-Attuned Immediately use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.YdOtskSkZXO9ERzF]{Black Hole} as a free action (if you have the Black Hole revelation).

Photon-Attuned Immediately use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.jPy4UlsL5AlVwKYC]{Supernova} as a free action (if you have the Supernova revelation).

Stock Striker.name: Stock Striker
Stock Striker.description: You wield bulky firearms as a melee weapon against those who seek to close into melee range. Any two-handed firearm you wield gains the parry trait and can be used as a two-handed melee weapon to make a stock attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage, is in the brawling group, and has the analog trait. If the firearm is above commercial grade, the stock gains the same additional damage dice and tracking benefits as the firearm, but does not benefit from upgrades installed in the firearm.

Stop Them in Their Tracks.name: Stop Them in Their Tracks
Stop Them in Their Tracks.description:
Requirements You've @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aimed} at a target.

With your mark in your sights, you order your target to halt in their tracks and surrender. You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} your mark. This check doesn't take the â€“4 circumstance penalty if the target doesn't share a language with you. On a critical success, your mark is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round.

Stubborn As....name: Stubborn As...
Stubborn As....description: You're willful, stubborn, and refuse to accept your own failureâ€”traits that have served you well in life and in death. When you critically fail a saving throw against a mental effect, you get a failure instead. Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.pfV96j18QXtzQXzG]{Deny Failure} reaction.

Student of the Unseen.name: Student of the Unseen
Student of the Unseen.description: You study the subtle, intangible forces that can be found in every particle and mote of magic in the universe around you. During your daily preparations, you can meditate on these spiritual and celestial mysteries and gain the Additional Lore skill feat in any Lore skill subcategory of your choice. This feat (and your proficiency in the Lore skill granted by it) lasts until you make your daily preparations again. Since both the feat and proficiency are temporary, you can't use them to satisfy a prerequisite for a skill increase or permanent character option (like a feat).

Stunt Maneuver.name: Stunt Maneuver
Stunt Maneuver.description: Whether you are a natural ace or a veteran pilot, you can push a vehicle to perform incredible stunts. Remove the reckless trait when you attempt a Stunt with a â€“1 penalty. If you are a master in Piloting, remove the reckless trait when you attempt a Stunt with a â€“2 penalty or lower. If you are legendary in Piloting, remove the reckless trait from any Stunt you attempt.

Subvert World's Rhythm.name: Subvert World's Rhythm
Subvert World's Rhythm.description: Whether through intense musical training, magical insight, or the goddess Meyel's divine blessing, you can sense the rhythm of the world around you and tug on time's chords to manipulate its melody and flow. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{haste} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{slow} as 3rd-rank primal innate spells. You can cast each of these spells once per day.

Suction Cups.name: Suction Cups
Suction Cups.description: You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.34E7k2YRcsOU5uyl]{Change Shape} to sprout hundreds of suction cups across your limbs. You gain a 15-foot climb Speed as long as you're wearing light armor or no armor.

Sudo Spell.name: Sudo Spell
Sudo Spell.description:
You time the components of your spell with ultraprecision, setting up a resonance that duplicates the spell's effects. If your next action is to Cast a Spell of 4th rank or lower that has no duration, the spell's energy reverberates and echoes. You can Cast the Spell a second time before the end of your next turn without expending a spell slot.

Jailbreak If you use Jailbreak Spell to use this spellshape, you can use Sudo Spell with a spell of 5th rank or lower that has no duration.

Superior Customization.name: Superior Customization
Superior Customization.description:
You've further modified your drone, granting it a new ability. You drone gains one superior customization.

Special You can select this feat up to three times.

Supernatural Soothing.name: Supernatural Soothing
Supernatural Soothing.description: When words fail and tempers flare, you center your emotions and then release your peaceful thoughts in a soothing, psychic calm.
