Once per day, you can cast either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EfFMLVbmkBWmzoLF]{Clear Mind} as an occult innate spell, heightened to half your level rounded up.

Supersonic Speed.name: Supersonic Speed
Supersonic Speed.description: When push comes to shove, you move incredibly fast, becoming a colorful blur of erratic motion. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition as long as you take a Stride action in your turn and have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition from the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.dXnb5du6mEkBRdQM]{Unleash Energy} action.

Suppressing Insults.name: Suppressing Insults
Suppressing Insults.description: Your cutting quips hamper your opponent's performance in the fight. On a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action, your opponent is @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} for as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} from your Demoralize.

Surface Strider.name: Surface Strider
Surface Strider.description: Through diligent training, you've learned to stretch your ability to remain out of the water for extended periods. You gain the amphibious trait.

Surprising Escape.name: Surprising Escape
Surprising Escape.description:
Trigger You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Your extreme flexibility and deceptively compact frame make it easy for you to escape a variety of confines, and your quick reaction time means you can do so in a flash! You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Swarm Evolution.name: Swarm Evolution
Swarm Evolution.description: You metamorphose into a powerful Swarm-like creature, though you retain your individuality. You gain a +2 status bonus to saves against fear and resistance to acid equal to half your level. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{mask of terror} as a 7th-rank innate primal spell once per day.

Sway the Heart, Stoke the Spirit.name: Sway the Heart, Stoke the Spirit
Sway the Heart, Stoke the Spirit.description:
You orate an inspiring speech that rallies your allies, cleansing their body and mind of harmful conditions and stoking their spirit for the ongoing battle. If you say this speech, Sway the Heart, Stoke the Spirit gains the auditory trait. If you sign this speech, Sway the Heart, Stoke the Spirit gains the visual trait. You and all allies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] benefit from a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EfFMLVbmkBWmzoLF]{Clear Mind} and a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo] spell. Additionally, your allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Will saves for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.XmdJvu33YRjQbLsz]{Effect: Sway the Heart, Stoke the Spirit}

Swerveshift.name: Swerveshift
Swerveshift.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack.

Requirements You are aware of the attack and are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the triggering attack.

You quickly Change Shape into a smaller size to avoid getting hit. You gain a circumstance bonus to AC, Fortitude DC, and Reflex DC against the triggering attack equal to the number of steps between your sizes when you Change Shape (+1 if you are one size smaller, +2 if you are two sizes smaller, and so on).

Swift Reposition.name: Swift Reposition
Swift Reposition.description:
Trigger You are about to roll a Reflex saving throw, but you haven't rolled yet.

Sensing danger, you leap and twist your body, course correcting midair to a more advantageous position. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering Reflex save. Regardless of the outcome, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} or Step.

Switch Places.name: Switch Places
Switch Places.description:
Requirements You are adjacent to an ally.

You deftly swap positions with a nearby ally. This is forced movement for your ally. Both you and your ally must be able to use actions with the move trait to use Switch Places, and you both must be able to fit in the squares you move to if your size is different.

Switch Target.name: Switch Target
Switch Target.description:
Trigger The creature you are currently Aimed at gains the dying or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} condition.

Requirements You're wielding a gun.

As your target falls, you immediately home in on the next. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim} at a different creature.

Synchronized Advance.name: Synchronized Advance
Synchronized Advance.description: You move forward alongside your exocortex, attacking while remaining defensive. If you have a drone, you Synchronized Step. If you have a turret, you Stride and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} Exocortex. If you end this movement adjacent to your drone or turret, you make a ranged Strike and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} behind your drone or turret.

Synchronized Initiative.name: Synchronized Initiative
Synchronized Initiative.description:
Trigger You and your bonded partner roll the same skill for initiative, but get different results.

You and your bonded partner act in utter synchronicity with one another, reacting to danger and entering battle as one. You and your bonded partner use the higher result between your initiative rolls, but use the lower Perception or skill modifier.

Syncretic Epiphany.name: Syncretic Epiphany
Syncretic Epiphany.description: Having plumbed the depths of your own connection, you've come to understand how your piece of reality interconnects with another. You learn the advanced epiphany spell of the chosen connection.

Synthesize Medicinal.name: Synthesize Medicinal
Synthesize Medicinal.description:
Frequency once per day

You can synthesize beneficial remedies within your own body and immediately digest them. You create one elixir, medicinal, potion, or serum that you know the formula for of a level equal to your level or lower. You don't pay any cost to create this item. You immediately consume and digest this item, Activating it as a free action that has the concentrate trait, rather than its usual activation method.

Synthetic Speech.name: Synthetic Speech
Synthetic Speech.description: You can connect with computers. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.AuzNHVHvsQPFIOQT]{Speak with Computers} on yourself once per day as an innate arcane spell.

Tactical Assault.name: Tactical Assault
Tactical Assault.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

Stride up to twice. You can make up to three ranged Strikes during this movement. Each ranged Strike you make must target a different creature within your first range increment (calculated from the point at which you took your attack at that target). Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but doesn't increase your penalty until you have made all your attacks.

Tactical Bond.name: Tactical Bond
Tactical Bond.description: You and your bonded partner have learned to physically shield one another from harm. If you would grant lesser cover to your bonded partner (including when your partner is using you as a mount), or your bonded partner would grant lesser cover to you, standard cover is granted instead.

Tactical Bully.name: Tactical Bully
Tactical Bully.description:
Requirements Your last action was a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}.

You use your size and strength to push and position your enemies around the battlefield. You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the creature you successfully Shoved, even if the target is no longer in your reach. If you have a tail attack, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Trip attempt.

Tactical Customization.name: Tactical Customization
Tactical Customization.description:
You've further modified your drone, granting it a new ability. You drone gains one tactical customization.

Special You can select this feat up to three times.

Tactical Drone.name: Tactical Drone
Tactical Drone.description: You've improved your drone, making it a mature companion and gaining additional capabilities. During an encounter, even if you don't Command your robot companion, it can still use 1 action that round on your turn to Stride or Strike. It can do this at any point during your turn, as long as you aren't currently taking an action. If it does, that's all the actions it gets that roundâ€”you can't Command it later.

Tactical Swap.name: Tactical Swap
Tactical Swap.description:
Frequency once per round.

Requirements Your last ranged Strike this turn missed or hit and failed to damage the target.

You swap weapons with a practiced motion. You Interact to swap your current weapon for another. Make a Strike against that enemy with your new weapon, but don't count the multiple attack penalty of the prior Strike when calculating the attack roll with this attack.

Tactical Team-Up.name: Tactical Team-Up
Tactical Team-Up.description: Your turret unleashes a hail of gunfire at a creature within its first range increment, creating an opening for you to press the attack. Your turret makes a ranged Strike against the target, and then you make a ranged Strike against the target. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against your Strike.

Tag Team.name: Tag Team
Tag Team.description:
Trigger The target of your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FXlhxST6fuaFt3Nh]{Get 'Em!} is critically hit by an ally's attack.

You seize the opening your ally has provided, quickly attacking your foe. Make a Strike against the triggering creature. If it's a ranged Strike, it must in your weapon's first range increment.

Take 'Em Alive!.name: Take 'Em Alive!
Take 'Em Alive!.description:
You urge your allies to take down your enemies without loss of life. Until the beginning of your next turn, you and your allies gain the following two benefits. You and your allies don't take the normal â€“2 circumstance penalty when making a nonlethal attack with a weapon that doesn't have the nonlethal trait. When you or an ally Cast a Spell that deals damage and doesn't have the death or void trait, you can add the nonlethal trait to the spell.

Lead by Example If you make a nonlethal attack against a single target before the end of your turn, you direct your allies to take down a specific target for later follow-up. The target of your attack is treated as having your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.FXlhxST6fuaFt3Nh]{Get 'Em!} directive on them, though you don't benefit from the lead by example effect on the Get 'Em!

Take the Wheel.name: Take the Wheel
Take the Wheel.description: Diving into a moving vehicle and seizing the controls is nothing new for you. You Board and Take Control of the adjacent vehicle.

Tale Spinner.name: Tale Spinner
Tale Spinner.description: You keep your people's stories alive with magic. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0zU8CPejjQFnhZFI]{Figment} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Prestidigitation} as occult innate spells at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Talented Tracker.name: Talented Tracker
Talented Tracker.description: Your keen nose makes you an excellent tracker. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Survival. If you would automatically become trained in Survival (from your background of class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to Track. This bonus increases to +2 when tracking by scent. You also gain the Experienced Tracker skill feat.

Talon Transporter.name: Talon Transporter
Talon Transporter.description: You've learned to carry additional supplies using your talons. You gain the Hefty Hauler skill feat. If you already have this feat, instead increase your maximum and encumbered Bulk limits by 2. While floating or flying you may use your feet as an additional pair of hands, but only to carry up to 4 Bulk of creatures or items beyond your maximum encumbrance.

Tashtari Cluster.name: Tashtari Cluster
Tashtari Cluster.description: You've learned to apply this ancient technique of clustering identical systems to form a parallel computing cluster to your magic, allowing you to manage many pieces of overclocked gear at once. You can have two pieces of overclocked gear at once, and you choose which gear is no longer overclocked the next time you use Jailbreak Spell.

Tear Wound.name: Tear Wound
Tear Wound.description:
Requirements Your most recent action was a critical success on a Strike with a melee weapon

You tear your weapon out of your foe, leaving bloody, vicious wounds. You deal @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage to your target, or @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage if you have the critical specialization for the weapon used in the triggering Strike. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon's tracking bonus.

Tech Caster.name: Tech Caster
Tech Caster.description: Your ability to control and empower technological devices has improved. You gain @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.74EAtV4JC9Cihtp7] and @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.naP8amjLGSEARe9V] as 1st rank divine innate spells. You can cast each of these divine innate spells once per day.

Tech Crafting.name: Tech Crafting
Tech Crafting.description: You can Craft tech items, though some have other requirements. When you select this feat, you gain formulas for four common tech items of 2nd level or lower.

Tech Familiarity.name: Tech Familiarity
Tech Familiarity.description: You have an intuitive understanding of computers, machines, and other technological devices. You become trained in Computers and Crafting. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background of class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

Telekinetic Titan.name: Telekinetic Titan
Telekinetic Titan.description: Straining every neuron, you briefly supercharge your telekinetic abilities. Choose Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom when you activate this ability. For 1 minute, you can carry Bulk equal to 7 + the chosen attribute modifier before becoming encumbered, and you can hold and carry a total Bulk of 12 + the chosen attribute modifier. Your telekinetic hands can hold and wield objects heavier than 1 Bulk, and you ignore the effects of your atrophied ability. Finally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.gNUrQ8jimAvAA0xg]{Telekinetic Lift} action. When the duration ends, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 1 minute, and your telekinetic hands drop any objects they can no longer hold.

Telepathic Conduit.name: Telepathic Conduit
Telepathic Conduit.description: When you use limited telepathy to communicate with another creature, you act as a conduit for their thoughts, allowing them to respond to you for a few scant momentsâ€”if they wish. The creature can give you a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action at the beginning of their next turn.

Telepredict.name: Telepredict
Telepredict.description:
You read the subtle cues of a target's brainwaves to anticipate the mental state of a single creature within range of your limited telepathy that you can detect with thoughtsense. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Deception checks and Intimidation checks targeting the creature, to saves against the target's effects that have the fear trait, and to your Will DC against the target's Intimidation skill actions, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}. If you deal mental damage to the target, increase this bonus to +2.

You can Telepredict the actions of only one creature at a time. Telepredict ends if you use it on a different creature or the creature leaves the range of your limited telepathy.

Tentacle Whip.name: Tentacle Whip
Tentacle Whip.description: You grow a tentacle that can lash out like a whip. You gain a tentacle unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage. Your tentacle is in the brawling weapon group and has the barathu, finesse, reach, and unarmed traits.

Terraforming Mines.name: Terraforming Mines
Terraforming Mines.description:
You install artificial gravity fields into your mines that activate when they explode. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.ccVcznj9KVYHLVaY]{Deploy} a mine, choose one of the following effects.

Big Bang: When your mines detonate, they push creatures 5 feet away from the mine in a random direction (10 feet plus knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

Gravity Field: When your mines detonate, the area affected by the explosion becomes your choice of high gravity, low gravity, normal gravity, or zero gravity for 1 minute.

Terrifying Bravado.name: Terrifying Bravado
Terrifying Bravado.description:
Trigger You critically succeed on a save against a fear effect whose source was a creature, or a creature critically fails or fails an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you.

You laugh at your enemy's failed attempts to bully you, turning the tables on your foe with a display of terrifying bravado. You attempt an Intimidation check to Demoralize the triggering creature.

Terror-Forming.name: Terror-Forming
Terror-Forming.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

Your weapon blasts apart the battlefield and leaves it a ruinous waste. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} attack. You don't designate a primary target, but instead make each square in the area of your attack difficult terrain. If a square was already difficult terrain, it becomes greater difficult terrain. Any difficult or greater difficult terrain created by this action remains in place and cannot be changed without extensive engineering or magic.

That'll Show 'Em.name: That'll Show 'Em
That'll Show 'Em.description: When you warn an ally of an attack, you follow up with a shot at your enemy. When you use your @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.JZxj1PyAM54d1GEP]{Watch Out!} reaction, you can make a melee or ranged Strike against the triggering creature. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike. If you hit, your target is @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of its next turn.

That's Not What I Heard.name: That's Not What I Heard
That's Not What I Heard.description:
You attempt to convince someone that you've seen rumors about them on the infosphere that could ruin their reputation. Choose a foe within 30 feet and attempt a @Check[type:society|defense:will] check against their Will DC.

Critical Success The target becomes distracted and takes a â€“3 status penalty to Will saves and Diplomacy checks for 1 minute. The target can end this effect early by checking a comm unit or other computer as a single action that has the manipulate trait or with the assistance of another creature checking for them.

Success As critical success, but the penalty is â€“2.

Critical Failure The target doesn't care about your accusation or knows it's a lie, ruining your reputation and giving you a â€“2 circumstance penalty to your Deception, Diplomacy and Society checks for 1 minute.

The Hush.name: The Hush
The Hush.description:
Frequency once per day

You fall utterly silent and focus strenuously on a question at hand, wracking your brain for information. You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} with a +2 circumstance bonus on the skill check. If you would get a critical failure, you get a failure instead, and if you would get a success, you get a critical success instead.

The Science of Motion.name: The Science of Motion
The Science of Motion.description: Your extensive scientific knowledge of astronomy, astrophysics, and stellar phenomenon have given you insight into the underpinnings of the universeâ€”particularly motion. You can use this knowledge to more easily move your foes across the battlefield. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}. If you critically fail an Athletics check to Reposition, Shove or Trip, you get a failure instead.

Thick Skins.name: Thick Skins
Thick Skins.description:
Each of your forms has unusually thick skin. Your DC on flat checks to end persistent bleed damage is reduced from 15 to 10, or from 10 to 5 after receiving especially appropriate assistance.

Special You can use the Restorative Shapeshifting feat to attempt an additional flat check to end persistent bleed damage, but this is not considered especially appropriate assistance.

Thought-Bonded Companion.name: Thought-Bonded Companion
Thought-Bonded Companion.description: You forge a telepathic bond with your animal companion, allowing you to sense its emotions and presence. Your animal companion can empathically communicate with you, as long as it's within 1 mile of you, sharing emotions. Additionally, as long as your animal companion is within 100 feet of you, you know its location and it knows your location. This doesn't give either of you knowledge of one another's surroundings.

Thoughtful Insight.name: Thoughtful Insight
Thoughtful Insight.description: You know that it's more important to act wisely than it is to act quickly. When you take the time to consider a problem from all angles, you come up with an insightful revelation. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pkcOby5prOausy1k]{Read Omens} as a 4th-rank occult innate spell. You can cast this spell once per day.

Tinkering Fingers.name: Tinkering Fingers
Tinkering Fingers.description:
You're good with your hands and can quickly improvise a fix for broken or damaged equipment.

You're trained in Crafting. If you are trained in Crafting from another source (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair} an item without using a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vLGDUFrg4yGzpTQX]{Repair Toolkit} without taking the â€“2 circumstance penalty, improvising tools from whatever you have at hand. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Crafting checks to Repair an item when you have a repair toolkit.

Too Stubborn to Die.name: Too Stubborn to Die
Too Stubborn to Die.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You would die.

You come back from the brink of death, hauling yourself back to consciousness despite your wounds and exhaustion. You push yourself to your absolute limits and don't die. If you have the dying or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions, you lose the dying and unconscious conditions. If you are at 0 Hit Points, you have 1 Hit Point. Increase the value of your wounded and doomed conditions by 1. You can use this reaction while unconscious.

Toppling Shot.name: Toppling Shot
Toppling Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You aim your shots to unbalance your foe, sending them back or knocking them over. You @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.LRbwV8LMLi6FFKjW]{Aim}, then make a ranged Strike at your mark. If the Strike hits, the target is knocked back 5 feet. If this forced movement would cause them to collide with a creature or object, both the target and the creature (if any) are dealt bludgeoning damage equal to your Aim damage. On a critical hit, the target is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Touch The Sky.name: Touch The Sky
Touch The Sky.description: There's nothing you love more than soaring through the air. When you fly, you don't count moving upward (straight up or diagonally) as moving through difficult terrain. This does not apply to flying with equipment or vehicles, such as jet packs and hover boards.

Transcended Existence.name: Transcended Existence
Transcended Existence.description: Your connection to existence transcends the limits of other mortals, granting you access to the most powerful spells. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

Transforming Huddle.name: Transforming Huddle
Transforming Huddle.description: You can adjust your body's size and shape to take advantage of obstacles on the battlefield. Change Shape into a Small-sized form and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}; you can Take Cover to gain standard cover if you would have lesser cover from a creature after you Change Shape; if you would have standard cover from a creature, you gain greater cover instead.

Transmutative Casing.name: Transmutative Casing
Transmutative Casing.description:
You can coat bullets with a substance capable or mimicking rare materials on the fly. You gain the following new mod.

Transmutative Casing (exocortex or weapon): Damage dealt by the item is inflicted by one of the following special materials of your choice: cold iron or silver. At 16th level, add adamantine and aucturnite to the list of options.

Travel-Tongue.name: Travel-Tongue
Travel-Tongue.description: Somewhere along your travels, picking up new languages became as easy as breathingâ€”some of your colleagues even suspect you might be blessed by the god Weydan! You can speak, read, and understand any language.

Trek the Frigid Wastes.name: Trek the Frigid Wastes
Trek the Frigid Wastes.description: You've spent many long years traversing Lajok's surface, moving from city to city or hunting for food and resources. You're accustomed to moving across slippery ice sheets and plowing through deep snow. When moving over ice or snow in arctic terrain, you always gain the benefits of the Cover Tracks action without needing to use the activity or having to move half your Speed. You don't treat icy terrain as uneven ground (though it's still difficult terrain for you), and you ignore difficult terrain caused by snow.

Tripartite Mind.name: Tripartite Mind
Tripartite Mind.description:
Transfer Cost 6

Trigger You would gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} condition.

By awakening and communicating with the parts of your subconscious responsible for maintaining your bonds and vitality network, you create duplicates of your consciousness capable of fending off mental intrusion. Attempt to counteract an effect of your choice imposing one of the triggering conditions, using half your level rounded up as your counteract rank and your spell DC as the counteract modifier.

Triune's Chosen.name: Triune's Chosen
Triune's Chosen.description: Triune chose you to become a prismeni. You hold the All-Code and its blessings close in your heart and cherish the knowledge and skill it has imparted upon you. You become trained in Religion and Triune Lore. You gain access to the pulse gauntlet, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, the pulse gauntlet is a simple weapon. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the pulse gauntlet.

True Leader.name: True Leader
True Leader.description: You can convey orders with a glance, a single word, or the tiniest flick of your hand (or suitable appendage, depending on ancestry). Once per turn, you can issue an envoy directive as a free action.

Twin Draw.name: Twin Draw
Twin Draw.description:
Requirements You have two free hands.

You have practiced dual wielding and smoothly drawing and taking aim with your weapons. Draw up to two one-handed weapons and Aim.

Twin Guard.name: Twin Guard
Twin Guard.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach critically hits you with a melee Strike and you are wielding two solar weapons.

You raise one of your weapons to intercept a particularly deadly attack. You gain resistance to the attack equal to your level. One of your solar weapons shatters and must be manifested to continue using it.

Twin Shooter.name: Twin Shooter
Twin Shooter.description: You are especially dangerous with twin guns. As long as you're wielding two simple guns, they gain the agile trait.

Twin Weapons.name: Twin Weapons
Twin Weapons.description:
You can manifest a second solar weapon. When you do so, you can choose its traits separately from your first weapon. When you @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.JLo2gJ2s0BXUKsLQ]{Attune} you can choose to manifest both weapons in the same action as long as you have free hands for each. Add the agile and twin traits to the list of weapon traits you can apply to your solar weapons.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.IHp2EZvBMcumn6Hf]{Effect: Solar Weapon (Twin)}

Twisted Dark Zone.name: Twisted Dark Zone
Twisted Dark Zone.description: You expose this reality to a realm of pure darkness filled with gibbering voices and otherworldly entities. The area of your quantum field functions as though it were an area of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]. Creatures that begin their turn in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your class DC or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. They are then immune for 24 hours.

Two Minds, One Soul.name: Two Minds, One Soul
Two Minds, One Soul.description:
Trigger You, your bonded partner, or both you and your bonded partner would roll a Will saving throw against a spell or effect that could impose the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or controlled condition.

Requirements You and your bonded partner are within 60 feet of one another, and are willing.

You and your bonded partner are two halves of the same spirit, entwined together in different bodies. Both you and your bonded partner roll the triggering Will saving throw. The triggering creature (or creatures) uses the higher result. Both you and your bonded partner are affected by the triggering spell or effect, even if it would normally only affect one of you.

Ultimate Drone.name: Ultimate Drone
Ultimate Drone.description:
With your guidance and consciousness upgrades, your drone transcends its code and develops true artificial intelligence. Your drone becomes a creature with the tech trait that has free will but otherwise uses its companion statistics. Your drone can act independently even if you're out of range or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. You and your drone each roll initiative and can choose to act on the better result. You also make the following adjustments.

  • Increase two of its attribute modifiers by 2.

  • Apply the extra benefits of one path listed below.

Bodyguard: Your drone is a master in Athletics. The drone's Strength and Constitution modifiers increase by 1. Its proficiency rank for unarmed attacks and integrated weapons increases to master, and it gains an additional integrated weapon.

Diplomat: Your drone is a master in Diplomacy, and its Charisma modifier increases by 2. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.6ON8DjFXSMITZleX]{No Cause for Alarm} feat.

Diva: Your drone is a master in Performance and Media Lore. The drone's Charisma modifier increases by 2. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.7LB00jkh6JaJr3vS]{Fascinating Performance} feat.

Hacker: Your drone is a master in Computers, and its Intelligence modifier increases by 2. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.V0nHjdYpGGit2Eyk]{Combat Hack} feat.

Nurse: Your drone is a master in Medicine, and its Wisdom modifier increases by 2. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.wYerMk6F1RZb0Fwt]{Battle Medicine} feat.

Ultimate Spacefarer.name: Ultimate Spacefarer
Ultimate Spacefarer.description: You're capable of surviving in the void of space indefinitely. While you maintain suspended respiration, you are immune to inhaled threats. Additionally, as long as you use suspended respiration, you don't need to eat or drink. Once per day as a free action, you can suspend respiration in atmosphere with these benefits for 1 minute.

Uncanny Awareness.name: Uncanny Awareness
Uncanny Awareness.description: You're in tune with your surroundings and can instinctively sense when danger is near. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks made as initiative rolls. If your initiative roll result is tied with that of an opponent, you go first, regardless of whether you rolled Perception or not. The first time each day that you roll Perception for initiative, you roll initiative twice and use the higher result.

Uncanny Comprehension.name: Uncanny Comprehension
Uncanny Comprehension.description: You take in your surroundings, instantly opening your mind up to the answers hidden all around you and the clues their presence has left behind. You instantly use up to three Recall Knowledge actions. If you have any special abilities or free actions that would normally be triggered when you Recall Knowledge, you can't use them for these actions. The first time one of these attempts to Recall Knowledge uses a Lore skill you selected with Additional Lore, you roll the associated Recall Knowledge check twice and use the higher result. That Recall Knowledge check gains the fortune trait.

Uncanny Deflection.name: Uncanny Deflection
Uncanny Deflection.description: Your well-aimed bullets fly unerringly toward your foes, even after deflecting an attack. When you succeed with @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.xtjGns4zvJmDZZ1J]{Deflecting Fire}, as part of that reaction, you can immediately make a ranged gun Strike with the same gun you used for Deflecting Fire. This Strike doesn't use ammunition, as it utilizes the same ammunition expended for Deflecting Fire.

Unconventional Expertise (Starfinder).name: Unconventional Expertise (Starfinder)
Unconventional Expertise (Starfinder).description: You've continued to advance your powers using your unconventional weapon. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the weapon you chose for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.49mBVNF4SK6iYdJm]{Unconventional Weaponry}.

Unconventional Weaponry (Starfinder).name: Unconventional Weaponry (Starfinder)
Unconventional Weaponry (Starfinder).description:
You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture. Choose an uncommon simple or martial weapon with a trait corresponding to an ancestry (such as vesk) or that is common in another culture. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

If you are trained in all martial weapons, you can choose an uncommon advanced weapon with such a trait. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a martial weapon.

Undead Scholar.name: Undead Scholar
Undead Scholar.description: Your people's long history of clashing with Eox has made you wary. You become trained in Religion. If you were already trained in Religion, you become trained in another skill of your choice. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Recall Knowledge about undead creatures.

Undead Slayer (Starfinder).name: Undead Slayer (Starfinder)
Undead Slayer (Starfinder).description:
You leverage your extensive knowledge of undead during combat. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against undead creatures. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage, the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice.

Furthermore, when you succeed or critically succeed at a check to Recall Knowledge against an undead creature that you can see, you identify a weak spot in their defensesâ€”for 1 minute, you gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons and unarmed attacks for attacks you make against that specific creature.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.jtlZPjobJNXLol7S]{Effect: Undead Slayer}

Underfoot.name: Underfoot
Underfoot.description: You use your size against larger foes, moving through them in a variety of ways to avoid notice and move undisturbed. As long as you are Small, you can end a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} action in a Medium or larger sized enemy's space. The enemy must have appropriate limbs or otherwise leave you enough room for this maneuver, as determined by the GM. You could not, for example, occupy the space of an ooze that matches the full dimensions of the square. While you occupy an enemy's space, that enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to you.

Underwater Combatant.name: Underwater Combatant
Underwater Combatant.description: You've learned how to wield nearly any weapon effectively while underwater. You don't take the â€“2 penalty for making melee slashing or bludgeoning Strikes while underwater. Your ranged attacks aren't affected by being underwater. You can use weapons that deal fire damage underwater.

Undying.name: Undying
Undying.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You have the dying condition and are about to attempt a recovery check.

You've died once before and have no intention of dying ever again, so your soul stubbornly resuscitates your body when you would otherwise perish. You're restored to 1 Hit Point, lose the dying and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions, and can act normally on this turn. You increase your wounded condition as normal.

Unhindered Advance.name: Unhindered Advance
Unhindered Advance.description: When you use @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.SWHe1OEtGajrRWrZ]{Tactical Advance}, you ignore difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

Universal Telepath.name: Universal Telepath
Universal Telepath.description:
Frequency once per day

Communication via mere words is a limitation of lesser minds. Your thoughts weave meaning from words, feelings, mental imagery, and ineffable stimuli for 10 minutes, during which you can communicate using your limited telepathy without sharing a language.

At 17th level, you can activate this feat at will.

Unleash Energy.name: Unleash Energy
Unleash Energy.description:
Frequency once per day

You unleash your pent up energy in a burst of speed and flurry of unpredictable motion. You Stride and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition for 3 rounds. You can only use the extra action each round to Stride.

Unleash Hell!.name: Unleash Hell!
Unleash Hell!.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements wearing armor customized with Hellknight regalia.

Your armor unleashes a gout of hellfire in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[(@actor.level)d6[@actor.flags.pf2e.hellknight.order-damage]|options:area-damage] damage per level of a type determined by your chosen Hellknight order (@Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic|options:area-effect]); a creature takes @Damage[(@actor.level)d6[spirit]|options:area-damage]{spirit damage} instead if that would be more detrimental (as determined by the GM).

Unleash Pneuma.name: Unleash Pneuma
Unleash Pneuma.description:
Frequency once per day

You unleash a portion of your spiritual essenceâ€”either the vitality of your living body or the void of your undead soulâ€”in a violent burst around you. You deal @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.unleashPneuma]] damage of your selected type to all adjacent creatures (@Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)|basic:true] save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher). At 9th level and every 2 levels thereafter, this damage increases by 1d6.

When you take this feat, choose either vitality or void. Once chosen, this selection can't be changed. Unleash Pneuma deals the chosen damage type and gains the chosen trait.

Special You can take this feat twice, but you must select a different damage type each time. If you do, Unleash Pneuma's frequency becomes once per day per damage type, rather than once per day.

Unleash Sota's Flame.name: Unleash Sota's Flame
Unleash Sota's Flame.description:
Channeling the heat of Sota's rekindled sun, you unleash a blast of plasma across the battlefield. You deal @Damage[10d8[fire]] damage in a 120 foot line. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|against:class-spell] save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage, plus @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, plus @Damage[1d6[persistent,electricity]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round. For 1 minute afterward, your body is awash with solar energy. Creatures that Grab you or that hit you with an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee weapon take @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage.

Unliving Memories.name: Unliving Memories
Unliving Memories.description: Some element of your borai nature gives you flashes from somewhere beyond, visions from the afterlife you were intended for or might still one day obtain. You become trained in a skill of your choice and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} feat for a Lore subcategory about a specific plane tied to your afterlife (such as Heaven, Hell, Nirvana, or Outer Rifts Lore).

Unquenchable Breath.name: Unquenchable Breath
Unquenchable Breath.description: When you use Dragonkin Breath, a creature who fails or critically fails its saving throw takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,@actor.flags.pf2e.dragonkinBreath.damageType]] damage of the same type. On a critical failure, the flat check to remove persistent damage increases to DC 20 (or DC 15, if the flat check would be reduced because the creature has an appropriate type of help). If you apply a critical weapon specialization effect that also deals persistent damage of the same type, apply this persistent damage in addition to the base persistent damage.

Unseen Tides.name: Unseen Tides
Unseen Tides.description: The surge of Kalo-Mahoi's ever-present tides courses in your blood, and you can feel their pull wherever you go. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement} as a 4th-rank primal innate spell that you can cast once per day.

Unsettling Display.name: Unsettling Display
Unsettling Display.description: You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} those around you by shifting your muscular and skeletal systems around. When you do, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.

Unstable Flare.name: Unstable Flare
Unstable Flare.description:
You supercharge your solar flare and unleash multiple simultaneous blasts at all foes in an area. Make a @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.0o7v0LwOjvvNJRCw]{Solar Shot} with a â€“2 penalty against each enemy within a @Template[type:burst|distance:15]{15-foot-radius burst} centered at any point within your Solar Shot's current range. Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but you do not increase your penalty until you have made all your attacks.

Graviton-Attuned You may Step once as a free action immediately before or after making your attacks.

Photon-Attuned You're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to each target of this attack until the start of your next turn.

Unstoppable Directives.name: Unstoppable Directives
Unstoppable Directives.description: Your confidence is a battery that keeps your allies going through doubt and pain. Increase the amount of temporary Hit Points granted by your directives by a number equal to your key attribute modifier. Increase the amount of temporary Hit Points you grant from non-directive actions by half your key attribute modifier (minimum 1).

Urban Survivalist.name: Urban Survivalist
Urban Survivalist.description: You can use Survival in place of Society to Subsist in cities, space stations, and other settlements. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice hazards in these environments; if you find a hazard in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Urbanite.name: Urbanite
Urbanite.description: You know how to be overlooked in urban environments. You move at full Speed in crowds and can use cover from crowds to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus on your Stealth checks when in a crowd of at least 10 creatures and a +4 circumstance bonus on your Stealth checks when in a crowd of at least 100 creatures.

Urchin.name: Urchin
Urchin.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger A creature Grabs you or successfully Strikes you with an unarmed melee strike or a non-reach melee weapon.

You flex the spines running down the back of your head and neck as a defensive response. The attacking creature takes @Damage[(floor((@actor.level + 1) / 3 + 1))d6[piercing]] damage, with a @Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. On a critical failure, the target also takes @Damage[(floor((@actor.level + 1) / 3 + 1))[persistent,bleed]] damage. At 8th level and every 3 levels thereafter, the damage increases by 1d6, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

Vector Reflector.name: Vector Reflector
Vector Reflector.description:
Trigger A @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} enemy damages you with a Strike.

You use your armor to absorb some of the kinetic energy of your opponent's attack. You gain resistance to all damage against the triggering attack equal to half your level (or your level if you have the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.class-features.Item.sy40CowlzpsjQkKd]{armor storm} fighting style). If the foe is within reach, you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the enemy, making an Athletics check as normal.

Vent Gas.name: Vent Gas
Vent Gas.description:
Frequency once per hour

You vent gas from sacs inside your body to propel you forward. The area you currently occupy, plus all squares in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], become filled with your vented gas. All creatures in the gas become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the gas become concealed to creatures within it. This gas disperses at the beginning of your next turn.

You gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to all your Speeds. Then you either Stride or Fly. At the end of your turn, your gas reserves are depleted, and the bonus to your Speeds ends.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.QlPWgySBDmyZujQD]{Effect: Vent Gas}

Verbal Transmission.name: Verbal Transmission
Verbal Transmission.description:
Frequency once per hour

You can project your words through wireless transmission, rather than speaking aloud, causing your words to emit from unsecured technological devices as either audio, text, or both. For example, your voice could emit audibly from an intercom or appear as text on a vidscreen or holosign. Select an unsecured technological device within 100 feet. For 1 minute, you can choose to transmit anything you say through that output device, rather than say it aloud. You can change which device you use as an output as a single action. Doing so doesn't extend the duration.

Versatile Outfit.name: Versatile Outfit
Versatile Outfit.description: You are known for your astounding custom outfits and pride yourself on designing versatile and reconfigurable garments, allowing you to create nearly any look in a matter of moments. You can use the Crafting skill rather than Deception to Impersonate another person, and can do so in 1 minute rather than the usual 10 minutes. You don't need a disguise kit to Impersonate a specific person when using Crafting to do so, and a maker's toolkit grants a +1 item bonus to the check.

Vesk Weapon Familiarity.name: Vesk Weapon Familiarity
Vesk Weapon Familiarity.description:
You are trained with all doshkos. In addition, you gain access to all uncommon weapons with the vesk trait. For the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these weapons, you get its critical specialization effect.

Vicious Breath.name: Vicious Breath
Vicious Breath.description: The intensity of your draconic breath lays waste to the environment and your foes. When you use Dragonkin Breath, the area of your breath becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Any creature that enters the area of your dragonkin breath or is occupying your breath's area at the end of its turn takes @Damage[4d6[@actor.flags.pf2e.dragonkinBreath.damageType]] damage of the same type (@Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic] save against the same DC as your dragonkin breath).

Vicious Incisors (Starfinder).name: Vicious Incisors (Starfinder)
Vicious Incisors (Starfinder).description: You've let your incisors grow long enough to serve as formidable weapons. Your jaws unarmed attack deals 1d6 piercing damage instead of 1d4, and gains the backstabber trait. You can file down your teeth and regrow them later on, enabling you to select this feat at any level, and to retrain into and out of this feat.

Vigilant Administrator.name: Vigilant Administrator
Vigilant Administrator.description: You are ready to counter any incoming magic effects. You gain an extra reaction each round that can only be used to @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.onqxEjE7qYDBT6nV]{Counterspell}.

Vitality Web.name: Vitality Web
Vitality Web.description: You can manifest your bond as a web of vital energy between your allies. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.Ooq9AWddIsD71iCi] epiphany spell.

Vlaka Lore.name: Vlaka Lore
Vlaka Lore.description:
You strive to keep the traditions and stories of your people alive, even as you build new communities and forge new alliances. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Diplomacy and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Vlaka Lore.

Void Sight.name: Void Sight
Void Sight.description: You're accustomed to living or working in utter darkness, and your eyes have adjusted to the gloom. You gain greater darkvision.

Warning Spray.name: Warning Spray
Warning Spray.description:
Trigger You roll initiative.

Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

As combat begins, you unleash an undirected snapshot with your weapon, forcing advancing foes to cower on approach. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} with your weapon. Your selected weapon cannot be a grenade or a missile launcher. Creatures in the area take no damage but must still make a save to avoid being @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} or take other effects your area attack would normally impose.

Warp Wounds.name: Warp Wounds
Warp Wounds.description:
Trigger You take damage from an enemy.

Requirements An enemy or willing ally is in your quantum field.

Your reality shifts to partially overlap with another in which someone else was damaged instead of you. You gain resistance to all damage against the triggering attack equal to half your level, and one enemy or willing ally in your quantum field takes damage equal to the amount of damage prevented this way.

Watch Out!.name: Watch Out!
Watch Out!.description:
Trigger A creature targets an ally within 60 feet with an attack, and you can see both the attacker and your ally.

You shout a warning to your ally, granting them a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.UQJIKzYOhfPuxYUi]{Effect: Watch Out!}

Weakening Shot.name: Weakening Shot
Weakening Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You target a creature's limbs or other appendages to weaken them. You Aim, then make a ranged Strike at your mark. If the Strike hits, the creature becomes your choice of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of your next turn (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical hit).

Whirling Swipe.name: Whirling Swipe
Whirling Swipe.description:
Requirements You are wielding a two-handed melee weapon.

You swipe your close combat weapon in a wide swing that leaves behind a deadly arc. Your weapon gains the area (burst 5 feet) and unwieldy traits until the end of the turn. If your weapon has reach, the burst radius becomes the reach of your weapon. Make an attack using @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}, with the burst centered on a corner of your square. You are excluded from the burst. Targets in range take damage as though struck with a melee Strike you make with your weapon, but they must succeed at a basic Reflex save as normal. If you're using a weapon with the backswing or sweep trait, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the save DC of the attack.

If you have the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.class-features.Item.8J94LU3sVZv12P2e]{Primary Target} class feature, the follow-up Strike to a Whirling Swipe is a melee Strike.

White Hat Hack.name: White Hat Hack
White Hat Hack.description:
Trigger You cast a non-cantrip spell that is not modified by @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.EE07CnQmn8Xg4gkd]{Jailbreak Spell}.

Requirements Your gear is overclocked.

You are an expert in testing the cyber defenses of tech gear and bolstering it against incoming damage. You use the magic energy of the last spell you cast to reduce the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd] condition by half the spell's rank (minimum 1) of up to one tech creature or tech item within 100 feet for every rank of the triggering spell. For the next minute, affected targets roll flat checks to recover from the glitching condition twice and take the higher result; this is a fortune effect.

Widen Area.name: Widen Area
Widen Area.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon with the area or automatic trait.

You set up your area weapon to affect more targets. If the next action you use is to make an attack with a weapon that has an area of burst, cone, or line, increase the area of that attack. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Wild Bond.name: Wild Bond
Wild Bond.description: Understanding that all living things are part of the same tapestry of life, you can tap into the universal code of life to radically alter the genes of creatures in your bond. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.3r9Xrt8qqTQbcw26] epiphany spell.

Willful Defiance.name: Willful Defiance
Willful Defiance.description: You loudly proclaim your opposition to a single creature you're aware of within 60 feet. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Armor Class and saving throws against the selected creature's attacks, spells, and other effects for 1 minute. During that time, if you would fail or critically fail a saving throw against the selected creature, you can choose to reroll the failed save. If you do, after rerolling, Willful Defiance ends.

Without a Trace.name: Without a Trace
Without a Trace.description: You are an expert at destroying or removing incriminating evidence from a crime scene. When using the Cover Tracks exploration activity, anyone tracking you must succeed at a Perception check against your Deception, Stealth, or Underworld Lore DC (whichever is highest). If you spent 10 minutes cleaning up a crime scene, anyone investigating the scene must succeed at a Perception check against your Deception, Stealth, or Underworld Lore DC (whichever is highest) to uncover any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} evidence.

Working Artist.name: Working Artist
Working Artist.description: People have noticed the originality and quality of your artistic creations, and you've started moonlighting as a professional artist. You become trained in Crafting or a Lore skill related to art (such as Art Lore or Sculpture Lore). When you succeed or critically succeed on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} using Crafting or a Lore skill related to art, calculate the amount you earn as if you'd attempted a check one level higher.

Wormhole.name: Wormhole
Wormhole.description:
Frequency once per hour

You force a rip in space that acts as a tunnel to a nearby location. Create two wormholes in unoccupied squares that are within 100 feet, visible to you, and at least 15 feet apart. If a creature enters the space of a wormhole, it emerges onto any adjacent space to the other wormhole that the creature desires. If there is no valid space for the creature to enter, then both wormholes collapse and the creature remains in the space where it entered the first wormhole. The wormholes last for 1 round before collapsing, but you can Sustain the wormholes for up to 1 minute. The attuned effects of this ability only apply to your attunement when you create the wormholes.

Graviton-Attuned A creature beginning its turn adjacent to a wormhole must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your class DC or be pulled into the wormhole.

Photon-Attuned A creature entering the wormhole becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until the start of its next turn.

Wriggling Contortionist.name: Wriggling Contortionist
Wriggling Contortionist.description: You can wriggle your way around tight spaces without much difficulty, making it hard for others to pin you down. You can ignore difficult terrain caused by moving through tight spaces that aren't tight enough to force you to Squeeze. If you roll a success to Squeeze, you get a critical success instead. Ignore any penalties to Speeds conferred by the suppressed condition.

Xenoarchaeologist Dedication.name: Xenoarchaeologist Dedication
Xenoarchaeologist Dedication.description:
You become an expert in Society and Thievery and gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Recall Knowledge checks and Delve Lore checks when using Investigate as your exploration activity.

You gain the Additional Lore general feat in Delve Lore, which you can use to Recall Knowledge about sites of archaeological significance, and about ancient history, relics, languages, and peoples. Upon gaining this skill, choose either Intelligence or Wisdom as the key attribute for your Delve Lore checks. This choice is permanent and can't be changed later.

Xenodruid Bond.name: Xenodruid Bond
Xenodruid Bond.description:
You become a member of a primal order that grants you powerful abilities. Choose one of the following xenodruid orders. These orders aren't galactic institutions, though many factions adhere to one or more of them.

You become trained in the listed skill associated with the order and add the listed spells to your spell list and spell repertoire as signature spells. If you were already trained in the listed skill, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice.

Animal Order Skill Animal Lore; Spells 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl], 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp], 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YtesyvfAIwXOqISq]

Elemental Order Skill Elemental Planes Lore; Spells 1st @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.FXIhLIMgi0QDTr3w], 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lpT6LotUaQPfinjj], 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1K6AYGisvo9gqdhs]

Viral Order Skill Medicine; Spells 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zJQnkKEKbJqGB3iB], 2nd @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.cykzPdDC93OkC1IN], 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MlpbeZ61Euhl0d60]

Plant Order Skill Plant Lore; Spells 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jSRAyd57kd4WZ4yE], 2nd @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.kRJg587SmUloc5kN], 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zCcfPS4y5SrZzU2x]

Xenodruid Dedication.name: Xenodruid Dedication
Xenodruid Dedication.description:
You can form a bond with the collective spirit of a world's ecosystems. This is a 10-minute activity that involves communing with nature and meditation. The planet must have an active biosphere. You can only bond with one planet at a time. This counts toward your maximum number of bonds. Planets don't count as creatures nor allies for the purposes of spells, prerequisites, or other abilities, including your vitality network.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Recall Knowledge about your planet's life and natural occurrences. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to subsist in its wilds and a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against environmental hazards and effects naturally found on your bonded planet. When off-world, you always know the general direction your planet lies in relation to you (but not distance), which grants a +1 circumstance bonus to Piloting checks to navigate.

In addition, you can assess the health of your planet once per day and attempt to locate any major disturbances to its ecosystems. Attempt a @Check[nature|dc:20] check while in contact with your planet.

Critical Success You diagnose the planet's health through its various ecospheres. In addition, you can detect specific ongoing disturbances to the natural worldâ€”such as industrial mining or a fire in a particular valley. You can sense the distance and direction of the disturbance and gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against hazards created by this disturbance.

Success As a critical success, but you can only sense disturbances happening on a massive scale (such as hurricanes, volcanic eruptions, or planetwide pollution) and the direction to it.

Failure You diagnose the planet's health but don't identify any disturbances.

Special You can take this feat if you have the mystic multiclass archetype dedication feat even if you haven't taken two additional mystic feats. Mystic archetype feats count as xenodruid feats, and vice-versa, for purposes of completing the archetypes.

You'll Have to Go Through Me!.name: You'll Have to Go Through Me!
You'll Have to Go Through Me!.description: You brace yourself to defend your allies behind you. Make an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire}. Until the start of your next turn, if you would be moved by a forced movement effect, you move 10 feet less. Until the start of your next turn, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.yBkdtiLtKv0yYU8L]{Living Shield} reaction. Using a move action ends this effect.

Ysoki Lore.name: Ysoki Lore
Ysoki Lore.description: Years of experience among ysoki communities have made you nimble, and you've learned to run and hide when enemies threaten. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Ysoki Lore.

Zone Overlap.name: Zone Overlap
Zone Overlap.description:
Requirements Your quantum field is active with one zone affecting it.

You cause a second zone to overlap your quantum field. You can choose to apply another zone you're able to create, or apply the existing zone again, improving its effects as follows: Danger Zone deals 2d6 extra damage, Debris Zone becomes greater difficult terrain, Twisted Dark Zone ignores the temporary immunity of creatures who previously attempted a save for 1 round, and Radiant Zone forces creatures to attempt another saving throw.
